What is cookie? Cookies are small text files that websites often place on computer hard drives of visitors to their sites. They are widely used order to make websites work, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the owners of the site. A cookie contains unique number, which is used to recognize your computer when user of your computer returns to website that it visited previously. We use cookies to enhance the online experience of our visitors, for statistical purposes and to better understand how our sites are used. Cookies may tell us, for example, whether you have visited our websites before or whether you are new visitor. There are two broad categories of cookies: First party cookies, served directly by WABCO to your computer. These cookies are used only by the website operator to recognise your computer when it revisits that site. Third party cookies, served by service provider on behalf of WABCO. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that it has appointed Henry R. Keizer to its board of directors. Mr. Keizer’s appointment take effect today. In addition, he take on the role of Chair of the Audit Committee effective October 1, 2015. Most recently, Mr. Keizer served as Deputy Chairman and Chief Operating Officer of KPMG LLP, one of the world’s largest accounting and professional services firms. Mr. Keizer contributes to WABCO more than 35 years of broad global industry experience gained through advising clients diverse sectors, including finance, manufacturing and technology. During his 35 years at KPMG, Mr. Keizer fulfilled range of senior executive leadership roles, including Global Head of Audit at KPMGI, consortium of more than 100 KPMG firms operating over 140 countries. Mr. Keizer holds bachelor’s degree accounting, summa cum laude, from Montclair State University, New Jersey, U.S.A. “Henry Keizer’s strategic global business acumen and profound financial counsel further strengthen our board as we continue WABCO’s global market outperformance through our proven three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. Kenneth J. Martin, member of WABCO’s board of directors since July 2007 and currently Chair of the Audit Committee, retire on October 1, 2015. “We convey our deep gratitude to Ken Martin for his superb contribution to WABCO’s board over the past eight years, and we wish him all the best for the future,” said Esculier. Press Photo / Caption: WABCO appointed Henry R. Keizer to its board of directors. He has over 35 years of global industry experience gained finance, manufacturing and technology, among other sectors. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . Meritor WABCO Delivers Top Quality Performance of Zero Defects Per 1 Million Parts Produced and Maintains 100 Percent On-Time Delivery TROY, Mich. (July 21, 2015) – Meritor WABCO received the 2014 Excellence Quality Award from Hino Motors Manufacturing U.S.A ., Inc . Meritor WABCO has been recognized with this prestigious award five times the past seven years. Meritor WABCO received the award recognition of achieving perfect zero parts per million (PPM) defect rate during the entire 2014 calendar year. Meritor WABCO supplies Hino with pneumatic and hydraulic anti-lock braking systems (ABS) for commercial vehicles built Williamston, West Virginia and Woodstock, Ontario, Canada. In addition to the zero PPM quality performance for Hino, Meritor WABCO’s on-time delivery performance 100 percent for 2014. “Hino has established strong reputation for rigorous quality standards, and this award recognizes our commitment to go above and beyond for our customer,” said Stephen Hampson, president and general manager for Meritor WABCO. “With our focus on Six Sigma and continuous quality improvement, we are looking to sustain our perfect quality score and 100 percent on-time deliveries.” The award presented to Meritor WABCO at the recent Hino 2015 Annual Business Meeting Plymouth, Michigan. About Hino Hino Trucks, Toyota Group Company, assembles, sells, and services Class 4-7 conventional commercial trucks the United States. The headquarters is located Novi, Michigan and boasts network of over 180 dealers nationwide committed to achieving excellence customer service and support. Hino Trucks is the premier medium duty nameplate the United States with product lineup that offers the lowest total cost of ownership, superior fuel economy, industry-leading environmental friendliness, unmatched reliability and maneuverability, and the most comprehensive bundle of standard features the market. For more information, visit our internet home page at www.hino.com or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube. Hino Motors Manufacturing U.S.A., Inc., Toyota Group Company, assembles Class 6 & 7 Hino brand trucks West Virginia, and builds axles and other components for certain Toyota vehicles Arkansas and California. About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension and control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading parent companies back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100 year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides Meritor WABCO the industry’s most extensive service and support network. Continues to Outperform Volatile and Currently Decreased Global Commercial Vehicle Market; Updates Guidance for 2015 Q2 2015 sales of $661.1 million, up 6.4 percent local currencies and down 10.1 percent U.S. dollars from year ago Q2 2015 operating margin of 13.9 percent on performance basis, up from 13.4 percent year ago; operating margin of 12.2 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 12.3 percent year ago Q2 2015 diluted EPS of $1.40 on performance basis versus $1.42 year ago; diluted EPS of $1.12 on U.S. GAAP basis versus $1.23 year ago In Q2 2015, WABCO generated $78.5 million net cash from operating activities and $56.1 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 79 percent year-to-date of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition Updates guidance for full year 2015 to reflect further adverse foreign exchange effects and market changes: sales growth to now range from 6 to 9 percent versus previous guidance from 5 to 10 percent local currencies; full year 2015 diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.60 to $5.85 versus previous guidance from $5.60 to $6.00; and full year 2015 diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.89 to $5.14 versus previous guidance from $4.86 to $5.26 BRUSSELS, Belgium, July 24, 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today reported Q2 2015 sales of $661.1 million, up 6.4 percent local currencies from year ago and down 10.1 percent U.S. dollars, reflecting significant strengthening of the U.S. dollar year on year. “In Q2 2015, we demonstrated yet again WABCO’s consistent ability to generate sales growth that strongly outperforms the global commercial vehicle market relative to truck and bus production, as we increased sales by 6.4 percent local currencies, despite significant decline of 10 percent new truck and bus builds globally,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “As expected, Q2 2015, North America expanded truck and bus production by 11 percent, and we significantly outperformed this market by increasing WABCO content per vehicle,” said Esculier. “As anticipated, new truck and bus builds accelerated Western Europe where we delivered strong outperformance. However, Western Europe’s further market growth almost fully offset by further decline truck and bus production Russia and other countries the Commonwealth of Independent States.” “Also Q2 2015, truck and bus production declined both China and South America more than we had expected,” said Esculier. “Nonetheless, WABCO outperformed both markets, particularly China, the world’s largest market for commercial vehicles, where we achieved outstanding outperformance of 25 percentage points by continuing to augment WABCO content per vehicle.” WABCO reported Q2 2015 performance operating income of $91.6 million versus $98.2 million year ago, and operating income $80.6 million on U.S. GAAP basis versus $90.4 million year ago. WABCO’s performance operating margin for Q2 2015 13.9 percent, up from 13.4 percent year ago, and operating margin 12.2 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 12.3 percent year ago. For Q2 2015, WABCO reported performance net income attributable to the company of $81.7 million or $1.40 per diluted share versus $86.6 million or $1.42 per diluted share year ago, and Q2 2015 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $65.8 million or $1.12 per diluted share versus $75.0 million or $1.23 per diluted share year ago. “In Q2 2015, we once again demonstrated the agility and adaptability of WABCO’s Operating System, our globally standardized management environment. It continued to enable fast, flexible responses to volatile market changes, while at the same time propelling robust productivity gains,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s Operating System Q2 2015 delivered $17.9 million of materials and conversion productivity. It generated materials productivity of 5.5 percent while achieving conversion productivity of 6.5 percent or $7.2 million our factories spanning 4 continents, new quarterly record amount,” said Esculier. During Q2 2015, WABCO generated $78.5 million net cash from operating activities and $56.1 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 79 percent year-to-date of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition. Since June 2011, WABCO has repurchased 14,653,773 shares for $1,096.1 million open market transactions as of June 30, 2015. WABCO is further authorized to repurchase up to $375.7 million of additional shares through December 31, 2016. “In Q2 2015, we continued to demonstrate our ability to transform top-line growth into solid bottom-line results,” said Esculier. “WABCO achieved healthy incremental operating margin of 15 percent, which delivered on target within our financial operating framework.” Incremental operating margin refers to the ratio of year-on-year increase performance operating income Q2 2015 and WABCO’s growth sales. Recent Highlights In Q2 2015, WABCO entered into development agreement with major original equipment manufacturer headquartered Europe to adopt OptiDrive™ transmission automation systems for the customer’s medium-duty truck driveline. Innovatively engineered flexible modules, WABCO’s industry award-winning OptiDrive technology shortens time-to-market up to 40 percent and reduces development cost by approximately 80 percent, compared with conventional automated manual transmission (AMT) systems. OptiDrive modular AMT technology boosts fuel economy up to 5 percent through optimized gear shifting. In addition, its ease-of-use accelerates driver training and improves driver effectiveness and comfort. Series production is expected to begin late 2016. This development agreement is addition to WABCO’s existing supply of other AMT products for commercial vehicles. Also Q2 2015, WABCO entered into several long-term supply agreements with new customer based China, established major truck maker that is expanding into the heavy-duty truck segment. WABCO’s new incremental business involves air-disc braking systems as well as conventional brake valves, other brake components and clutch servo technology . WABCO support two new and separate platforms for the customer’s different brands of medium- and heavy-duty trucks. Series production is planned to begin by mid-2017 for the Chinese market and expected export to Southeast Asia. WABCO China further differentiated its offering for this customer through highly cost-effective wheel-end solutions specially designed to satisfy local market requirements. WABCO’s North American joint venture Meritor WABCO extended long-term supply agreement Q2 2015 with leading trailer manufacturer headquartered the United States. An existing customer for well over decade, this major trailer maker has designated WABCO’s technology as their preferred standard stability control system on their insulated and refrigerated trailer lines for North America, as of July 2015. Meritor WABCO’s new incremental business involves Roll Stability System (RSS) version 1M, which combines the benefits of anti-lock brake performance and trailer stability control single unit. RSS version 1M is further differentiated through advanced features and technology to continuously monitor trailer’s risk of rollover. In addition, Meritor WABCO currently supplies this customer with entire portfolio of trailer safety and efficiency products. All local commercial vehicle manufacturers India rely on WABCO’s test track located Chennai to homologate their anti-lock braking systems (ABS) for compliance with the national government’s new ABS regulation. India’s ABS mandate comes into effect on October 1, 2015 for trucks weighing more than 12 tons and buses above 5 tons. WABCO’s technology leadership and strong market position India for ABS are further differentiated through its company-owned proving ground, which fully supports truck and bus makers to meet customer and regulatory requirements respectively. It provides optimal conditions to successfully certify all variants of commercial vehicles equipped with WABCO ABS on all road surfaces. In Q2 2015, WABCO’s North American joint venture Meritor WABCO endorsed the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration’s (NHTSA) final rule issued on June 3 requiring electronic stability control (ESC) systems on truck tractors and large buses. According to the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration , rollovers are the fourth most frequent cause of fatal accidents involving large trucks. NHTSA is projecting that its new ruling prevent as many as 1,759 crashes, 649 injuries and 49 fatalities each year, providing the trucking industry with annual net economic benefits of more than $300 million on $45 million investment by fleet owners to comply with the ruling. In 2003, Meritor WABCO first-to-market the U.S. with its SmartTrac™ stability control system . Today, 262,000 vehicles more than 220 fleets are equipped with SmartTrac technology. Commercial vehicle fleets equipped with SmartTrac report reduction of up to 60 percent for rollover and loss-of-control accidents. WABCO’s North American joint venture Meritor WABCO announced its support Q2 2015 for two new recommendations by the U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) . The NTSB has recommended requiring vehicle manufacturers to install forward collision avoidance systems as standard equipment on all new vehicles. The NTSB has recommended installing autonomous emergency braking systems following published performance standards for such equipment by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). Meritor WABCO currently supplies OnGuard™ , the leading collision mitigation system for commercial vehicles North America. With more than 80,000 units installed, 27 billion road miles of service and reorder rate of virtually 100 percent, fleets increasingly welcome this system’s improvements road safety and operating efficiency. Recently, WABCO introduced its enhanced version of OnGuard – branded OnGuardACTIVE™ – for trucks and buses North America. OnGuardACTIVE, WABCO’s most advanced collision mitigation system, features superior radar, operates effectively all seasons and delivers better performance poor visibility driving conditions. Recently, WABCO’s North American joint venture Meritor WABCO received award for excellence quality from Hino Motors Manufacturing U.S.A. It represents top recognition for superlative quality performance of zero defects per one-million-parts produced and for maintaining 100 percent on-time delivery throughout 2014. It marks the fifth time the past seven years that this major customer has honored Meritor WABCO with this prestigious award. Meritor WABCO supplies Hino with pneumatic and hydraulic anti-lock braking systems (ABS) for commercial vehicles built Williamston, West Virginia, U.S.A., and Woodstock, Ontario, Canada. WABCO Updates Full Year 2015 Guidance “Based on our current estimates of future market conditions – mainly recognizing further adverse foreign exchange effects year on year as well as continued weakening of new truck and bus production China, South America and Russia – we believe it is timely to tighten WABCO’s previously disclosed guidance for full year 2015,” said Esculier. WABCO expects full year 2015 sales growth to now range from 6 to 9 percent versus previous guidance from 5 to 10 percent local currencies. WABCO expects its performance operating margin to now range from 14.0 to 14.5 percent versus previous guidance from 14.2 to 15.1 percent and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from 12.9 to 13.4 percent versus previous guidance from 13.0 to 13.9 percent. WABCO expects its diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.60 to $5.85 versus previous guidance from $5.60 to $6.00 and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.89 to $5.14 versus previous guidance from $4.86 to $5.26. In addition, WABCO reiterates that it expects 2015 to convert between 80 and 90 percent of its performance net income attributable to the company into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with items for streamlining. “This updated guidance still reflects WABCO’s continuous and robust global outperformance of markets, while generating solid incremental operating margin consistent with our financial operating framework and at the same time delivering healthy free cash-flow conversion,” said Esculier. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . OnGuardACTIVE™ - An active safety system that helps prevent accidents by warning drivers of potential rear-end collisions, and even intervenes if needed. OnLane™ - With many distractions on the road, this lane departure warning system uses camera technology to help keep drivers on the right track. OptiPace™ - WABCO‘s predictive economic cruise control offers fuel saving potential by adjusting vehicle speed to undulating road topography. TailGUARD™ for Truck & Bus - WABCO's new blind spot detection solution for your truck and bus. Foundation Brakes The most demanding heavy truck, bus and off-highway applications require air brake components with the best stopping credentials. WABCO's MAXX range is game-changing generation of high performance, single-piston air disc brakes that further improve vehicle safety and efficiency. MAXX™ 22 Air Disc Brake - The industry’s lightest and highest performing single-piston air disc brake designed for heavy duty commercial vehicles. MAXX™ 19 Air Disc Brake - Engineered for medium duty vehicles. Maintenance costs can be reduced thanks to exchangeable wear sensor technology. MAXX™ 17 Air Disc Brake - A top performer for 17.5 inch wheels that boosts braking performance and offers choice of wear sensor technologies. MAXXUS™ Air Disc Brake - High-performance brake power from Medium to Severe Duty significantly reduces stopping distance of North American commercial vehicles. WABCO EasyFit™ - An automatic slack adjuster that ensures the correct transmission of power from the actuator to the drum brake S-camshaft. Actuators These are the real heroes of the air brake world – transforming compressed power into mechanical action. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that it has appointed Jon Morrison President for its Americas Business Unit. Morrison is 30-year veteran of the global transportation industry. “I’m honored to take on the role of WABCO President for the Americas,” Morrison said. “These are exciting times the commercial vehicle industry and I look forward to advancing WABCO’s success as preferred supplier of technologies that further improve the safety and efficiency of trucks, buses and trailers across North and South America. WABCO is recognized for delivering differentiation and value to our customers every day. I’m committed to continuing that focus and leveraging our market leadership to further our growth these key markets through technology innovation and excellence execution.” Prior to his current role, Morrison served as President, North America for American Axle & Manufacturing, and before that he held the position of Vice President, Vehicle Dynamics and Controls with WABCO. From 2006 to 2014, Morrison served as President and General Manager of Meritor WABCO, North American joint venture between WABCO and Meritor that markets and sells advanced safety technology and efficiency components. Morrison is based at WABCO’s regional headquarters for North America Rochester Hills, Michigan, and oversees all planning, finance, sales, marketing, engineering, product development and manufacturing activities. In North America, WABCO is recognized as industry leader advanced vehicle control and braking systems, including collision mitigation systems. Meritor WABCO has sold more than 80,000 OnGuard™ collision mitigation systems the U.S. alone, having protected customers collectively for more than 27 billion miles. Recently, WABCO introduced its enhanced version of OnGuard – branded OnGuardACTIVE™ – for trucks and buses North America. It features superior radar, operates effectively all seasons and delivers better performance poor visibility driving conditions. Morrison takes active role to support industry associations and organizations. He is currently member of the Heavy Duty Manufacturers Association (HDMA) and its Heavy Duty Business Forum. He is former member of the University of Michigan Transportation Research Institute (UMTRI) External Advisory Board, as well as the Intelligent Transportation Society of America (ITSA) Board of Directors and Leadership Circle. He holds Bachelor’s degree General Management from Purdue University West Lafayette, Indiana, and Master’s degree Business Administration from Bowling Green State University Bowling Green, Ohio. Press Photo / Caption: WABCO has appointed Jon Morrison President for its Americas Business Unit. Morrison is 30-year veteran of the global transportation industry. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . Code of Conduct Conflicts Mineral Policy WABCO Supplier Portal WABCO Supplier Score Card Conflict Minerals Policy WABCO is committed to responsible sourcing and supports the humanitarian objective of ending ongoing violence funded by the trade of conflict minerals from the eastern portion of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and surrounding countries (“Conflict Region”). WABCO fully supports U.S.legislation on the supply of conflict minerals, including the rules adopted by Securities Exchange Commission. Conflict minerals include gold, tin, tantalum and tungsten. The U.S Secretary of State may designate other minerals the future. WABCO’S COMMITMENT WABCO endorses the objectives of the U.S. legislation to address the trade of conflict minerals. WABCO not knowingly procure minerals from the Conflict Region unless they are certified as conflict free by independent third party. WABCO is committed to complying with the due diligence requirements to determine the source of conflict minerals used within its products and expects its suppliers to assist with this task. WABCO’S EXPECTATIONS WABCO expects all of its suppliers to comply with the WABCO Master Supply Agreement Terms and Conditions relating to conflict minerals and to carry out sufficient due diligence to ensure that their supply chain is conflict free. The aim is to ensure that only “conflict free” materials and components are used products that we procure. As leading global supplier of commercial vehicle technologies, WABCO is committed to ensuring social responsibility our supply chain and helping to prevent the trade of conflict minerals which finance or benefit armed groups the conflict region. Code of Conduct Conflicts Mineral Policy WABCO Supplier Portal WABCO Supplier Score Card Conflict Minerals Policy WABCO is committed to responsible sourcing and supports the humanitarian objective of ending ongoing violence funded by the trade of conflict minerals from the eastern portion of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and surrounding countries (“Conflict Region”). WABCO fully supports U.S.legislation on the supply of conflict minerals, including the rules adopted by Securities Exchange Commission. Conflict minerals include gold, tin, tantalum and tungsten. The U.S Secretary of State may designate other minerals the future. WABCO’S COMMITMENT WABCO endorses the objectives of the U.S. legislation to address the trade of conflict minerals. WABCO not knowingly procure minerals from the Conflict Region unless they are certified as conflict free by independent third party. WABCO is committed to complying with the due diligence requirements to determine the source of conflict minerals used within its products and expects its suppliers to assist with this task. WABCO’S EXPECTATIONS WABCO expects all of its suppliers to comply with the WABCO Master Supply Agreement Terms and Conditions relating to conflict minerals and to carry out sufficient due diligence to ensure that their supply chain is conflict free. The aim is to ensure that only “conflict free” materials and components are used products that we procure. As leading global supplier of commercial vehicle technologies, WABCO is committed to ensuring social responsibility our supply chain and helping to prevent the trade of conflict minerals which finance or benefit armed groups the conflict region. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, announced that WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jacques Esculier deliver keynote presentation today about doing business as market leading supplier India at IAA Commercial Vehicles 2010 Hanover, Germany. “With more than 40 years of local experience, WABCO is deeply rooted, award-winning supplier to manufacturers of trucks and buses India, and we are passionate about continuing our market leadership this rapidly evolving market,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “WABCO is proud to contribute to ‘IAA India Day’ by sharing our response to this emerging global market opportunity.” The keynote address about India by WABCO Chairman and CEO Jacques Esculier at IAA 2010 is scheduled today from 1:30 p.m. to 1:50 p.m. the Convention Center. WABCO at IAA 2010 Hall 17 at Stand A20 Visit WABCO through September 30 at Hanover Exhibition Center Hanover, Germany. Live Demonstrations at IAA Innovation Stage WABCO trucks equipped with innovative driver assistance systems be featured daily live demonstrations at the IAA Innovation Stage (outdoor area, north of Hall 26). Keynote about China by WABCO Chairman and CEO WABCO Chairman and CEO Jacques Esculier address challenges and opportunities China on September 29 from 12:00 p.m. to 12:30 p.m. the Convention Center. About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $1.5 billion 2009, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO India has won the 2010 India Manufacturing Excellence Award (IMEA) with Super Platinum distinction. It marks the third year that WABCO’s site Chennai has been awarded IMEA platinum certification, resulting IMEA Consistency Award to recognize the site’s honors 2007, 2009 and 2010. The Economic Times (ET)-India Manufacturing Excellence Awards partnership with Frost & Sullivan is India’s largest on-site assessment of manufacturing practices benchmarked against global standards. At recent ceremony Mumbai, the jury of ET and Frost & Sullivan experts named the WABCO manufacturing facility Chennai as IMEA 2010 Super Platinum recognition of the site’s highest score among all other awardees 2010. IMEA’s assessment comprises 12 categories of manufacturing practices, including customer focus, supply chain management and quality systems, among other operational and business measurements. All award submissions are evaluated by global consulting firm Frost & Sullivan whose expert team conducts further assessment during site audit among short list of candidates. “Everyone at WABCO India is proud, once again, to be selected for this outstanding national award, particularly because the Economic Times partnership with Frost & Sullivan recognizes that our Chennai site continuously achieves and sustains manufacturing excellence,” said P. Kaniappan, Managing Director, WABCO India. “We are delighted that the judges have honored us with their IMEA Consistency Award as we are now platinum certified for three years, further showing our world class success.” “WABCO takes great pride India for winning the highest possible award this internationally acclaimed industry assessment,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “The Economic Times and Frost & Sullivan’s judges look for diligence, perseverance, foresight, and dedication to sustain successful lean manufacturing and continuous learning. Our facility Chennai has accomplished yet another superlative achievement, gaining further recognition of its superb manufacturing capabilities as it continues to demonstrate its global competitiveness.” In 2009, addition to being named IMEA Super Platinum, WABCO India honored with the Gold Award for Manufacturing Excellence from the Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India, leading industry group. The company previously won Deming Prize for total quality management, the first awarded to company India; Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) Excellence Award from the Japan Institute of Plant Maintenance; and Japan Quality Medal, the first awarded to company India. With sales of $1.5 billion 2009, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Tata Motors recognizes WABCO as Braking Technology Partner Bosch India and WABCO INDIA organize ‘SAFETY DRIVE’ symposium to promote vehicle safety WABCO India Consolidates its Brand Under the WABCO Name WABCO INDIA LIMITED Wins Two Excellence awards from TATA Motors, India’s Largest Manufacturer of Commercial Vehicles WABCO–TVS (INDIA) Limited TO BE RENAMED AS 'WABCO INDIA LIMITED' WABCO India Factory Chennai Wins India’s Two Top Awards for Manufacturing Excellence WABCO CEO Esculier Delivers Keynote Address About Sustaining Success as Premier Supplier India at IAA Commercial Vehicles 2010 WABCO–TVS (INDIA) Limited TO BE RENAMED AS ‘WABCO INDIA LIMITED’ Chennai – India – August 3, 2011 : WABCO–TVS (INDIA) Limited has today announced its name change from WABCO-TVS (INDIA) Limited to WABCO INDIA LIMITED. It is line with agreement entered with Sundaram-Clayton Limited, after the acquisition of the equity shares by Clayton Dewandre Holdings Ltd from TVS group, who have the approval from the shareholders as well as the Registrar of Companies (ROC) India to proceed with the new name. WABCO Holdings Inc., global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, acquired majority ownership WABCO–TVS (INDIA) Limited 2009 thereby strengthening WABCO’s presence India. After the acquisition, WABCO allowed until June’12 to use the TVS trademark sales, marketing and distribution of products. WABCO now run its India operations under the WABCO INDIA brand name. “We are proud of our TVS heritage as it has helped us to build strong relationships with customers across India for over 40 years,” said Mr. P. Kaniappan, Whole–time Director, WABCO INDIA LIMITED . “We are passionate about contributing to WABCO’s continued global success through our unique engineering capabilities, broad range of technologies, network of local suppliers, and more than 7,000 distribution outlets nationally for product support and other aftermarket services.” “A well-anchored market leader, WABCO INDIA is highly awarded by customers for quality and innovation while internationally recognized for world class manufacturing,” said Mr. Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer . “WABCO INDIA is committed to sustaining its success as premier supplier, and continue to localize new technologies while setting new global standards for service levels and further enhancing its knowledge of new technologies within its extensive product support network.” WABCO INDIA designs, manufactures and markets conventional braking products, advanced braking systems and other related air-assisted technologies, systems and products for commercial vehicles. It directly serves customers locally and through WABCO internationally. WABCO INDIA currently has three world class factories India - Ambattur, Chennai; Mahindra World City, Chennai; and Jamshedpur. It has over 1,100 employees and reported sales of Rs.899 crores 2010-11. Tata Motors recognizes WABCO as Braking Technology Partner NEW DELHI, India – March 22, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier of safety and efficiency systems to the commercial vehicle industry, demonstrate its industry leading safety and efficiency technologies at India’s first-ever T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship. Tata Motors has recognized WABCO as its Braking Technology Partner and host the race on March 23, 2014 at the acclaimed Buddh International Formula 1 Circuit Greater Noida. Overall, six truck racing teams compete the T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship showcasing twelve of Tata Motors’ state-of-the-art PRIMA Model 4038.S trucks All of the specially customized race vehicles feature number of safety and efficiency technologies drawn from WABCO’s extensive global portfolio. “As the local market leader for commercial vehicle safety and control technologies, WABCO is honored to sponsor Tata Motors’ T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship as its official Braking Technology Partner. We are excited to showcase the high performance of our advanced braking systems racing environment, which represents the most extreme conditions for heavy duty trucks,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “The fifty years of experience we have gained from innovating safety and vehicle control systems here India means that WABCO technologies are helping to protect drivers not just on the race track, but the hundreds of thousands of trucks and buses on India’s roads every day.” Each race truck is equipped with fully integrated compressed air system that includes WABCO’s high-performance Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) alongside high-output compressor technology, advanced air processing systems and braking components. WABCO the first company to introduce Anti-lock Braking Systems (ABS) to the commercial vehicle industry and today has sold more than eight million systems globally. ABS enhances the stability and steerability of vehicles even the most extreme braking events. WABCO combines its world-class braking components with advanced controls systems to improve the response time and reduce the braking distance of vehicles. In addition, WABCO’s innovative high-output compressor technologies and air processing systems improve the efficiency of vehicles by lowering their weight and fuel consumption. WABCO’s vision is to help significantly reduce the number of commercial vehicle accidents worldwide. In 2012 study, India’s Ministry of Road Transport and Highways attributed 77 percent of road accidents to drivers losing control over their vehicles. WABCO’s innovative technologies such as Anti-Lock Braking, ESCsmart TM roll stability control , OptiDrive™ automated manual transmission and OnGuard TM collision mitigation are widely recognized by commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators for their ability to improve driver effectiveness and road safety. Over the past five years, WABCO has helped to improve the safety of 25,000 petroleum and hazardous goods carriers India alone by fitting them with the company’s robust Anti-Lock Braking System. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.5billion 2012, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com About WABCO INDIA WABCO INDIA has five world-class manufacturing sites located Ambattur, Chennai; Jamshedpur; Mahindra World City; Pant Nagar and Lucknow as well as software development centre and company-owned test track Chennai. WABCO INDIA excels engineering, manufacturing and local sourcing. It designs, manufactures and markets conventional braking products, advanced braking systems, and other related air-assisted products and systems. WABCO INDIA has achieved major market share the Indian OEM market as well as the domestic aftermarket, which it serves through extensive national distribution network. WABCO INDIA employs more than 1,100 employees and reported Rs. 976 Crs sales its fiscal year 2012-13. WABCO’s AMT Technology OptiDrive Increases Fuel Economy, Improves Driver Effectiveness and Vehicle Safety OptiDrive™ automated manual transmission (AMT) technology combines comfort and ease-of-use of automatic transmission with the efficiency of manual transmission Increases fuel economy up to 5% for trucks and buses; trials conducted India, two fleets claim average fuel savings up to 8% on buses fitted with WABCO’s AMT OptiDrive system Industry award-winning OptiDrive, breakthrough AMT technology, is superbly engineered as modular system. It reduces by 50 percent the development time required for vehicle and transmission makers to apply OptiDrive to their platforms WABCO’s AMT technology addresses issues associated with the shortage of qualified drivers India. It reduces driver stress and fatigue, improving driver effectiveness; it frees drivers from frequent gear shifting and improves vehicle control and road safety. These benefits comfort even inexperienced drivers to operate with confidence and ease of use CHENNAI, India, May 21, 2014 – WABCO, leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today at its test track Chennai, India, demonstrated its OptiDrive system, advanced automated manual transmission (AMT) technology for trucks and buses. WABCO’s AMT systems are available from 5- to 16-speed applications, including its breakthrough OptiDrive modular AMT system. “WABCO expects to satisfy growing market demand and to expand its base of customers for AMT systems India, which currently includes original equipment manufacturers and fleets,” said P. Kaniappan, Managing Director, WABCO India. “WABCO has been working on AMT programs India with major commercial vehicle manufacturers for their respective truck and bus platforms, and we believe our industry India could benefit greatly from adopting this technology more broadly.” WABCO’s OptiDrive technology automatically engages the vehicle’s clutch and gear shift actuation. It takes into account the driver’s operation, engine torque, vehicle load and road inclination, resulting optimized gear shifting, which increases fuel economy up to 5 percent for trucks and buses congested city traffic and on long hauls alike. WABCO’s AMT systems free drivers from frequent shifting, reducing their stress and fatigue, while allowing drivers to further concentrate on traffic conditions. Optimized gear shifting improves driver effectiveness, particularly among less experienced drivers, and it enables more and better qualified drivers. “OptiDrive shows WABCO’s technology leadership automated manual transmissions as it continues to gain acceptance globally among makers of trucks, buses and transmissions, particularly Asia and North America,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia. “WABCO pioneered our industry’s first AMT system 1986 Europe where today more than 60 percent of trucks adopt AMT solutions, and WABCO is further differentiated as we still remain our industry’s only independent supplier of compressed air-powered AMT systems.” In addition, WABCO’s AMT solutions reduce wear on transmission components, lowering maintenance costs over the vehicle’s lifetime. Optimized gear-shifting reduces emissions, resulting environmentally cleaner footprint for fleets. WABCO has sold more than 2 million AMT systems worldwide since its introduction. Recently, WABCO has partnered with number of major commercial fleet operators India, to newly develop as well as retrofit AMT solutions, including trials on buses. For example, VRL Logistics, one of India’s leading transport companies, tested WABCO’s OptiDrive system for six months on two buses. “Our bus drivers report more comfort as there is no gear shifting and test findings indicate fuel savings from 5 to 8 percent,” said L. Ramanand Bhat, Chief Technical Officer at VRL Logistics. “Our drivers prefer vehicles with AMT as it reduces their stress and fatigue, and based on our satisfactory experience, we have further adopted WABCO’s AMT systems as original equipment fitment and retro-fitment for large number of our trucks and buses.” About WABCO INDIA WABCO India designs, manufactures and markets conventional braking products, advanced braking systems, and other related air-assisted products and systems. The company has achieved major market share the Indian OEM market as well as the domestic aftermarket, which WABCO serves through strong and wide national distribution network. With five world-class manufacturing facilities, two application engineering centers and test track India, WABCO India excels engineering and manufacturing. WABCO India employs over 2,900 employees and reported Rs. 979Crs sales 2012-13. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. Lucknow Plant to Supply Advanced Braking Technologies to Major Truck Manufacturers LUCKNOW, India, September 3, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, inaugurated today its fifth manufacturing facility India, located Lucknow. WABCO’s extended network India helps both local and global commercial vehicle manufacturers to further grow their domestic and export business. WABCO’s latest plant inauguration demonstrates the company’s continued ability to anticipate and align with the requirements of its customers India through the supply of just-in-time, first-rate engineered, locally adapted safety and efficiency technologies for trucks and buses built India. At Lucknow, WABCO manufacture advanced technologies, including anti-lock braking systems (ABS) , actuators and range of braking valves for multiple global commercial vehicle makers operating India. WABCO’s new plant Lucknow expands the company’s world-class manufacturing capacity India beyond its four existing plants: two Chennai, one Jamshedpur and another Pantnagar. The company’s new 11-acre (40,500 sq. meters) facility provides employment for around 150 people to-date. WABCO expects to employ estimated 300 persons when this factory reaches its full production capacity by the end of 2015. “Our new factory Lucknow enables WABCO to further strengthen its partnership with commercial vehicle manufacturers operating India while further enhancing the leading market position of WABCO INDIA,” said Mr. Jacques Esculier , WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “This plant marks yet another milestone the successful expansion of WABCO’s manufacturing network India and worldwide. It is another industry-leading example of the lean manufacturing system which further differentiates WABCO globally.” “As strategic Tier 1 supplier, WABCO continues to support Tata Motors the development and delivery of world-class, innovative technologies that help improve the safety and efficiency of Tata trucks and buses on India’s roads,” said Mr. Rajnish Julka , Plant Head - Lucknow, Tata Motors Limited, at the inauguration ceremony. “WABCO’s outstanding performance product quality and excellence execution continues to contribute to enduring partnership that now spans five decades.” “WABCO’s continuous investment local engineering and manufacturing capabilities demonstrates our long-standing commitment to anticipate and fulfill the diverse and dynamic needs of truck and bus manufacturers India, while continually delivering products and services that meet or exceed world-class standards of quality,” said Mr. P. Kaniappan , Vice President, WABCO INDIA. Pictured here (from left to right): Mr. Rajnish Julka, Plant Head- Lucknow, Tata Motors Limited; Jacques Esculier, Chairman and CEO, WABCO; P. Kaniappan, Vice President , WABCO INDIA; Leon Liu, President, Truck, Bus and Car OEMs Division, WABCO; Mr. Vijeyandra Pandian, Indian Administrative Service and Additional Managing Director, Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation. Award-Winning Intelligent Trailer Program Provides Breakthrough Innovations to Improve Safety, Efficiency and Total Cost of Transportation BRUSSELS, Belgium / LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, March 22, 2012 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, is showcasing its award-winning Intelligent Trailer Program at the 2012 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS) Louisville, Kentucky, through March 24. WABCO’s program is the industry’s most innovative, comprehensive and modular solution to address critical needs of fleets to improve trailer safety and efficiency, increase driver effectiveness, and enhance the capabilities of fleet managers to reduce total cost of transportation. Enabled by several breakthrough technologies, WABCO’s Intelligent Trailer Program combines major functions to improve vehicle safety and efficiency into single integrated program for all types of trailers globally. Functions can be used separately or combination, allowing trailer builders and fleet operators to select those functions most relevant for their particular needs through the most cost-effective solution. “WABCO’s Intelligent Trailer Program is the industry’s only complete program that optimizes return on investment for fleets and drivers by reducing vehicle and trailer downtime, lowering costs, improving driver comfort, and enhancing vehicle safety and efficiency,” said Nikhil Varty, WABCO Vice President, Americas. “Driven by our passion for innovation, we continue to help customers to quantify utilization of their assets, thus enabling transport professionals to better assess future investments.” The program offers 25 functions to customers many regions worldwide. Vehicle manufacturers can customize additional functions to meet individual operational and maintenance needs. In North America, currently offered functions include: Emergency Brake Alert – It flashes the trailer’s stop lights during hard braking to warn trailing drivers and reduce the risk of rear-end collisions. Rollover Stability Support – A special system assesses data such as load, wheel speed and transverse acceleration. The trailer automatically brakes as necessary. Finisher Brake – It helps avoid damage and spillage of asphalt while unloading tippers during road construction. Overload Warning – It allows maximum trailer load and alerts the driver case of overload. Tire Pressure Monitoring (IVTM) – Using external wheel-mounted sensors, the system warns drivers real-time when tires are deflating or under-pressurized. More about Intelligent Trailer Program at: http://www.wabco-auto.com/en/intelligenttrailer WABCO Breakthroughs As the technology leader the global commercial vehicle industry, WABCO’s breakthroughs include, among other vehicle safety and efficiency technologies, the first autonomous emergency braking system (AEBS) , the first collision mitigation system (CMS) with active braking, and the first electronic stability control (ESC) system . WABCO pioneered the industry’s first electronic braking system (EBS) , the first electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) , the first automated manual transmission (AMT) system , the first anti-lock braking system (ABS) , and the first high performance single-piston air disc brakes . Founded the United States 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO is U.S. public company listed on the New York Stock Exchange. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.8 billion 2011, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Latest Aerodynamic Product Enables Trailer Manufacturers and Fleets Europe to Improve Fuel Economy and Operational Efficiency BRUSSELS, Belgium and HANOVER, Germany, September 23, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE:WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, debuted its innovative OptiFlow™ Tail solution today at IAA Commercial Vehicles 2014 Hanover, Germany. WABCO’s proven aerodynamic product helps to improve the fuel economy and operational efficiency of trailers throughout Europe. WABCO’s new OptiFlow Tail features innovative modular design of four folding panels that significantly improves air flow at the trailer’s rear. Specifically engineered for trailers Europe, OptiFlow Tail’s durable panels are mounted directly on the trailer’s swing doors, allowing for the doors to fully open. OptiFlow Tail’s modular system utilizes fast and easy-to-use folding and unfolding mechanism. WABCO’s latest aerodynamic product be available for new trailers and as retrofit option for trailers already operation. “Today’s launch of OptiFlow Tail demonstrates our continued technology leadership to improve the efficiency of trailers for manufacturers, fleet operators and transport companies throughout Europe,” said Nick Rens, President, Trailer Systems, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division. ”Proven on the test track, OptiFlow Tail helps to increase the fuel economy of tractor-trailer combinations by up to 3.5 percent at highway speeds.” OptiFlow Tail further expands the company’s portfolio of efficiency-enhancing products for tractor-trailer combinations. It builds on the gained experience through WABCO’s OptiFlow SideWings, unique patented flow-conductor that is specially contoured to optimize the airflow around and underneath the trailer, reducing air resistance. Made of robust yet lightweight material, OptiFlow SideWings has proven on test tracks and on the road to increase fuel economy by up to 5 percent at highway speeds. M Installing both OptiFlow Tail and SideWings on tractor-trailer combinations, WABCO anticipates potential fuel savings by up to 7 percent at highway speeds. Both aerodynamic OptiFlow products are part of the company’s award-winning Intelligent Trailer Program . New OptiPace System Expands WABCO’s Industry-Leading Advanced Driver Assistance Portfolio BRUSSELS, Belgium and HANOVER, Germany, September 23, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE:WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today introduced OptiPace™ technology, predictive economic cruise control system for trucks and buses, at IAA Commercial Vehicles 2014 Hanover, Germany. WABCO’s OptiPace system marks the company’s newest addition to its industry-leading portfolio of advanced driver assistance systems. WABCO’s breakthrough OptiPace system uses on-board digital map technology and proprietary algorithms to anticipate and adapt the vehicle’s most economic speed based on the road topography ahead. For instance, it helps drivers and fleets to achieve highly economical vehicle operation up and down slopes, which offers potential for fuel savings. It reduces wear-and-tear on brake wear, offering another cost saving for operators. “OptiPace marks another level of differentiation for WABCO vehicle safety and efficiency technologies. Alongside considerable potential for fuel savings, this advanced driver assistance system contributes to greener world through lower vehicle emissions,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Truck, Bus & Car Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) Division. “In new long-term supply agreement, major commercial vehicle manufacturer has already adopted our OptiPace system for series production expected to begin 2016, further demonstrating WABCO’s unmatched ability to anticipate the safety and efficiency needs for tomorrow’s commercial vehicles different regions of the world,” said Liu. WABCO’s new OptiPace system represents the first series of predictive cruise control innovations, which allow for additional combined safety and efficiency functionalities such as optimization of the vehicle’s speed based on road curves ahead, automatic compliance with speed limits and integration with WABCO’s adaptive cruise control (ACC). WABCO continues to address increasing demand from commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators worldwide to help produce trucks, buses and trailers that are safer and more cost-efficient. WABCO’s industry-leading portfolio of advanced driver assistance systems helps to increase vehicle safety and driver effectiveness through technologies such as: Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) maintains stable and safe distance to the vehicle the same lane ahead. OnGuard™ collision mitigation system (CMS) with active partial braking helps to mitigate rear-end collisions involving moving or stopping vehicles the same lane ahead. OnGuardPLUS™ advanced emergency braking system (AEBS) detects moving, decelerating and stationary vehicles the same lane ahead. It alerts the driver via acoustic, visual and haptic signals. It autonomously applies full braking against moving and decelerating vehicles ahead, and autonomously applies partial braking against stationary vehicles ahead. OnGuardPLUS can bring the vehicle to complete stop, helping to prevent or mitigate rear-end collisions. OnGuardMAX™ advanced emergency braking system (AEBS) detects moving, decelerating and stationary vehicles the same lane ahead. It alerts the driver via acoustic, visual and haptic signals. It autonomously applies full braking against moving, decelerating and stationary vehicles ahead. OnGuardMAX can bring the vehicle to complete stop, helping to prevent or mitigate rear-end collisions. OnLane™ camera-based lane departure warning system (LDWS) features the new optional functionality of driver drowsiness alert. TailGUARD™ advanced driver assistance system for trucks, buses and trailers combines the functions of rear blind-spot monitoring and automatic braking. OptiPace™ predictive economic cruise control automatically optimizes the vehicle’s speed by anticipating the road topography ahead. WABCO is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Taking place on February 5-6, 2013 at WABCO’s proving ground and test track Chennai, the symposium serve as platform for industry bodies, OEMs and media to examine and deliberate on the present state of vehicle safety India. The symposium thus aims at highlighting available technologies and solutions to improve vehicle and road safety India. Present state of global road accident fatalities According to the United Nations (UN), worldwide 1.3 million people traffic accidents each year, and 50 million are injured. Within ten years, the number of annual road deaths could rise to 1.9 million – nearly 50 percent rise. This is driven mainly by the rapid growth road traffic the emerging countries. The UN has thus announced 2011-2020 as the ‘Decade of Action for Road Safety’ with the objective to reduce the forecasted number of road deaths by 50%. One of the five pillars that the UN has described for this project is ‘Safer Vehicles’. This entails universal deployment of crash avoidance and mitigation technologies, such as the Electronic Stability Program (ESP®) Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) and Electronic Stability Control (ESC) commercial vehicles, cars and motorcycles. Road accident fatalities India According to the latest Road Transport ministry report India, with one road accident every minute 2011 that claimed one life every 3.7 minutes, perhaps has the highest road fatality rate the world. The need to tackle this issue expeditiously couldn’t have been more pronounced. Keeping view the urgency to address this problem, Bosch and WABCO being two of the major providers of vehicle safety solutions to the market, have taken the initiative to collaborate with the automobile industry to discuss possible measures this direction. An initiative towards vehicle safety awareness Commenting on the event, Mr. Balasubramanian, Deputy Managing Director Bosch Chassis Systems India Limited said, “The ‘Safety Drive’ symposium is initiative to garner the collective effort of all stakeholders who support the cause of improved vehicle safety India. As company dedicated to developing technology that is ‘invented for life’ it is imperative that Bosch contributes towards making vehicles safer. It is crucial that critical safety features become mandatory aspect of any vehicle that plies on Indian roads. The problems and fatalities on Indian roads are very real and it is imperative that we use available technology and global best practices to make our vehicles safer. And this endeavour we look forward the support of OEMs, the government, industry players and the end users themselves.” Reinforcing WABCO’s commitment to advance safety and driver effectiveness commercial vehicles, Mr. P. Kaniappan, Whole-Time Director, WABCO INDIA said, “Alongside the rapid growth traffic volumes and transportation routes throughout India, we are facing alarming growth the number and severity of road accidents. Partnering on this ‘Safety Drive’ initiative with Bosch offers WABCO powerful platform to highlight the positive and proven impact of established commercial vehicle safety technologies, including ABS (Anti-Lock Braking System) and ESC (Electronic Stability Control), which have the potential to significantly reduce the number of accidents on India’s roads. Participation of international experts “The ‘Safety Drive’ Symposium see the participation of international experts. David Ward, Director General of the FIA Foundation for the Automobile and Society, UK registered charity that promotes road safety, and sustainable mobility speak on the topic of “The Decade of Action for Road Safety-Global Plan”, Mr. Thomas Lich from Bosch Corporate Research present on Accident Research India, while Dr. Christian Wiehen, Chief Technology Officer, WABCO speak on the topic of “Improving Road Safety India with Commercial Vehicle Control Systems”. Symposium guests include Prince Michael of Kent (first cousin to Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II) patron of the Global Road Safety Commission and Mr. B. Bhanot Chairman TEDC (BIS) – major authority formulation and implementation of safety and emission regulations the country. About Bosch The Bosch Group is leading global supplier of technology and services, active the fields of automotive technology, energy and building technology, industrial technology, and consumer goods. According to preliminary figures, more than 306,000 associates generated sales of 52.3 billion euros 2012. The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its more than 350 subsidiaries and regional companies some 60 countries. If its sales and service partners are included, then Bosch is represented roughly 150 countries. This worldwide development, manufacturing, and sales network is the foundation for further growth. Bosch spent some 4.5 billion euros for research and development 2012, and applied for over 4,700 patents worldwide. The Bosch Group’s products and services are designed to fascinate, and to improve the quality of life by providing solutions which are both innovative and beneficial. In this way, the company offers technology worldwide that is “Invented for life. The company set up Stuttgart 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) as “Workshop for Precision Mechanics and Electrical Engineering.” The special ownership structure of Robert Bosch GmbH guarantees the entrepreneurial freedom of the Bosch Group, making it possible for the company to plan over the long term and to undertake significant up-front investments the safeguarding of its future. Ninety-two percent of the share capital of Robert Bosch GmbH is held by Robert Bosch Stiftung GmbH, charitable foundation. The majority of voting rights are held by Robert Bosch Industrietreuhand KG, industrial trust. The entrepreneurial ownership functions are carried out by the trust. The remaining shares are held by the Bosch family and by Robert Bosch GmbH. More information is available online at www.bosch.com and www.bosch-press.com . About Bosch India In India, Bosch is leading supplier of technology and services the areas of automotive and industrial technology, consumer goods and building technology. Additionally, Bosch has India, the largest development centre, outside Germany, for end to end engineering and technology solutions. The Bosch Group operates India through six companies, viz, Bosch Limited, Bosch Chassis Systems India Limited, Bosch Rexroth India Limited, Robert Bosch Engineering and Business Solutions Limited, Bosch Automotive Electronics India Pvt Ltd, Bosch Electrical Drives India Pvt Ltd.. In India, Bosch set up its manufacturing operation 1953, which has grown over the years to include 13 manufacturing sites and 7 development and application centers. Bosch Group India employs over 27,000 associates. In India it generated consolidated revenue of over Rs. 11,300 crores 2011. In India Bosch Limited is the flagship company of the Bosch Group. It earned revenue of over Rs 8000 crores 2011. Additional information can be accessed at www.boschindia.com About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.8 billion 2011, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com About WABCO INDIA WABCO INDIA has four world-class manufacturing sites located Ambattur, Chennai; Jamshedpur; Mahindra World City; and Pant Nagar; as well as software development centre and company-owned test track Chennai. WABCO INDIA excels engineering, manufacturing and local sourcing. It designs, manufactures and markets conventional braking products, advanced braking systems, and other related air-assisted products and systems. WABCO INDIA has achieved major market share the Indian OEM market as well as the domestic aftermarket, which it serves through extensive national distribution network. WABCO INDIA employs over 1,100 employees and reported Rs. 1058 Crs sales its fiscal year 2011-12. WABCO’s EasyFit™ Automatic Slack Adjuster enables the transmission of power from the actuator to the S-cam shaft drum brakes. On the basis of particular technical advancements, it supports constant clearance between brake lining and drum, even under extreme temperature conditions. With this new development, WABCO offers a technical and cost attractive alternative to the common slack adjusters for the truck, bus and trailer segments. Expands Agreement with Turkey’s Largest Manufacturer of Commercial Vehicles WABCO Supplies Breakthrough Air Compression Technology for Trucks at Ford Otosan; Expands Agreement with Turkey’s Largest Manufacturer of Commercial Vehicles BRUSSELS, Belgium, August 7, 2013 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that it has expanded its long-term supply agreement with Ford Otosan, Turkey’s largest manufacturer and exporter of commercial vehicles. The expanded agreement adds the supply of WABCO’s breakthrough c-comp™ air compressor with integrated clutch for series production 2015 to support Ford Otosan’s current and new platforms of heavy duty trucks. WABCO’s c-comp features the industry’s most compact compressor design available, combining high performance and best-in-class efficiency. WABCO’s breakthrough technology supports engines that meet upcoming EURO VI emission standards, contributing to improved environmental sustainability. The new contract between Ford Otosan and WABCO expands their partnership that began more than 10 years ago, with WABCO supplying broad portfolio of braking, air management and electronic suspension technologies and systems to support series production of Ford Otosan’s trucks. “This significant new contract with Ford Otosan further demonstrates WABCO’s technology leadership as yet another major global truck manufacturer adopts our industry-leading air compressor with integrated clutch for volume production,” said Mike Thompson, WABCO Vice President, Compression and Braking. “We are proud to expand our partnership with Ford Otosan as we continue to help sustain their success through WABCO innovations that improve vehicle efficiency and performance while providing clean air solutions.” Ford Otosan has long track record of market leadership Turkey and 2012 the company accounted for 60 percent of the country’s total commercial vehicle exports. Ford Otosan exports heavy duty trucks to 30 countries Europe, Asia and Africa. Press photo / caption: WABCO’s c-comp™ is innovative air compressor with integrated multi-disc clutch. It features the industry’s most compact compressor design, combining high performance and best-in-class efficiency. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. With sales of $2.5 billion 2012, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Supplies Breakthrough Air Compression Technology to Two Leading Global Manufacturers of Commercial Vehicles WABCO Supplies Breakthrough Air Compression Technology to Two Leading Global Manufacturers of Commercial Vehicles BRUSSELS, Belgium / LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, March 20, 2013 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced at the 2013 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS) Louisville, Kentucky, that it is now supplying its breakthrough c-comp™ compressor with integrated clutch to two leading global manufacturers of commercial vehicles. WABCO’s c-comp features the industry’s most compact compressor design available, combining high-performance and best-in-class-efficiency. This breakthrough technology from WABCO supports engines that meet upcoming EURO VI emission standards, contributing to improved environmental sustainability. Furthermore, WABCO plans to introduce its innovative c-comp compressors to the North American market during 2013. Two global original equipment manufacturers, headquartered Europe, January 2013 began installing WABCO’s c-comp on their European heavy-duty trucks and buses, fulfilling their requirements for reliable and robust compressor that delivers significant fuel savings. “We are proud to announce these two major customer adoptions of our industry-leading, compact air compressor with integrated clutch for volume production,” said Nikhil Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “These latest customer awards continue to demonstrate WABCO’s differentiation through breakthrough innovations that offer dual benefits of enhanced vehicle efficiency and lower operating costs.” WABCO’s breakthrough c-comp air compressor technology optimally disengages the compressor through pneumatic signal when no air is needed, allowing fuel savings up to 145 gallons (550 liters) annually long haul operations of 125,000 miles (200,000 km) typical North American driving conditions. The c-comp has simple on-off control and only draws power from the engine during the pumping phase, switching off completely during the long off-load phase. This leads to significant reduction of the compressor’s overall energy demand. It reduces maintenance costs due to lower carbonization and at the same time, enhances driver comfort due to reduced noise levels. At MATS 2013, one of the commercial vehicle industry’s leading exhibitions North America, WABCO’s c-comp with integrated clutch be showcased alongside other WABCO breakthrough technologies that help to improve vehicle safety, enhance driver effectiveness and increase vehicle efficiency. WABCO and Meritor WABCO at MATS 2013 Booth 34455 the South Wing Kentucky Exposition Center, Louisville, Kentucky, March 21 to 23, 2013 WABCO and Meritor WABCO host the following events at MATS 2013 ESCsmart™ “Drive-it-Away” media-only seminar, March 20, 1:30 pm – 2:15 pm, Room C108, South Wing OnGuard™ collision mitigation system “Ride-n-Drive”, March 21 and 22, 2013 (sign up at WABCO booth 34455) WABCO Breakthroughs As the technology leader the global commercial vehicle industry, WABCO’s breakthroughs include, among other vehicle safety and efficiency technologies, the first autonomous emergency braking system (AEBS) , the first high performance single-piston air disc brake , the first collision mitigation system (CMS) with active braking, and the first electronic stability control (ESC) system. WABCO pioneered the industry’s first electronic braking system (EBS) , the first electronically-controlled air suspension (ECAS) , the first automated manual transmission (AMT) system and the first anti-lock braking system (ABS) . Founded the United States 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO is U.S. public company listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Press photo / caption: WABCO’s c-comp™ represents state-of-the-art air compression technology that significantly increases commercial vehicle efficiency. C-comp is equipped with integrated clutch, enabling fuel savings up to 145 gallons per year. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.5 billion 2012, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading global suppliers back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100-year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides the JV with the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE:WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, pioneering breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, collision mitigation, stability control and transmission automation systems. In 1986, WABCO introduced the first electronic transmission automation system for commercial vehicles, industry breakthrough, and today the company is leader transmission automation technology based on more than 20 years of experience driveline controls. Covering nearly all applications medium and heavy duty trucks as well as buses, WABCO’s OptiDrive, new modular automated transmission system consists of three core components: cabin mounted shift lever unit, including the system’s electronic control unit; shift actuator mounted on the gearbox, and clutch actuator. Depending on the driver’s preference, WABCO’s OptiDrive can change gears full automatic mode or as initiated by the driver. By optimizing the gear shifting process, OptiDrive improves vehicle control and enhances comfort. It significantly contributes to lower average fuel consumption by shifting at the most effective speed, major cost saving over the vehicle’s lifetime. In addition, OptiDrive significantly reduce the total cost of ownership of vehicle as more accurately controlled shifting operations result less wear among components. Compared with manual transmission, OptiDrive requires less driver training as it further simplifies vehicle operation, resulting increased driver awareness for traffic conditions and improved road safety. Features Smart modular system design for transmissions easily adaptable from 5 to 16 speeds Minimized space requirements at gearbox Central control unit included cabin mounted shift lever unit Pneumatic shift and clutch actuators Easily adaptable to existing trucks and transmissions Reliable design based on long experience Development and testing according to state-of-the-art specifications Full functionality including software for plug and play approach Market Availability: Worldwide Legal Entity Privacy Policy Disclaimer Copyright and Terms of Use

Features The special features of DDU are listed below Air Drying – Removes moisture completely from the compressed air Unloading – Regulates system pressure by exhausting the air delivered to the compressor, to the atmosphere when system pressure is increases; and allows re-charging of the system when the system pressure reduces. Safety Valve – In case of any malfunctioning of the unloader valve, it protects the compressor and system by blowing off the excess pressure. This device is integrated with the unloader valve mechanism. Quadruple System Protection Valve (QSPV) – This function is integrated into the DDU, which protects the healthy circuits of the air brake system, case of failure one of the circuits. The non-return valves this portion prevents back flow of stored compressed air upstream. Tyre inflator (Optional feature) – This device helps for inflation of the vehicle tyres. Purge tank – This tank which is integrated with the DDU stores dry air for regeneration of the desiccant bed. Benefits Eliminates need of separate purge tank and associated pipeline, fittings and fasteners Eliminates need of separate QSPV the system. Integration of purge tank and QSPV simplifies piping chassis and leads to the ease of fitment Integrated mounting bracket provided on the DDU body eliminates the need for separate mounting bracket used currently for air dryer fitment. Application Medium and heavy duty commercial vehicles Buses and trailers Market Availability: Indian Markets Legal Entity Privacy Policy Disclaimer Copyright and Terms of Use
