Weitere Informationen unter: www.wabco-auto.com Über Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension and control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading global suppliers back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100-year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides the JV the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Automotive Control Systems, Inc., wholly-owned subsidiary of WABCO Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:WBC), provides breakthrough technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For more information, visit meritorwabco.com. September WABCO Kids Corner (Zelt C 59 Freigelände Halle 17) IAA Nutzfahrzeuge Hannover Spiel, Spaß „echte Zertifizierung“ für Kinder 3 12 Jahren HANNOVER, 24. September 2014 – WABCO, führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie, verfolgt diesjährigen IAA Nutzfahrzeuge Hannover zukunftsweisende Recruiting-Strategie, Blick vorne richtet. Getreu Motto „Recruiting mal anders“ gezielt Ingenieure übermorgen angesprochen, Eltern weltweit bedeutendste Messe für Nutzfahrzeugindustrie besuchen. Am WABCO Kids Corner, Zelt C 59 Freigelände Halle 17, können ambitionierten Nachwuchsingenieure anderem ferngesteuerten Modell-Lkws versuchen. Ausgestattet „Top Driver“ Baseball-Kappe, passend WABCO‘s gleichnamigen Trainingsprogramm für Lkw-Fahrer, „Testingenieur“ T-Shirt, gilt für Nachwuchs, Lkw Stile „Top Driver“ sicher Parcours steuern. Als Lohn winkt echtes „Junior Top Driver“ Zertifikat WABCO University, WABCOs Kompetenzzentrum für professionelle Trainingslösungen. Auch abseits „Zertifizierungs-Lehrgänge“ Kindern WABCO Kids Corner geboten. Während Eltern Sitzbereich Messerundgang ausruhen WABCO, WABCO University Top Driver Trainingsprogramm informieren können, heißt für Nachwuchs freie Fahrt blauen WABCO Bobby Car Lkws. Etwas Action, umso Kreativität, erfordern faltbare Lkw-Modelle Karton, Nachwuchsingenieuren zusammengebaut bemalt können. Hier Jüngsten schnell klar, Wartung Service entscheidende Faktoren für Erfolg „Top Driver“ sind. Abgerundet bunte Erlebnis abwaschbaren „Tomorrow’s Truck Stop“ Tattoos, diesjährigen Motto WABCO Stands IAA Nutzfahrzeuge. Der WABCO Kids Corner Samstag Sonntag (27. / 28. September) Freigelände Messe Hannover Zelt C 59 Halle 17 9:00 18:00 Uhr geöffnet. Der Industriemessestand WABCO befindet Halle 16, Stand B10. Photos Celebrate Trucking Community Worldwide WABCO Announces Winners of '#MyTruckStop' Social Media Campaign; Photos Celebrate Trucking Community Worldwide Five winners to receive iPad minis Hundreds of images submitted by commercial vehicle drivers from across the globe Social artwork shown at WABCO's IAA 2014 booth themed 'Tomorrow's Truck Stop' BRUSSELS, Belgium, October 20, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, announced the winners of its global "#MyTruckStop" campaign launched connection with IAA Commercial Vehicles 2014, one of the industry's most global trade shows held Hanover, Germany. Truck drivers and other members of the global commercial vehicle community submitted hundreds of photos of their favorite truck stops via Twitter , Facebook and Instagram using the hashtag #MyTruckStop. Responding to this call, participants captured diverse snapshots of their daily lives linked through truck stops across the world. All entries received were entered into the prize draw to win one of five iPad minis, with winners being notified by WABCO this week. "Truck stops are central hub for truck drivers all around the world, and the success of our '#MyTruckStop' campaign helped to celebrate the vibrancy and essential role of these communities," said Nick Rens, President, Trailer, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division at WABCO. "We were amazed by the levels of response and diversity of images that we received. From the hustle and bustle of Japan, to back drop of the New York skyline, it great to see drivers giving us real insights into their lives on the road. I’d like to express thanks to everybody who contributed to our '#MyTruckStop' campaign." WABCO showcased hundreds of the '#MyTruckStop' entries received large social art mosaic at the company’s IAA 2014 booth themed 'Tomorrow’s Truck Stop'. The company currently displays the artwork for download on its web site. Achieves New Record for Quarterly Performance Earnings; Updates Guidance for 2014 Q3 2014 sales of $707.3 million, up 4.5 percent local currencies and up 4.5 percent U.S. dollars from year ago Q3 2014 operating margin of 13.4 percent on performance basis, up from 13.2 percent year ago; operating margin of 12.4 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 12.8 percent year ago Q3 2014 diluted EPS of $1.44 on performance basis, up from $1.26 year ago; diluted EPS of $1.37 on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $1.26 year ago In Q3 2014, WABCO generated $48.0 million net cash from operating activities and $89.3 million of free cash flow, excluding payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items, and for the one-time item of $73.5 million due to expiration of the accounts receivable securitization program, resulting conversion rate of 103 percent of performance net income attributable to the company Updates guidance for full year 2014; sales growth to now range from 5.5 to 6.5 percent local currencies versus previous guidance to range from 6 to 9 percent; diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.45 to $5.55 versus previous guidance to range from $5.45 to $5.75, and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.77 to $4.87 versus previous guidance to range from $4.77 to $5.07 BRUSSELS, Belgium, October 24, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today reported Q3 2014 sales of $707.3 million, up 4.5 percent local currencies from year ago and up 4.5 percent U.S. dollars, of which 2.7 percent comes from the Q3 2014 consolidated results local currencies of Transics International , WABCO’s newly acquired subsidiary. WABCO reported Q3 2014 performance operating income of $94.8 million, up from $89.5 million year ago, and operating income $87.7 million on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $86.9 million year ago. WABCO’s performance operating margin for Q3 2014 13.4 percent, up from 13.2 percent year ago, and operating margin 12.4 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 12.8 percent year ago. “In Q3 2014, we grew sales by 4.5 percent and demonstrated – once again – our ability to outperform the market every region, as we continued to increase WABCO content per vehicle and further expanded market share global environment that remains volatile and uncertain and which new truck and bus builds eroded by 3.4 percent year on year,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Also Q3 2014, we continued to transform top-line growth into robust bottom-line performance. Our early anticipation of market softening triggered immediate cost reduction measures that contributed to healthy incremental operating margin of 15 percent, excluding year on year currency transactional effects,” said Esculier, referring to the ratio of increase performance operating income and WABCO’s growth sales. “This led to new quarterly record for performance earnings per diluted share at $1.44, increase of 14 percent versus the same period year ago.” “In Q3 2014, WABCO achieved $17.5 million of materials and conversion productivity, while continuing to contain price erosion,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s Operating System, our global management framework, continued to enable fast, flexible responses to market changes during Q3 2014 and it generated materials productivity of 5.0 percent and conversion productivity of 6.3 percent, both of these quarterly results marking ongoing robust productivity gains.” For Q3 2014, WABCO reported performance net income attributable to the company of $86.5 million or $1.44 per diluted share, up from $79.5 million or $1.26 per diluted share year ago, and Q3 2014 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $82.0 million or $1.37 per diluted share, up from $80.0 million or $1.26 per diluted share year ago. During Q3 2014, WABCO generated $48.0 million net cash from operating activities and $89.3 million of free cash flow, excluding payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items, and for the one-time item of $73.5 million due to expiration of the accounts receivable securitization program, resulting conversion rate of 103 percent of performance net income attributable to the company. Since June 2011, WABCO has repurchased 13,066,261 shares for $921.7 million open market transactions as of September 30, 2014. WABCO is authorized to repurchase up to $78.3 million of additional shares through December 31, 2014. Recent Highlights In Q3 2014, WABCO inaugurated its fifth factory India, located Lucknow. WABCO’s extended network India helps both local and global commercial vehicle makers to further grow their domestic and export business. This plant’s opening demonstrates WABCO’s continued ability to anticipate and align with the requirements of its customers India through the supply of just-in-time, first-rate engineered, locally adapted safety and efficiency technologies for trucks and buses built India. At Lucknow, WABCO manufactures actuators and range of braking valves and produce advanced technologies, including anti-lock braking systems (ABS) , for multiple global commercial vehicle makers operating India. WABCO’s global manufacturing network comprises 21 sites across 11 countries on 4 continents. WABCO announced Q3 2014 that it has been awarded new long-term agreement by major manufacturer of commercial vehicles headquartered Europe. WABCO supply brake actuator technologies for new truck platform that enter into new markets Southeast Asia. Series production is expected to begin 2016 at the customer’s plant Thailand. Designed by WABCO engineers India, these brake actuators have been optimally adapted for the customer’s local product applications the region of Southeast Asia. At the same time, WABCO supply its products from its factory Rayong, Thailand, which opened 2013 and already delivers superlative quality through zero defects for every million parts produced. WABCO presented Q3 2014 its next-generation TX-TRAILERGUARD™ fleet management solution. It combines the functionalities of WABCO’s award-winning TrailerGUARD™ telematics solution with Transics International’s back-office software platform TX-CONNECT™ . New TX-TRAILERGUARD helps commercial fleets to improve vehicle safety and efficiency performance while reducing cost, as it enables effective truck, trailer, driver and cargo management real time. It is the industry’s first and only solution that covers both truck and trailer information integrated into one portal. TX-TRAILERGUARD marks the first product integration after WABCO acquired fleet management systems company Transics, market leader Europe, February 2014. WABCO unveiled Q3 2014 its innovative OptiFlow™ Tail solution, aerodynamic product that helps to improve fuel economy and operational efficiency of trailers Europe. Its innovative modular design of folding panels significantly improves air flow at the trailer’s rear. OptiFlow Tail shows WABCO’s continued technology leadership to improve trailer efficiency for manufacturers, fleet operators and transport companies. Proven on the test track, OptiFlow Tail helps to increase the fuel economy of tractor-trailer combinations up to 3.5 percent at highway speeds. OptiFlow Tail builds on experience gained through WABCO’s OptiFlow SideWings , flow-conductor that optimizes the airflow around and underneath the trailer, reducing air resistance. OptiFlow SideWings has proven on test tracks and on the road to increase fuel economy up to 5 percent at highway speeds. WABCO disclosed Q3 2014 that it further expanded its market-leading electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) technology – branded OptiRide™ – to the truck market China. As result, China National Heavy Truck Corporation, one of China’s largest producers of heavy-duty trucks, has adopted OptiRide series production on multiple truck platforms across range of axle configurations. WABCO is the first and only supplier of ECAS technology for truck and bus makers China. WABCO’s award-winning ECAS technology, the global industry’s best-selling solution for electronic control of air suspension, delivers fuel savings up to 5 percent under certain conditions, while providing optimal ride performance. In Q3 2014, WABCO introduced OptiPace™ technology, predictive economic cruise control system for trucks and buses. WABCO’s OptiPace system marks the company’s newest addition to its industry-leading portfolio of advanced driver assistance systems. WABCO’s breakthrough OptiPace system uses on-board digital map technology and proprietary algorithms to anticipate and adapt the vehicle’s most economic speed based on the road topography ahead. For instance, it helps drivers and fleets to achieve highly economical vehicle operation up and down slopes, which offers potential for fuel savings. In new long-term supply agreement, major European commercial vehicle manufacturer has already adopted the OptiPace system for series production expected to begin 2016. WABCO reported Q3 2014 that its breakthrough e-comp™ technology is now adopted road trials by more than 25 truck and bus manufacturers Europe, North America and Asia. WABCO’s e-comp is electrically driven air compressor that is specifically engineered for hybrid and pure electric vehicles. It is being increasingly deployed as solution for inner city and zero- or low-emission zones. The e-comp’s universal design is suitable for wide range of truck and bus applications worldwide. WABCO Updates Full Year 2014 Guidance Based on our current estimates of future market conditions, WABCO tightens its previously disclosed guidance for full year 2014. WABCO expects full year 2014 sales growth to now range from 5.5 to 6.5 percent local currencies versus previous guidance to range from 6 to 9 percent; performance operating margin to now range from 12.9 to 13.1 percent versus previous guidance to range from 12.9 to 13.3 percent; and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from 12.2 to 12.4 percent versus previous guidance to range from 12.2 to 12.6 percent, resulting diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.45 to $5.55 versus previous guidance to range from $5.45 to $5.75 and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.77 to $4.87 versus previous guidance to range from $4.77 to $5.07. Consistent with its committed framework, WABCO reiterates that it expects 2014 to convert between 80 and 90 percent of its net income attributable to the company into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with items for streamlining, separation, acquisition, and expiration of the accounts receivable securitization program. “Looking ahead, our three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution continue to drive WABCO’s differentiation that positions us as preferred supplier the global commercial vehicle industry,” said Esculier. “Our continued ability to outperform our market, together with further initiatives to drive productivity operating expenses, enables us to mitigate sudden decline global demand for truck and bus production and still achieve healthy earnings per share.” Conference Call Jacques Esculier, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, Chief Financial Officer, discuss WABCO’s results and outlook on conference call at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time today. Expands Commitment to Off-Highway Industry China WABCO Showcases Advanced Safety and Efficiency Technologies at bauma 2014; Expands Commitment to Off-Highway Industry China BRUSSELS, Belgium, and SHANGHAI, China, November 24, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE:WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, for the first time showcase its industry-leading technologies at bauma China 2014 Shanghai, China. The company feature advanced products and systems that help manufacturers of off-highway vehicles worldwide to significantly improve vehicle safety and efficiency. bauma China 2014, one of the largest trade shows for construction vehicles and related equipment worldwide, be held from November 25-28 at the Shanghai New International Expo Center Shanghai, China. "Our presence at bauma 2014 demonstrates our commitment to expand our presence China to serve off-highway vehicle manufacturers vital growth market worldwide," said Nick Rens, President, Trailer Systems, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division, WABCO. "We feature WABCO's pioneering safety and efficiency technologies, including our proven hydraulic anti-lock braking system (ABS), powerful air disc brake, and fuel saving clutch compressor. These technologies further help manufacturers of construction, mining, agricultural and other specialty vehicles to significantly improve the safety and efficiency performance of their heavy duty vehicles." WABCO showcase numerous leading safety and efficiency technologies from its portfolio of "industry firsts" and major innovations at bauma China 2014. Differentiating WABCO products and systems on display at bauma include: Advanced Hydraulic ABS – latest generation of hydraulic anti-lock braking system (ABS) for off-highway and specialty vehicles. Hydraulic ABS specifically engineered to deliver top braking performance harsh environments and on low friction surfaces. It helps to prevent wheel spinning or locking, thereby, ensuring superb vehicle steerability. Proven Full Hydraulic Power Brakes – hydraulic braking system for off-highway vehicles over 10 tons. Full Hydraulic Power Brakes easily connect to pre-configured power hydraulic systems and can be customized to operate on various vehicle braking platforms. For more than 30 years, WABCO's full hydraulic power braking system has delivered top performance and reliability to off-highway vehicle builders. Powerful PAN™ 25 Air Disc Brake – industry-first air disc brake for heavy duty vehicles with 25-inch wheel applications. The brake contributes to driver comfort, safety and performance and significantly reduces maintenance cost compared to traditional drum brakes. Breakthrough c-comp™ clutch compressor – industry-first technology the off-highway vehicle segment. The system optimally disengages vehicle's air compressor from the engine when air delivery is not needed. WABCO's energy-efficient c-comp air compressor helps to lower related fuel consumption and maintenance cost. For nearly 20 years, WABCO has provided leading safety and efficiency technologies to truck, bus and trailer manufacturers China, the world's largest commercial vehicle market. The company continues to expand its leading product and service offerings to off-highway vehicle builders China, including SANY Group. SANY Group, headquartered China, serves the construction machinery industry worldwide. WABCO supplies advanced braking and efficiency technologies to SANY, including anti-lock braking systems, air disc brakes and air processing systems. WABCO innovations help enhance the safety and efficiency of SANY's portfolio of select off-highway vehicles such as concrete mixers, concrete pump trucks, truck cranes, as well as all-terrain cranes. BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 8, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that on December 5, 2014 its board of directors authorized the company to enter into additional two-year share repurchase program. The new board authorization allows for the repurchase of up to additional $500 million of common shares at the discretion of management from December 5, 2014 through December 31, 2016. Since the initiation of WABCO’s first share buyback program June 2011, the company has returned $962 million cash to shareowners through the repurchase of 13,483,461 million shares open market transactions. “This latest share buyback authorization from our board of directors is good news for WABCO shareowners,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “It demonstrates our ongoing commitment to deliver value to them, this case by returning cash.” About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. With sales of $2.7 billion 2013, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Directors, Further Strengthening Board’s Global Automotive Expertise BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 11, 2014 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that it has appointed Nick Reilly to its board of directors. Mr. Reilly’s appointment took effect on December 5, 2014. Mr. Reilly brings to WABCO nearly 40 years of experience working the global automotive industry. Most recently, he served as strategic advisor to three automotive suppliers Korea, the U.S. and Ukraine. Before then, Mr. Reilly held international executive roles with General Motors (GM) Europe, North America and Asia for 35 years, including President of GM Europe from 2009 through 2012. Prior to his tenure with the U.S. automaker, he worked for eight years finance and the investment community. Mr. Reilly holds degrees economics from the University of Cambridge, Cambridge, United Kingdom. “Nick brings wealth of global automotive industry expertise and sound strategic counsel to WABCO’s board as we continue to master the challenges and capitalize on the significant opportunities of the global commercial vehicle industry,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “His appointment further strengthen our board as we maintain market leadership through our proven three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution.” Press photo / caption: WABCO appointed Nick Reilly to its board of directors. He brings to WABCO nearly 40 years of experience working the global automotive industry. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung Innovative Meritor WABCO OnLane™ Lane Departure Warning System Now Available for Freightliner Trucks Innovative Meritor WABCO OnLane™ Lane Departure Warning System Now Available for Freightliner Trucks TROY, Mich., (Nov. 4, 2013) – Meritor WABCO, leader the integration of safety and efficiency technology for the North American commercial vehicle industry, announced that its OnLane™, innovative lane departure warning system, is available for immediate orders as option on Freightliner Cascadia ® and Freightliner Cascadia Evolution models. Meritor WABCO’s OnLane, powered with SafeTrak technology by Takata, is forward-looking, vision-based lane departure warning system designed to monitor road markings and the vehicle’s position the lane. The new system delivers distinct and separate audible warnings to the driver if the vehicle leaves its lane unintentionally, encouraging the use of turn signals. OnLane provides unique feature called driver alertness warning (DAW), which detects erratic or degraded driving based on lane weaving and provides warning to the driver. This powerful tool helps drivers stay aware of dangerous driving situations caused by fatigue or distraction. “As the market leader collision mitigation systems North America, Meritor WABCO’s OnLane helps improve safe driving, particularly when used as part of overall integrated safety system,” said Carsten Duevell, senior director, Vehicle Control Systems, Meritor WABCO. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Association (FMCSA) is promoting voluntary adoption of lane departure warning systems to trucking fleets to encourage safe driving behaviors and reduce crashes. Commercial vehicle collisions involving property damage can cost fleets up to $197,000 each, while those resulting fatalities can cost up to $1.2 million. FMCSA has estimated the payback for lane departure warning type systems to be as short as nine months and the payback as high as $6.55 for every dollar spent. The OnLane lane departure warning system is unique one-box solution integrating camera and electronics. OnLane allows for quick and simple installation coupled with outstanding reliability. Vehicle alerts and warnings can be transmitted to fleet management systems through telematics system. In addition, OnLane can be equipped as retrofit solution to existing fleet vehicles addition to OEM line build. OnLane sales, service and technical support is available from DriveForce™ and OnTrac, Meritor WABCO’s industry leading organization of 150 dedicated support professionals. For additional product information or to order, contact Meritor WABCO the United States or Canada by calling 866-OnTrac1 (866-668-7221). About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading global suppliers back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100-year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides the JV the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Automotive Control Systems, Inc., wholly-owned subsidiary of WABCO Holdings, Inc., provides breakthrough technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For more information, visit meritorwabco.com . Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung Meritor WABCO Releases Reman MACK ASET Air Compressor Meritor WABCO Releases Reman MACK ASET Air Compressor TROY, Mich., (Nov. 15, 2013) – Meritor WABCO, leader integrated safety systems and efficiency technology for the North American commercial vehicle industry, is marking “America Recycles Day” with the release of remanufactured System Saver™ air compressor for select trucks that use the MACK ASET engine. “We’ve seen increased demand from manufacturers for our System Saver products, and now we’ve efficiently remanufactured our air compressor for aftermarket use,” said Pat Kealy, director, Aftermarket, Meritor WABCO. “Its quality is comparable to new compressor – and with the extra ecological benefit of recycling versus adding material to landfill.” A typical compressor contains approximately 40 pounds of steel, iron and aluminum, which has the metal content equivalent of approximately 1,200 beverage cans. The remanufactured air compressor minimizes the amount of waste added to landfills and offers customers alternative choice compared to new unit. WABCO is the original manufacturer and WABCO Reman Solutions, part of WABCO, remanufactures the Mack ASET Compressor, making it the only Mack ASET Compressor on the market tested to the same strict specifications as original OEM product. WABCO Reman Solutions takes each compressor through rigorous teardown and inspection process, and it is thoroughly remanufactured using OEM components. The remanufactured MACK ASET Compressor be available through Meritor’s Aftermarket group on January 2, 2014. In addition, this MACK ASET Compressor (Part #: S911 153 0550X) is serviced through Meritor Aftermarket group at 888-725-9355 the United States, 800-387-3889 Canada or by visiting www.MeritorPartsOnline.com . Increases WABCO’s Ownership to 100% WABCO Acquires Remaining Shares its Joint Venture, Shandong Weiming Automotive Products, Jinan, China; Increases WABCO’s Ownership to 100% SHANGHAI, China, November 27, 2013 – WABCO, global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, recently announced that it has acquired the remaining shares its Chinese joint venture, Shandong Weiming Automotive Products (SWAP) located Jinan, thus increasing WABCO’s ownership from 70 to 100 percent. The change ownership interest completed on August 30, 2013 and has been approved by the local authorities. WABCO paid $4.6 million cash. As previously disclosed, WABCO had established SWAP 1996 together with Mingshui Automotive Fitting Factory. Through Six Sigma Lean production, SWAP has developed into leading supplier of technologies and control systems for major manufacturers of trucks, buses and trailers China while exporting more than half its products around the world. WABCO’s 100 percent interest SWAP marks the company’s third wholly owned factory China. WABCO owns and operates another Six Sigma Lean production facility located Jinan and one Qingdao. WABCO’s fourth factory China, majority-owned joint venture with FUWA, the world’s largest manufacturer of commercial trailer axles, is located Taishan. “This further investment our Jinan site demonstrates another step WABCO’s expansion China and further strengthens our well-anchored, localized manufacturing strategy that supports the competitiveness of our technologies and further differentiates WABCO,” said Leon Liu, President, WABCO Asia. “Our four advanced production facilities China show WABCO’s commitment to the local commercial vehicle market and further strengthen our global supply chain network as WABCO continues to deliver high quality, cost efficient products and services to customers China and around the world.” Headquartered Shanghai, WABCO China has over 1,500 employees including local engineers research and development. Integrated with WABCO’s global engineering network, WABCO China operates new product development center Shanghai to further differentiate WABCO’s capabilities for local applications. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. With sales of $2.5 billion 2012, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Retains Reimbursement of 206 Million Euros Awarded by EU General Court WABCO Confirms Closure of Case of Appeal Arising from EU Fine on Former Entities of American Standard Companies; Retains Reimbursement of 206 Million Euros Awarded by EU General Court BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 2, 2013 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today confirmed that the period for appeal has expired – and no appeal has been filed by the European Commission – regarding the EU General Court’s recent ruling to significantly reduce civil fine of EUR 326.1 million imposed by the European Commission June 2010 (approximately $400 million at the date of assessment). The original fine imposed on entities representing the former American Standard Companies Inc. and certain of its former operations Europe involving bathroom fittings and fixtures cartel. On September 16, 2013, the General Court reduced the fine by EUR 205.8 million to EUR 120.3 million. As previously reported, WABCO awarded its EUR 205.8 million reimbursement based on WABCO’s initial appeal against the European Commission’s fine. “WABCO remains satisfied with the General Court’s ruling this matter, and we note that the European Commission has not filed appeal within the legally required period,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Indeed, we are pleased that this case is now closed.” Also as previously disclosed, WABCO has never manufactured or marketed any of the products that were the subject of the European Commission’s investigation and no one from WABCO had any involvement with the matter. However, connection with its spin-off from American Standard Companies Inc. 2007, and as disclosed WABCO’s Form 10K and 10Q filings, WABCO obliged to indemnify American Standard Companies Inc., now known as Trane Inc., and certain of its former entities involved the Commission’s investigation and related fines. As required by its indemnification agreement with Trane, WABCO paid the full amount of the fine September 2010 and keep the full amount of the reimbursement, which paid October 2013 by the European Commission. Marks Industry’s First Series Production WABCO Begins to Supply IVECO Trucks with Newest Anti-Lock Braking System Integrated with Breakthrough Electronic Stability Control ESCsmart; Marks Industry’s First Series Production BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 4, 2013 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that it has begun to supply IVECO with WABCO’s newest generation of pneumatic anti-lock braking system (ABS version E8) integrated with breakthrough electronic stability control ESCsmart™ to equip IVECO’s new Eurocargo Euro 6 medium-duty on-road trucks. IVECO is global manufacturer of commercial vehicles headquartered Turin, Italy, and part of CNH Industrial Group. It marks the first time the commercial vehicle industry that these advanced WABCO safety technologies are being adopted together series production. As announced October 2011, WABCO entered into multi-year supply agreement with IVECO to furnish these advanced technologies for series production Europe starting 2013. WABCO’s newest generation of pneumatic ABS technology integrated with ESCsmart improves the vehicle’s directional stability and helps to protect against roll-over, skidding and spin-out during critical driving situations. Fleets and truck drivers benefit from optimal ESC performance on the road as it adapts to changing vehicle characteristics. Truck and bus manufacturers benefit from ESCsmart as it eases vehicle assembly and end-of-line procedures series production across wide range of new vehicle types. “WABCO further demonstrates technology leadership as together with IVECO we bring advanced anti-lock braking systems integrated with smarter electronic stability technology to the market on IVECO’s new range of Eurocargo Euro 6 medium-duty trucks,” said Bodo Klein, WABCO Vice President, Vehicle Dynamics and Control Systems. “IVECO can respond faster to market needs by introducing new vehicle types less time as we help to increase end-of-line manufacturing efficiency while improving vehicle safety.” WABCO supplies IVECO’s heavy-duty on-road trucks with ABS, ESC, electronic braking and electronically controlled air suspension systems, as well as air compressor technology , braking products, adaptive cruise control and vehicle control modules, among other vehicle safety and efficiency components. In addition to pioneering ABS for commercial vehicles 1981, WABCO introduced ESC 2001. WABCO ESC systems help to mitigate more than 500,000 critical driving situations per year globally. WABCO’s newest generation of ABS with ESCsmart is available worldwide. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Reiterates That its OptiFlow SideWings Improve Fuel Economy by 1.5 Liters per 100 Km on Tractor-Trailer Combinations WABCO Reiterates That its OptiFlow SideWings Improve Fuel Economy by 1.5 Liters per 100 Km on Tractor-Trailer Combinations BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 17, 2013 – WABCO, global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that OptiFlow™ SideWings , its innovative vehicle efficiency technology, has once again demonstrated fuel savings of approximately 1.5 liters per 100 kilometers on tractor-trailer combinations. Mounted on trailers, OptiFlow SideWings are uniquely designed, patented flow-conductors that are specially contoured to optimize airflow around and behind the vehicle, thus reducing energy loss caused by aerodynamic drag. In trials recently performed at professional test track France, attended by customers and professionals from the transport industry, WABCO conducted live demonstration that compared results among several commercial vehicles that were equipped with OptiFlow SideWings and then tested without WABCO’s aerodynamic panel. STEF transport firm provided two vehicles from trailer builder Lamberet; Fraikin transport operator provided two vehicles from trailer maker Chéreau, and TIP Trailer Services – one of Europe’s largest leasing companies – showcased trailer made by Krone. In addition, Norbert Dentressangle, another of Europe’s largest transport fleets, showcased one of their vehicles. Using widely recognized standards set forth by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE), test conditions included similar tractor-trailer combinations such as the type of cab, engine, axles and gearboxes; the pattern of body, chassis and axles the same for each vehicle. Vehicles were tested traveling at the speed of 85 km per hour. These test results were consistent with WABCO’s cumulative data, demonstrating that vehicles equipped with OptiFlow SideWings improve fuel savings by approximately 1.5 liters per 100 km. As result, vehicle traveling 120,000 km year on European roads could save on average estimated € 2,000 fuel costs by installing WABCO’s OptiFlow SideWings. “STEF is leader the transportation and logistics of food products under controlled temperature and we are committed to sustainable development. With fleet of 1,900 refrigerated trailers Europe, the Group always embraces innovation to equip its vehicles with the most efficient and environmentally friendly technology solutions,” said Nadège Dubinsky, Technical Director of STEF Vehicles. “We have adopted OptiFlow SideWings aerodynamic technology for trailers because it generates fuel savings and reduces carbon emissions by reducing the trailer’s aerodynamic drag. Equipping STEF trailers with OptiFlow SideWings help us to achieve our 2014 goal of reducing CO2 emissions per ton per kilometer by 8% within our second CO2 charter signed with ADEME for the 2012-2014 period,” Dubinsky added, referring to the charter of the French Agency for Environment and Energy Management. “Lamberet is the first trailer builder France to integrate aerodynamics into the design of its equipment. Our new ‘CX system’ – the winner of prize for innovation at the recent Solutrans tradeshow France – is equipped with OptiFlow SideWings,” said Gwenaël Tuet, Director of Studies and Services at Lamberet. “We chose OptiFlow SideWings because WABCO’s system fully supports our product philosophy to provide customers with high-quality refrigerated trailers that are enhanced by the most advanced technologies and tailored to their business needs.” “With durable, quickly exchangeable modular panels and its easy-lifting attachment system, OptiFlow SideWings are compatible with all platforms, thus improving operability and simplifying maintenance,” said Tuet. “OptiFlow SideWing’s patented airplane shape offers real advantage over other systems because it generates thrust that helps to reduce fuel consumption by 1.5 liters per 100 km.” “These robust results of the fuel-saving performance of OptiFlow SideWings show how WABCO continues to add value to transport companies, fleet operators and trailer builders across Europe and globally through technology leadership that improves vehicle efficiency,” said Christiaan Verschueren, WABCO Business Enterprise Leader, Trailer Systems. “Increasing fuel economy, lowering operating expenses and reducing CO2 emissions demonstrate how fleets and original equipment manufacturers everywhere can incrementally improve their business.” WABCO is available to advise fleets about multi-year financing possibilities, which would enable customers to benefit from improved fuel economy from the first day that they equip their trailers with OptiFlow SideWings. About OptiFlow SideWings In 2013, WABCO further extended its technology portfolio with the launch of OptiFlow SideWings for trailers, the first new range of products that improve the aerodynamics of commercial vehicles. With its innovative OptiFlow range, WABCO supports customers to reduce vehicle operating costs, resulting lower total cost of ownership. By ensuring minimum of drag and by providing lighter alternative to conventional trailer skirts, WABCO’s new OptiFlow SideWings contribute to efficiency gains and significant cost-savings over the life of vehicle. Behind the tractor wheels and axles, the airflow moves towards the vehicle’s center, providing high angle of attack for the motion of air currents. The wing profile of the flow-conductor improves the trailer’s aerodynamics by capturing this angled airflow at the lower end of the tractor, creating force the driving direction and guiding it to the trailer along the rotating wheels. OptiFlow SideWings are made from material that is lighter and more durable than material used conventional trailer skirts. OptiFlow SideWings are easy to install and compatible with any length and type of trailer. Press photo / caption: WABCO’s OptiFlow SideWings improve fuel economy by up to 1.5 Liters per 100 Km on tractor-trailer combinations, recent test demonstrated at professional test track France. Pictured here is vehicle supplied by STEF, leader the transportation and logistics of food products under controlled temperature. The trailer showcases WABCO’s aerodynamic OptiFlow SideWings. With sales of $2.5 billion 2012, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. New Video-Capturing Safety Feature Now Available Meritor WABCO Enhances OnLane, its Innovative Lane Departure Warning System; New Video-Capturing Safety Feature Now Available TROY, Mich., December 19, 2013 – Meritor WABCO, leader the integration of safety and efficiency technology for the North American commercial vehicle industry, today announced new option for OnLane™, its innovative lane departure warning system, that enhances OnLane with the ability to record and save videos of critical safety events. The new video safety option is available now. “This additional and robust safety feature responds to specific needs of fleet customers that utilize the most advanced, integrated safety components, including stability control, traction control, collision mitigation and lane departure warning,” said Carsten Duevell, senior director, Vehicle Control Systems, Meritor WABCO. “Critical event video-capturing is valuable enhancement to our Integrated Safety Systems product line.” Meritor WABCO’s OnLane, powered with SafeTraK technology by Takata, is vision-based lane departure warning system. It is designed to monitor road markings and the vehicle's position the lane. The system delivers distinct audible warnings to the driver encouraging the use of turn signals, if the vehicle leaves its lane unintentionally. In addition, OnLane is equipped with the industry’s only driver alertness warning (DAW) feature, which detects erratic or degraded driving based on lane weaving and provides warning to the driver. This unique DAW safety innovation helps drivers stay aware of dangerous driving situations caused by fatigue or distraction. Meritor WABCO’s new video-capturing feature is triggered by critical events, such as sudden deceleration. When critical safety event occurs, the system capture forward-looking color video of the scene ahead for the 10 seconds before – and five seconds after – the start of the event. The enhanced OnLane system automatically stores the 20 most recent videos. The videos can be downloaded manually using Meritor WABCO’s TOOLBOX™ 11.0 diagnostic software. The video download function is included with the purchase of TOOLBOX 11.0. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Association (FMCSA) is promoting voluntary adoption of lane departure warning systems to trucking fleets to encourage safe driving behaviors, mitigate accidents and reduce the number of crashes. Commercial vehicle collisions involving property damage can cost fleets up to $197,000 per occurrence, while those resulting fatalities can cost up to $1.2 million. FMCSA has estimated that the payback for lane departure warning systems can be nearly sevenfold nine months or less. As reported by the American Trucking Associations, 80 to 90 percent of truck-related accidents with cars are attributed to the other vehicle, and as result, video documentation can strongly support potential related litigation. OnLane’s industry-exclusive one-box solution allows for quick and simple installation coupled with outstanding reliability. Vehicle alerts and warnings can be transmitted to fleet management systems through telematics system. OnLane can be equipped as retrofit solution to existing fleet vehicles, addition to OEM line build. OnLane sales, service and technical support is available from DriveForce™ and OnTrac, Meritor WABCO's industry-leading organization of 110 dedicated support professionals. For additional product information or to order, contact Meritor WABCO theUnited StatesorCanadaby calling 866-OnTrac1 (866-668-7221). About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency-smart components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension and control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading global suppliers back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100-year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides the JV the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:WBC), provides breakthrough technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For more information, visit http://www.meritorwabco.com . Preisverleihung IAA Nutzfahrzeuge 2012 WABCO kürt Gewinner „Workshop Challenge“ europäischen Service Partner; Preisverleihung IAA Nutzfahrzeuge 2012 BRÜSSEL, Belgien / HANNOVER, 25. September 2012 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie, Gewinner WABCO Service Partner Challenge 2012 bekanntgegeben. Im Rahmen Wettbewerbs europäischen Service Partner Betriebe erstklassigen Service Wartung Reparatur Nutzfahrzeugen Beweis stellen. Die feierliche Preisverleihung fand 23. September IAA Nutzfahrzeuge 2012 Hannover statt. Den Sieg WABCO Wettbewerb holte Service Partner Betrieb Stadlmüller Leopoldsdorf, Österreich. Die WABCO Service Partner Kunzmann Stockstadt, Deutschland Tradimex Jesenitz, Tschechien, belegten gemeinsam Platz. Die WABCO Service Partner Challenge startete März 2012 Onlinetest. Insgesamt 1.367 Werkstätten 33 europäischen Ländern teilnehmen, Fachwissen wichtigsten WABCO Systeme testen lassen. Basierend Ergebnissen Runde gingen Werkstätten 10 Ländern Finalrunde. Dort jedes Werkstatt-Team Herz Nieren Sachen Diagnosekompetenz, praktische Fähigkeiten, Reparatur-Geschwindigkeit Service-Effizienz getestet. An eigens dafür präparierten Sattelauflieger, ausgestattet neuester WABCO Technologie, innerhalb zweistündigen Zeitfensters gezielt eingebaute Fehler identifiziert, analysiert behoben werden. “Wir stolz WABCO für hervorragenden Leistungen Service Partner Challenge 2012 ausgezeichnet werden,“ Leopold Stadlmüller, Geschäftsführer Stadlmüller GmbH. “Diesen Wettbewerb gewinnen, Beleg für außergewöhnlichen Diagnosekompetenzen praktischen Fähigkeiten Reparatur-Geschwindigkeit Service-Effizienz unseres Teams. Gratulation WABCO Service Partner Betriebe – gemeinsam beste europäische Werkstattnetz für Nutzfahrzeuge werden.“ „WABCO gratuliert Service Partner Werkstatt Stadlmüller, beeindruckende Art Weise Fähigkeit bewiesen hat, Fahrzeug kurzer Zeit Straße bringen,“ Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President, Trailer Systems and Aftermarket. „Auch Service Partnern Kunzmann Tradixmex herausragenden Leistungen gratulieren. In Tat verdienen Finalteilnehmer besondere Anerkennung. Mit Workshop Challenge 2012 europäischen Partner Möglichkeit zeigen, Speditionen herausragenden Service Qualität WABCO Produkte über gesamte Lebensdauer Nutzfahrzeuge schätzen.“ WABCO Service Partner strengsten Kriterien Branche zertifiziert. Dazu gehören Qualifikation Mitarbeiter Bewertung Arbeitsprozesse Werkstatt. Somit bieten WABCO Service Partner weltweit hervorragende Serviceleistungen Bereichen Diagnose, Wartung Reparaturen, Bearbeitung Abwicklung Garantieanträgen für WABCO Produkte. WABCOs Service Partnern Werkstattnetz umfasst 2.000 erstklassige Fachwerkstätten weltweit. Es bietet umfangreiche 24-Stunden Pannenhilfe Service Ort. Mit WABCOs webbasiertem Advanced Location Finder – www.wabco-services.com – findet sofort nächstgelegene WABCO Service Partner. Auszeichnung effizientesten Telematiksysteme Branche für Anhängerflotten WABCO TrailerGUARD Telediagnosefunktion gewinnt Telematik Award 2012; Auszeichnung effizientesten Telematiksysteme Branche für Anhängerflotten BRÜSSEL, Belgien, 10. Oktober 2012 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie, bekanntgegeben, WABCOs TrailerGUARD™ Telediagnosefunktion für Flottenmanagement Anhängern Telematik Award 2012 Kategorie für Logistik Ladung gewonnen hat. Der bedeutende Branchenpreis kürzlich IAA Nutzfahrzeuge 2012 verliehen, bedeutendsten Messen für Nutzfahrzeugbranche. „Wir stolz darauf, Telematik Award 2012 gewonnen haben. Die Auszeichnung unterstreicht, WABCOs TrailerGUARD Branchenstandard setzt, Auslastung Anhängerflotten optimiert Betriebskosten reduziert,“ Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President Trailer Systems and Aftermarket. „Die TrailerGUARD Telediagnosefunktion Beispiel dafür, WABCO großer Leidenschaft Innovationen arbeitet, Speditionen helfen, Sicherheit Effizienz Fahrzeuge erhöhen. Gleichzeitig unterstützen dabei, Zustand vorhandenen Fahrzeuge auszuwerten zukünftige Investitionen gezielt planen.” Die TrailerGUARD Telediagnosefunktion branchenweit Art für Einsatz elektronischen Brems- Luftfederungssystemen Anhängefahrzeugen. Sie liefert Statusinformationen Echtzeit. Die TrailerGUARD Telematik ermöglicht Flottenmanagern Fernüberwachung verschiedener Betriebsdaten Bremsbelagverschleiß, Kilometerstand, Achslast Reifendruck. Bei Kühlanhänger können Innentemperatur Türstatus Funktionen überwacht werden. 2010 WABCOs TrailerGUARD Telematik Award Kategorie Objektsicherung gewonnen. Die TrailerGUARD Telematik gehört WABCOs preisgekröntem Intelligent Trailer Program , Reihe anwenderorientierten Lösungen, Arten Anhängefahrzeugen für verbesserte Sicherheit, größere Effizienz innovativere Anwendung sorgen. Durch Entscheidung für einzelne kombinierte Module können Hersteller Anhängefahrzeugen Transportbetriebe jeweiligen Bedürfnisse Kostengesichtspunkten zugeschnittenen Funktionen auswählen. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Board of Directors Authorizes Additional $400 Million of Share Buyback WABCO Board of Directors Authorizes Additional $400 Million of Share Buyback BRUSSELS, Belgium, October 29, 2012 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that on October 26, 2012 its board of directors authorized the company to enter into additional share repurchase program. This board authorization allows for the repurchase of further $400 million of common shares at the discretion of management for period until December 31, 2014. Since the initiation of WABCO’s ongoing share buyback program of $400 million commenced June 2011, the company has repurchased 6,409,012 million shares for $340.2 million open market transactions as of October 26, 2012. Together with the new program, WABCO is now authorized to repurchase up to $459.8 million of shares between now and December 31, 2014. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded over 140 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. With sales of $2.8 billion 2011, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Delivers Robust Operating Margin Amid Sudden Downturn Key Markets; Adjusts Guidance for Full Year 2012 WABCO Reports Q3 2012 Results; Delivers Robust Operating Margin Amid Sudden Downturn Key Markets; Adjusts Guidance for Full Year 2012 Q3 2012 sales of $588 million, down 7.2 percent local currencies and down 16.7 percent U.S. dollars from year ago Q3 2012 operating margin of 13.0 percent on performance basis, down from 13.4 percent year ago; operating margin of 12.4 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, down from 13.1 percent year ago Q3 2012 diluted EPS of $1.02 on performance basis, down from $1.19 year ago; diluted EPS of $1.19 on U.S. GAAP basis, down from $1.22 year ago In Q3 2012, WABCO generated $112.6 million net cash from operating activities and $90.2 million of free cash flow, excluding payments of $4.3 million for streamlining and separation activities, resulting conversion rate of 136 percent of performance net income attributable to the company, bringing year-to-date 2012 conversion rate to 102 percent As announced on October 29, 2012, WABCO is now authorized to repurchase up to $459.8 million of shares through December 31, 2014 Previously disclosed guidance for full year 2012 sales is adjusted to decline between 4 and 5 percent local currencies and full year 2012 diluted EPS on performance basis is narrowed to now range from $4.28 to $4.38, while full year 2012 diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis is adjusted to now range from $4.54 to $4.64 BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 2, 2012 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today reported Q3 2012 sales of $588 million, down 7.2 percent local currencies from year ago and down 16.7 percent U.S. dollars, reflecting sudden downturn key markets. “We had previously stated that markets across all regions would be uncertain and unstable throughout 2012 but Q3 2012 market conditions further deteriorated beyond what we expected as global truck and bus production declined 12 percent year on year and 8 percent versus the previous quarter,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Western Europe, our largest market, accelerated its downturn as new truck and bus builds declined 11 percent versus year ago and 16 percent versus Q2 2012. In addition, North America reversed its growth trend Q3 2012 as the market contracted almost 2 percent year on year and 16 percent versus the previous quarter,” said Esculier. “Furthermore, truck and bus production China dropped 17 percent year on year and 11 percent versus the previous quarter.” “Nonetheless, WABCO delivered solid performance operating margin at 13.0 percent Q3 2012 as we acted quickly to mitigate this sudden downturn, further demonstrating WABCO’s strong execution of business fundamentals across our global organization,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s business from emerging markets continued to benefit from increased adoption of our technologies, resulting higher value of WABCO content per vehicle,” said Esculier. “Also Q3 2012, our aftermarket business delivered its best quarter ever.” WABCO reported Q3 2012 performance operating income of $76.4 million versus $94.5 million year ago, and operating income $73.2 million on U.S. GAAP basis versus $92.4 million year ago. WABCO reported Q3 2012 performance operating margin of 13.0 percent, down from 13.4 percent year ago, and operating margin 12.4 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, down from 13.1 percent year ago. WABCO reported Q3 2012 performance net income attributable to the company of $66.3 million or $1.02 per diluted share versus $81.9 million or $1.19 per diluted share year ago, and Q3 2012 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $77.5 million or $1.19 per diluted share versus $83.8 million or $1.22 per diluted share year ago. Q3 2012 U.S. GAAP results benefitted from several discrete tax items. WABCO generated $112.6 million net cash from operating activities Q3 2012, resulting free cash flow of $85.9 million. Excluding payments of $4.3 million for streamlining and separation activities, free cash flow $90.2 million, which is conversion rate of 136 percent of performance net income attributable to the company, bringing year-to-date 2012 conversion rate to 102 percent. “WABCO’s Q3 2012 results demonstrate how the company consistently and efficiently flexes with changes market demand to continue to deliver outstanding value for our shareowners,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s fundamentals remain firmly place as we continue to mitigate the impact of sales declines on our margins.” “WABCO’s Operating System, one of our industry’s most advanced management environments, continued to enable fast and flexible responses to significant market changes. It generated $17.1 million of materials and conversion productivity Q3 2012, another solid result. Gross materials productivity represented 5.3 percent of total materials cost but, as expected, the impact of commodity inflation reduced net materials productivity to 4.6 percent,” said Esculier. “Q3 2012 another robust quarter throughout our organization for conversion productivity, which we delivered at 6.1 percent, while at the same time continuously flexing capacity to address changes market demand.” As previously announced, WABCO’s board of directors authorized the company on October 26, 2012 to enter into additional share repurchase program. This board authorization allows for the repurchase of further $400 million of common shares at the discretion of management for period until December 31, 2014. Since the initiation of WABCO’s ongoing share buyback program of $400 million commenced June 2011, the company has repurchased 6,409,012 million shares for $340.2 million open market transactions as of October 26, 2012. Together with the new program, as of October 26, 2012, WABCO is authorized to repurchase up to $459.8 million of shares through December 31, 2014. Recent Highlights WABCO announced Q3 2012 that it has acquired Ephicas, pioneering company the field of aerodynamic solutions for commercial vehicles. WABCO develop range of aerodynamic products – branded OptiFlow™ – designed to increase vehicle efficiency and reduce fuel consumption for trucks, trailers and buses. WABCO’s first product introduction is innovative aerodynamic SideWing for trailers. Already installed within 17 major European fleets, SideWing delivers long-haul fuel savings up to 5 percent. Independent tests show these results are up to 3 times greater than those from comparable competitive products. In Q3 2012, WABCO reported that it has entered into new agreement with GAZ Group, Russia’s leading manufacturer of commercial vehicles. WABCO is sole supplier of anti-lock braking systems (ABS) for heavy-duty trucks, and the company supply ABS for series production of Ural trucks and GAZ Group’s whole line of buses. WABCO supply its innovative integrated system for electronic tire pressure monitoring, IVTM™, for series production of low-floor LIAZ buses for Moscow’s public bus fleet. GAZ Group has been customer of WABCO since 2005. The Meritor WABCO joint venture North America reported Q3 2012 that WABCO’s anti-lock braking system (ABS) is now standard equipment on all Navistar’s International® ProStar®+ and LoneStar® class 8 trucks. These vehicles from Navistar Inc. add to the more than 7 million ABS systems already produced by WABCO for the North American market. Also Q3 2012, WABCO presented its breakthrough hydraulic anti-lock braking systems (ABS). This technology is the industry’s first and unique range of hydraulic ABS that integrates electronic stability control (ESC) for trucks and buses worldwide. As the first supplier to bring such technology to market, WABCO helps original equipment manufacturers to respond to government regulations that increasingly require ESC on different classes of commercial vehicles. From 2013 onward, national authorities be implementing ESC legislation Europe, Asia, and North and South America. WABCO introduced OnLane™ technology, lane departure warning system (LDWS) for trucks and buses, Q3 2012. OnLane marks WABCO’s next step advanced driver assistance systems. OnLane increases vehicle safety by providing the driver with visual and acoustic warnings or optional seat-vibration warning, during unintentional lane departure, which is one of the most common causes of accidents involving commercial vehicles. OnLane is fully compliant with the European Union’s regulation that requires LDWS on new trucks and buses as of November 2013. WABCO INDIA inaugurated its second world-class manufacturing facility at Mahindra World City Chennai, India, during Q3 2012. The company now owns and operates four world-class manufacturing sites located India. WABCO’s Plant 2 at Mahindra World City manufacture leading technologies and innovative products to supply commercial vehicle manufacturers Germany, Japan, Poland, and the United States, among other markets internationally. The new plant employ 160 people, including 30 engineers. Recently, WABCO announced that its TrailerGUARD™ telematics system with remote diagnostics technology for trailer fleet management has won the 2012 Telematics Award for logistics and transport, top industry honor. TrailerGUARD’s new remote diagnostics function is the industry’s first of its kind for trailer’s electronic braking and air suspension control system. It allows remote diagnosis by providing information about the trailer’s technical status real-time. WABCO said Q3 2012 that it has been recognized with top award for quality achievement throughout 2011 by PACCAR, global technology leader the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality commercial trucks. PACCAR honored WABCO’s manufacturing facility Meppel, the Netherlands, which supplies vehicle parts and components for DAF trucks series production at quality levels that equal or exceed PACCAR’s requirements. Full Year 2012 Guidance Based on prevailing market conditions, WABCO revises its guidance for 2012 to now indicate estimated 2012 sales to decline between 4 and 5 percent local currencies, which is adjusted from previous guidance for sales growth to range between negative 2 percent and positive 3 percent local currencies. WABCO narrows its guidance for 2012 performance operating margin to now range from 13.4 to 13.6 percent versus its previous guidance to range from 12.8 to 13.8 percent, while operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis is adjusted to now range from 13.1 to 13.3 percent, versus its previous guidance to range from 12.5 to 13.5 percent, resulting updated diluted earnings per share on performance basis to range from $4.28 to $4.38 versus previous guidance to range from $4.30 to $4.80, and diluted earnings per share on U.S. GAAP basis is updated to now range from $4.54 to $4.64 versus previous guidance to range from $4.42 to $4.92. WABCO now expects to convert around 90 percent of its net income attributable to the company into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with streamlining and separation activities, upgrade of the company’s previous guidance for conversion rate between 80 and 90 percent. “Although the market downturn Q3 2012 sudden, WABCO remained well prepared to protect our margins,” said Esculier. “Looking ahead, we expect to achieve full year 2012 operating margin that equals or exceeds the record level that we set 2011 on performance basis.” “WABCO’s three-pillar strategy – technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution – continues to power the future success of WABCO,” said Esculier. “Even these uncertain times, we remain fully confident our ability to continue to deliver maximum value for WABCO’s shareowners.” Conference Call WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jacques Esculier and Chief Financial Officer Ulrich Michel discuss WABCO’s results and outlook on conference call at 9 a.m. Eastern Time today. It be webcast at www.wabco-auto.com where the press release and financial information be available under "WABCO Q3 2012 Results." The call is accessible by telephone listen only mode. Replay dial-in number is +1 404 537 3406 and U.S. toll-free dial-in number is 855 859 2056. Pass code is 34780403. National Platinum Supplier Award TROY, Mich., (Nov. 12, 2012) – Meritor WABCO, leader advanced safety systems and efficient air system solutions for the commercial vehicle industry, captured the 2012 Platinum Supplier Award from Wabash National Corp. during its annual supplier conference. Meritor WABCO, Wabash National supplier for more than 20 years, is the only supplier to earn this top honor for five consecutive years. Wabash National recognizes key suppliers that exceed expectations meeting increased demand and maximizing productivity. Based on Wabash’s supplier ratings, the Platinum Supplier Award is presented for excellence supply chain performance, delivery, quality, cost and innovation. “It’s one thing to offer great products that meet our customers’ needs, but we believe that it’s our service team – the largest and most knowledgeable the industry – that enables us to stay ahead of customer expectations,” said Mark Melletat, director, Trailer Systems, Meritor WABCO. “Receiving recognition like this – year after year – reinforces that Meritor WABCO is staying aligned with our customer’s vision.” Meritor WABCO provides trailer anti-lock braking systems (ABS), roll stability systems (RSS) and InfoLink data gateway systems that support axle control systems and tire inflation systems. About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency-smart components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension and control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading global suppliers back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100-year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides the JV the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Automotive Control Systems, Inc., wholly-owned subsidiary of WABCO Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:WBC), provides breakthrough technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For more information, visit meritorwabco.com . Recognition from U.S. Industry Association for Participation Setting Standards for Air Management Technology to Equip Public Buses BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 16, 2010 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that the American Public Transportation Association (APTA), leading industry organization to improve public transportation, has recognized WABCO for its participation APTA’s Standards Development Program. In particular, APTA recognizes WABCO’s contribution setting technical standards for air supply systems and air compressors to equip public bus fleets the United States and Canada. APTA’s Standards Development Program is based on industry consensus involving suppliers, original equipment manufacturers, government agencies and public organizations engaged mass transit through bus fleets. It provides standard bus procurement guidelines and recommended practices for public authorities and bus fleet operators. “APTA’s Standards Development Program is great asset to the transit industry, and we thank WABCO for its ongoing participation,” said William Millar, APTA President. “We greatly appreciate WABCO’s time, outstanding effort, technical research, field testing and overall dedication to this successful industry program that helps advance public bus fleets.” “We are proud to support APTA and contribute WABCO’s technology leadership gained from decades of experience serving bus makers and fleet operators around the world,” said Nikhil Varty, WABCO Vice President, Compression and Braking. “Our passion is to continue upgrading industry standards of air management performance for all bus applications, and we are delighted to do together with industry colleagues under APTA’s leadership. APTA and its members help ensure that public bus transportation is safer, cleaner, greener, more comfortable and more accessible communities throughout the United States and Canada.” About the American Public Transport Association The American Public Transportation Association (APTA) is nonprofit international association of more than 1,500 public and private member organizations, engaged the areas of bus, paratransit, light rail, commuter rail, subways, waterborne passenger services, and high-speed rail. This includes: transit systems; planning, design, construction, and finance firms; product and service providers; academic institutions; transit associations and state departments of transportation. More than 90 percent of the people using public transportation the United States and Canada are served by APTA member systems. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $1.5 billion 2009, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Volkswagen Konzerns BRÜSSEL, Belgien, 1. Dezember 2010 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeug- Automobilindustrie beliefert Volkswagen Konzern Vakuumpumpen. Die Pumpen sofort Serienproduktion zweier Dieselmotorgruppen Einsatz: 1,6 Liter Dieselmotor Volkswagen 3,0 Liter V6 Dieselmotor Audi. Die ausgereifte Vakuumpumpen-Technologie WABCO basiert Drehschieberprinzip, Schieber über Rotor direkt angetrieben wird. Diese Technologie erstmalig 2001 Markt gebracht ermöglicht kompakten Bauweise geringstmöglicher Leistungsaufnahme Verbesserung Kraftstoffeffizienz niedrigere CO 2 -Emissionen. „Wir erhöhen fortlaufend Leistungsfähigkeit motorgetriebenen Vakuumpumpen Pkw. Die Pumpentechnologie Drehschieberprinzip WABCO bietet Automobilherstellern hervorragende Möglichkeit Kraftstoffeffizienz Fahrzeuge steigern, leistet Beitrag für sauberere umweltfreundlichere Fahrzeuge,“ Mike Thompson, WABCO Vice President, Car Systems. „Wir arbeiten großer Leidenschaft daran, fortwährend innovative Lösungen entwickeln, kosteneffizient einfach installieren sind, weltweit stark wachsenden Nachfrage Hochleistungsvakuumpumpen geringster Leistungsaufnahme gerecht werden.“ WABCO verfügt über 50 Jahre Erfahrung Entwicklung Produktion Vakuumpumpen liefert Pkw-Hersteller weltweit. Die Vakuumpumpen für Pkw WABCO Standorten Europa Werk Qingdao, China hergestellt. Über WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) weltweit führenden Anbieter für Sicherheits- Regelsysteme für Nutzfahrzeuge. Seit 140 Jahren WABCO federführend Entwicklung elektronischen, mechanischen mechatronischen Technologien für Brems-, Stabilitäts-, Federungs- automatische Antriebssysteme für schwere Nutzfahrzeuge. Zu unseren Kunden gehören führenden Lkw-, Anhänger- Bushersteller Welt. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Factory Chennai Wins India’s Two Top Awards for Manufacturing Excellence WABCO Factory Chennai Wins India’s Two Top Awards for Manufacturing Excellence BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 7, 2010 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO India has won the 2010 India Manufacturing Excellence Award (IMEA) with Super Platinum distinction. It marks the third year that WABCO’s site Chennai has been awarded IMEA platinum certification, resulting IMEA Consistency Award to recognize the site’s honors 2007, 2009 and 2010. The Economic Times (ET)-India Manufacturing Excellence Awards partnership with Frost & Sullivan is India’s largest on-site assessment of manufacturing practices benchmarked against global standards. At recent ceremony Mumbai, the jury of ET and Frost & Sullivan experts named the WABCO manufacturing facility Chennai as IMEA 2010 Super Platinum recognition of the site’s highest score among all other awardees 2010. IMEA’s assessment comprises 12 categories of manufacturing practices, including customer focus, supply chain management and quality systems, among other operational and business measurements. All award submissions are evaluated by global consulting firm Frost & Sullivan whose expert team conducts further assessment during site audit among short list of candidates. “Everyone at WABCO India is proud, once again, to be selected for this outstanding national award, particularly because the Economic Times partnership with Frost & Sullivan recognizes that our Chennai site continuously achieves and sustains manufacturing excellence,” said P. Kaniappan, Managing Director, WABCO India. “We are delighted that the judges have honored us with their IMEA Consistency Award as we are now platinum certified for three years, further showing our world class success.” “WABCO takes great pride India for winning the highest possible award this internationally acclaimed industry assessment,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “The Economic Times and Frost & Sullivan’s judges look for diligence, perseverance, foresight, and dedication to sustain successful lean manufacturing and continuous learning. Our facility Chennai has accomplished yet another superlative achievement, gaining further recognition of its superb manufacturing capabilities as it continues to demonstrate its global competitiveness.” In 2009, addition to being named IMEA Super Platinum, WABCO India honored with the Gold Award for Manufacturing Excellence from the Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India, leading industry group. The company previously won Deming Prize for total quality management, the first awarded to company India; Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) Excellence Award from the Japan Institute of Plant Maintenance; and Japan Quality Medal, the first awarded to company India. Münchener Gerichtsentscheid: Zurückweisung Berufung Knorr-Bremse Urteil Verletzung deutschen Wettbewerbsrechts BRÜSSELS, Belgien / MÜNCHEN, 8. Dezember 2010 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie bekanntgegeben, Berufung Knorr-Bremse Systeme für Nutzfahrzeuge GmbH (Knorr-Bremse) früheres Gerichtsurteil zurückgewiesen wurde, Gericht Knorr-Bremse Verletzung deutschen Wettbewerbsrechts verurteilt hatte. Das Oberlandesgericht München 2. Dezember 2010 Berufung Knorr-Bremse zurückgewiesen einstweilige Verfügung 19. Oktober 2009 bestätigt. Mit einstweiligen Verfügung Knorr-Bremse untersagt, gegenüber Kunden behaupten, WABCO Bremssysteme Patente Knorr-Bremse verletze gleichzeitig gemeinsamen Kunden Vertraulichkeits­verpflichtung aufzuerlegen, abzuhalten, WABCO über Vorwürfe Knorr-Bremse diskutieren. Das Gericht bestätigte, Knorr-Bremse WABCO Kunden vorsätzlich unmöglich hatte, WABCO über Patentverletzungsvorwürfe Knorr-Bremse sprechen. Dieses Verhalten stelle Verletzung deutschen Wettbewerbsrechts dar, WABCO hierdurch Möglichkeit genommen sei, Vorwurf Patentverletzung stellen. Wie 20. Januar 2010 gegeben, Landgericht München Widerspruch Knorr-Bremse Fall Gunsten WABCO entschieden. Knorr-Bremse legte Entscheidung anschließend Berufung ein. Am 2. Dezember Berufung Oberlandesgericht München zurückgewiesen. WABCO teilt mit, Münchener Gerichte hätten verschiedenen Gelegenheiten Fall konsistent Gunsten WABCO entschieden. WABCO bestätigt Überzeugung, WABCO rechtswirksames Patent verletzt, Behauptungen Knorr-Bremse beziehen. WABCO legt Wert faires ethisch korrektes Wettbewerbsumfeld bekräftigt erneut Einsatz Wahrung Interessen Interessen Kunden. Das Unternehmen erfreut, Mitarbeiter, Kunden Nutzfahrzeugbranche wissen, WABCO erneut erfolgreich unrechtmäßige Geschäftsgebaren Wettbewerbers verteidigt hat. Die Münchener Gerichte entschieden, Verhalten Knorr-Bremse unlautere Behinderung Geschäftsbeziehung WABCO Kunden darstellt. Seit 140 Jahren WABCO federführend Entwicklung elektronischen, mechanischen mechatronischen Technologien für Brems-, Stabilitäts-, Federungs- automatische Antriebssysteme für schwere Nutzfahrzeuge. Zu unseren Kunden gehören führenden Lkw-, Anhänger- Bushersteller Welt.
