Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Wins Two Top Supplier Awards for Third Year Row at CNHTC, China’s Largest Manufacturer of Heavy Duty Trucks WABCO Wins Two Top Supplier Awards for Third Year Row at CNHTC, China’s Largest Manufacturer of Heavy Duty Trucks BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 15, 2010 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO has been honored with multiple top supplier awards for the third year row by China National Heavy Truck Corporation (CNHTC), the largest manufacturer of heavy duty trucks China. Recently, CNHTC Truck Company honored WABCO with its 2010 Excellent Supplier Award for overall superlative performance and outstanding commercial partnership. In addition, CNHTC Truck Company recognized WABCO with its 2010 Quality Improvement Award for significantly high quality across products, delivery and after sales service. As previously announced, for its performance during 2009, WABCO had won Best Supplier Award from CNHTC Engine Company as well as Best Quality Supplier and Best Support Awards from CNHTC Special Purpose Vehicle Company. WABCO had previously won Best Supplier Award and two Best Quality Awards from the CNHTC organization recognition of WABCO’s performance during 2008. “We are proud to win CNHTC’s top awards for excellence and quality 2010 as we successfully satisfied our customer’s diverse and dynamic needs while demonstrating speed and flexibility. For the third year row, CNHTC’s recognition marks WABCO as strong brand of reference China powered by our local people, manufacturing sites and sourcing capabilities,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia. “We are passionate about quality and reliability all our products and services, particularly as we produce China some of WABCO’s most advanced technologies to better serve local customers.” A supplier to CNHTC since 1997, WABCO furnishes air management products, braking systems including anti-lock braking systems (ABS) and transmission control products. WABCO provides CNHTC with automated manual transmission (AMT) systems on sole supplier basis through 2016. In December 2008, CNHTC became the world’s first original equipment manufacturer to adopt WABCO OptiDrive™ technology volume production. WABCO’s OptiDrive system, breakthrough transmission automation technology, is modular AMT solution for commercial vehicles. It is recipient of the 2010 Automotive News PACE™ Award, the automotive industry’s benchmark for innovation. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $1.5 billion 2009, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that the company has raised its full year 2010 guidance due to stronger than expected aftermarket sales growth, further increased demand from original equipment manufacturers Europe and stronger than anticipated demand from customers China during the fourth quarter. “Our business is developing even more favorably than we expected two months ago as severe winter conditions Europe boost aftermarket sales and additional customer demand Europe and China further grows our fourth quarter revenues,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “As we prepare to enter 2011, our expanding backlog means keeping factories running during year-end holidays, which turn further increase volume productivity. We see more favorable impacts from year-end activities Q4 2010 than previously expected.” WABCO now expects estimated increase Q4 2010 sales of 41.5 to 43.5 percent local currencies or $623 to $633 million (at EUR to USD exchange rate of 1.37), which is up from 35 to 40 percent local currencies or $595 to $615 million (at EUR to USD exchange rate of 1.35) the company’s previous guidance. WABCO has raised its Q4 2010 guidance for performance operating margin to range from 12.0 to 12.5 percent, up from its previous guidance of 9.0 to 10.0 percent, and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to range from 11.2 to 11.7 percent, up from its previous guidance of 8.9 to 9.9 percent. Furthermore, WABCO has raised its Q4 2010 guidance for diluted earnings per share on performance basis to range from $0.88 to $0.93, upgrade of previous guidance that ranged from $0.62 to $0.72. WABCO has adjusted its Q4 2010 guidance for diluted earnings per share on U.S. GAAP basis to range from $0.89 to $0.94 per share, replacing previous guidance ranging from $0.64 to $0.74 per share. As result of upgraded Q4 2010 guidance, WABCO is raising its full year 2010 guidance to estimated increase 2010 sales of 47 to 48 percent local currencies or $2,172 to $2,182 million (at EUR to USD exchange rate of 1.33), which is up from 46 to 47 percent local currencies or $2,144 to $2,164 million (at EUR to USD exchange rate of 1.325) the company’s previous guidance. WABCO has raised its full year 2010 guidance for performance operating margin to range from 10.4 to 10.6 percent, up from its previous guidance of 9.7 to 10.0 percent, and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to range from 9.8 to 10.0 percent, up from its previous guidance of 9.4 to 9.7 percent. In addition, WABCO has raised its full year 2010 guidance for diluted earnings per share on performance basis to range from $2.73 to $2.78, upgrade of previous guidance that ranged from $2.47 to $2.57. WABCO has adjusted its full year 2010 guidance for diluted earnings per share on U.S. GAAP basis to loss ranging from $3.59 to $3.54 per share, replacing previous guidance of loss ranging from $3.85 to $3.75 per share. “Market developments continue to create increasingly better conditions for WABCO to perform on our three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, global expansion and excellence execution,” said Esculier. “Entering 2011, we continue to expect strong momentum on path of growth while sustaining the outstanding success of WABCO.” About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $1.5 billion 2009, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Appoints Mary Petrovich to Board of Directors, Further Diversifying Board’s Experience WABCO Appoints Mary Petrovich to Board of Directors, Further Diversifying Board’s Experience BRUSSELS, Belgium, October 21, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that on October 18, 2011 its board of directors increased the size of the board to nine members and appointed Mary L. Petrovich to fill the new position. Ms Petrovich’s appointment is effective as of November 1, 2011, and she serve on the board’s Audit Committee. Ms Petrovich is former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of AxleTech International, leading global supplier of off-highway and specialty vehicle drivetrain technology, which is General Dynamics company (NYSE: GD). Presently, Ms Petrovich is director at three companies: Woodward (NASDAQ: WWD), leading manufacturer and service provider of energy controls for global infrastructure equipment; GT Advanced Technologies (NASDAQ: GTAT), global provider of technology and materials for the solar, LED and other specialty markets; and Modine Manufacturing Company (NYSE: MOD), global provider of thermal management technology and systems. “This appointment further diversify our board’s global experience as we continue to pursue our three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Mary Petrovich has broad understanding of our industry and extensive experience with commercial vehicle technologies as we continue to globalize our passion for innovation.” About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.2 billion 2010, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Posts 20% Organic Sales Growth; Delivers Another Quarter of Strong Profitability; Maintains Guidance for 2011 WABCO Reports Q3 2011 Results; Posts 20% Organic Sales Growth; Delivers Another Quarter of Strong Profitability; Maintains Guidance for 2011 Q3 2011 sales of $706 million, up 20 percent local currencies and up 30 percent on U.S. GAAP basis from year ago Q3 2011 operating margin of 13.4 percent on performance basis, up from 10.3 percent year ago; operating margin of 13.1 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, up from 10.1 percent year ago Q3 2011 diluted EPS of $1.19 on performance basis, up from $0.71 year ago; diluted EPS of $1.22 on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $0.66 year ago In Q3 2011, WABCO generated $103.7 million net cash from operating activities and $83.1 million of free cash flow, excluding payments for streamlining and separation activities, resulting conversion rate of 101 percent of performance net income Maintains full year 2011 guidance BRUSSELS, Belgium, October 27, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today reported Q3 2011 sales of $706 million, up 20 percent local currencies from year ago and up 30 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, reflecting the industry’s strong global growth. “Q3 2011 marked yet another period of consistently robust results as we generated significant sales growth of 20 percent local currencies while continuing to deliver superior level of incremental operating profit margin at 29 percent, thus continuing at near-record levels profitability,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Propelled by the global growth our industry, our third quarter results mark how WABCO continues to demonstrate its ability to outperform the overall market, improve productivity and deliver high incremental profitability.” “During Q3 2011, the commercial vehicle industry continued to develop strongly as Europe, North America and South America generated double-digit growth production of trucks and buses. WABCO continued to outperform the overall market globally,” said Esculier. “In Q3 2011, China, India and Brazil still produced 58 percent of the world’s trucks and buses. WABCO further benefited from our well anchored position these emerging markets where we successfully maintain increasing level of adoption of WABCO technologies and systems, resulting higher value of WABCO content per vehicle.” WABCO reported Q3 2011 performance operating income of $94.5 million, two thirds higher than $56.4 million year ago, while operating income $92.4 million on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $54.8 million year ago. The ratio of the increase performance operating income Q3 2011 and the 20 percent increase sales represents incremental operating margin of 29 percent, excluding the impact from foreign exchange translation. WABCO reported Q3 2011 performance operating margin of 13.4 percent, up from 10.3 percent year ago, while operating margin 13.1 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, up from 10.1 percent year ago. WABCO reported Q3 2011 performance net income of $81.9 million or $1.19 per diluted share, up from $47.1 million or $0.71 per diluted share year ago, and Q3 2011 U.S. GAAP net income of $83.8 million or $1.22 per diluted share, up from $44.0 million or $0.66 per diluted share year ago. WABCO generated $103.7 million net cash from operating activities Q3 2011, resulting free cash flow of $83.1 million, excluding payments of $8.5 million for streamlining and separation activities, which is conversion rate of 101 percent of performance net income. “Q3 2011 marks another quarter of superior results, showing how WABCO consistently and efficiently transforms strong global sales growth into robust profitability,” said Esculier. “WABCO delivered operating margin of 13.4 percent on performance basis, which ranks near our all-time record of 13.6 percent for performance operating margin that we achieved the previous quarter. We delivered Q3 2011 performance net income of $81.9 million, very close to WABCO’s record that we set last quarter.” “WABCO’s Operating System, one of our industry’s most advanced management environments, continues to yield high level of productivity. It generated $17.3 million of materials and conversion productivity Q3 2011. Gross materials productivity represented 4.9 percent of total materials cost but, as expected, the impact of commodity inflation reduced net materials productivity to 3.1 percent,” said Esculier. “Q3 2011 another powerful quarter throughout our organization for conversion productivity, which surged to record level of 6.3 percent, marking commanding achievement, particularly long series of consecutive quarters of high growth.” Since the inception of WABCO’s share buyback program announced on May 27, 2011, the company has repurchased 2.4 million shares for $131 million open market transactions while maintaining strong balance sheet with positive net cash position of $36.0 million as of September 30, 2011. Recent Highlights On October 6, WABCO announced that it has entered into long term agreement with IVECO to supply innovative anti-lock braking systems (ABS) with WABCO’s breakthrough ESCsmart™ technology that certifies electronic stability control (ESC) for commercial vehicles. IVECO is global manufacturer of commercial vehicles headquartered Italy. WABCO’s ABS and ESCsmart technologies equip Eurocargo Euro 6 medium duty on-road trucks starting 2013 for series production Europe. WABCO’s ESCsmart is the commercial vehicle industry’s first and most efficient technology of its kind to homologate ESC, saving significant time and labor for truck and bus manufacturers. In Q3 2011, WABCO reported that it supply its breakthrough c-comp™ clutchable air compressor technology to global customer headquartered Europe, one of the world’s largest manufacturers of heavy duty trucks, as part of the multi-year extension of major long-term agreement to supply advanced air compression technology. WABCO c-comp air compressors allow fuel savings up to 264 gallons (1,000 liters) on long haul applications annually while reducing the vehicle’s carbon dioxide emissions by as much as 5,700 pounds (2,600 kilograms). Deliveries worldwide start 2013 support of the customer’s truck engines that meet upcoming EURO VI emission standards. During Q3 2011, WABCO entered into new agreements with several major customers to supply advanced safety technologies and systems for series production. For example, WABCO supply KAMAZ with anti-lock braking systems (ABS) that are integrated with anti-slip controls (ASR) to improve braking and driving performance. KAMAZ is the largest manufacturer of commercial vehicles the Russian Federation. WABCO supply Van Hool with Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) for buses. Van Hool, based Belgium, is one of the industry’s largest independent manufacturers of buses. WABCO disclosed Q3 2011 that it has entered into multi-year agreement with leading global automaker General Motors to supply innovative mechanical vacuum pump technology for gasoline direct-injection (GDI) engines passenger cars to be produced North America, Europe and Asia. Series production is expected to begin 2012. WABCO’s industry-leading vacuum pump technology offers compact, light-weight design with ultra-low power consumption attributes. WABCO announced Q3 2011 that its subsidiary WABCO India has been honored with two excellence awards from TATA Motors, India’s largest manufacturer of commercial vehicles. TATA Motors has recognized WABCO for “Excellence Technology and Innovation” and “Excellence Quality.” WABCO currently supplies TATA Motors with extensive range of products and systems related to braking as well as air generation and management for trucks and buses. TATA Motors is the world's fourth largest truck manufacturer and the world's second largest bus manufacturer. WABCO reported Q3 2011 that it has been honored Brazil with ZF South America’s first Sustainability Award for best performance sustainable practices. ZF is leading worldwide automotive supplier for driveline and chassis technology headquartered Germany. For this award, ZF’s supplier must have environmental management systems certified as ISO 14001 compliant as well as Occupational Health and Safety Assessment Series (OHSAS) 18001 certification. The supplier must demonstrate strong results on four out of five sustainability pillars: environment, society, education, culture and sports. WABCO supplies ZF with conventional and advanced technologies and components for transmission automation and driveline controls. Also Q3 2011, WABCO presented its new IVTM™ system, which is the company’s latest breakthrough technology for integrated monitoring of tire pressure on trucks, trailers and buses. Together with TrailerGUARD™ telematics, IVTM provides drivers and fleet operators with real-time tire pressure information. It helps maintain tire inflation at optimum level and, as result, reduces fuel consumption by up to 2 percent while increasing the lifetime of tires by up to 20 percent. It improves vehicle safety as correct tire inflation enables better road handling and shorter braking distance. Recently, the Meritor WABCO joint venture North America announced that it intends to form strategic alliance with Takata, global leader safety systems, to develop new active safety system products for commercial vehicles North America. Starting now, Meritor WABCO markets and distributes Takata’s SafeTraK® lane departure warning systems for trucks and trailers. The proposed alliance complements and enhances Meritor WABCO’s portfolio of industry-leading active safety technology such as OnGuard™ collision safety systems and SmartTrac™ stability control systems. WABCO Maintains Full Year 2011 Guidance WABCO maintains its previously disclosed full year 2011 guidance: sales growth to range from 22 to 25 percent local currencies; full year performance operating margin to range from 13.2 to 13.8 percent and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to range from 12.8 to 13.4 percent; and diluted earnings per share on performance basis to range from $4.55 to $4.80 and on U.S. GAAP basis to range from $5.01 to $5.26. WABCO maintains that it expects to convert between 80 and 90 percent of its full year 2011 performance net income into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with streamlining and separation activities. “We continue to leverage WABCO’s three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution, enabling our global organization to take fast, flexible and full advantage of changing market conditions,” said Esculier. “Looking ahead, we expect to continue to outperform the global market while driving productivity gains and continuing to deliver outstanding profitability.” Conference Call WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jacques Esculier and Chief Financial Officer Ulrich Michel discuss WABCO’s results and outlook on conference call at 9 a.m. Eastern Time today. Air Compression to Another Leading Global Manufacturer of Commercial Vehicles BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 16, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, supply its breakthrough c-comp™ clutchable air compression technology to another leading global manufacturer of commercial vehicles headquartered Europe. Series production Europe is expected to begin by the end of 2012 to equip WABCO’s c-comp air compressor on this major customer’s heavy duty truck and bus engines that meet upcoming EURO VI emission standards. WABCO’s breakthrough c-comp air compressor optimally disengages truck or bus compressor from the engine when the vehicle’s air pressure reaches full pressure. As result, it allows fuel savings up to 264 gallons (1,000 liters) on long haul applications annually while reducing the vehicle’s carbon dioxide emissions by as much as 5,700 pounds (2,600 kilograms). “This new agreement marks yet another series adoption of WABCO’s industry-leading air compression technology as we continue to innovate solutions to meet rising standards for vehicle efficiency and environmental sustainability,” said Nikhil Varty, WABCO Vice President, Compression and Braking. “Our breakthrough c-comp air compressors continue to demonstrate WABCO’s technology leadership through outstanding vehicle operating economy and fewer emissions as we help global manufacturers to provide cleaner, greener heavy duty trucks and buses.” About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.2 billion 2010, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. (Nov. 17, 2011) – Meritor WABCO Vehicle Control Systems recently received the prestigious 2011 Platinum Supplier Award from Wabash National Corp. They are the only supplier to receive this award for four consecutive years. During its annual supplier conference, Wabash National recognizes key suppliers that went above and beyond to meet increasing customer demand and maximize productivity. The Platinum Supplier Award is presented for excellence supply chain performance, delivery, quality, cost and innovation. Meritor WABCO supplies trailer anti-lock braking systems (ABS), roll stability systems (RSS) and InfoLink data gateway systems that support axle control systems and the Meritor Tire Inflation System™ (MTIS) by PSI to Wabash National. “Meritor WABCO is the leader trailer ABS and our relationship with Wabash National – along with the honor of receiving this award four consecutive years – further proves our ability to provide top quality supply chain performance,” said Mark Melletat, director, Trailer Systems, Meritor WABCO. “We were the first to provide real-time data communication between the tractor and trailer via our InfoLink™ system, which is used by Wabash National today. We couldn’t be more proud to receive this award and have our products acknowledged by leading trailer manufacturer such as Wabash National.” To support fleet operators with quality Meritor WABCO products and services that meet tight deadlines, industry-leading Customer Service team provides service and support throughout North America. Another Industry First for Advanced Safety Technology China as Part of Contract with Yutong, World’s Largest Manufacturer of Buses BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 29, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, supply its Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) to Yutong China, the world’s largest manufacturer of buses, as part of expanded long-term agreement to furnish advanced safety technologies. It marks the first adoption of ACC technology on commercial vehicle the Chinese market. Series production start the first quarter of 2012 with WABCO ACC as standard feature on Yutong’s range of high-end buses, which includes luxury, intercity, urban, light and hybrid electric buses. Yutong buses are service 27 countries. WABCO’s ACC automatically adjusts the vehicle’s speed to maintain preset distance to the moving vehicle ahead. It reacts with acoustic and visual warning, engine control and, if necessary, partial braking. It improves vehicle safety as well as driver effectiveness and comfort. WABCO continue long-term to supply Yutong with electronic stability control (ESC) and electronic braking systems (EBS) as standard features for series production on Yutong’s range of high-end buses. “We greatly value WABCO’s technology portfolio as it strongly supports our “Super Safety” program comprising ACC, ESC and EBS as standard features on high-end Yutong buses,” said Tang Wang, Deputy Director of Technology, Yutong Bus Company. “We are proud to be the first bus maker China to equip vehicles with ACC, and as result, the safety controls on our premier products are the most advanced the Chinese market.” “We continue to pioneer new technologies for advanced safety and driver effectiveness as demonstrated by Yutong’s choice of WABCO’s ACC to further strengthen their leading position the bus market China and internationally,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia. “Commercial vehicle manufacturers China are increasingly attributing further value to vehicle and road safety, and as result, they are growing their adoption of highly advanced technologies. This trend is driver for increasing WABCO content per vehicle through specially developed, locally adapted systems and products.” WABCO pioneered ESC for commercial vehicles 2001 and has continued to innovate this safety technology ever since. ESC improves directional stability and helps protect against roll-over, skidding and spinning as well as jack-knifing tractor-trailer combinations. WABCO has sold more than 100,000 ESC systems since its introduction. WABCO introduced EBS for heavy duty commercial vehicles 1996 and has maintained its global leadership for this safety technology. EBS shortens the braking distance, enables stable steering throughout the braking procedure and improves driver effectiveness and comfort. It improves brake wear, thus reducing maintenance cost. In addition, WABCO currently supplies Yutong with electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) , braking products and anti-lock braking systems (ABS) . As the inventor of ABS for commercial vehicles, WABCO first to introduce ABS China. WABCO is currently China’s major ABS supplier for trucks and buses. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.2 billion 2010, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Advanced Safety Technologies for Award-Winning Trailer from Krone, Leading European Manufacturer of Agricultural Trailers BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 13, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that it supplies trailer electronic braking systems (T-EBS) with its roll stability support function (RSS) to Krone, leading European manufacturer of agricultural trailers and machinery, and winner of Agritechnica 2011 Innovation Award. Recently held Hanover, Germany, Agritechnica is the world’s largest exhibition for agricultural machinery and equipment. Krone has applied WABCO T-EBS with RSS trailer technologies to the special conditions of agricultural trailers, thus advancing the braking safety of farm trailers and further stabilizing the tractor-trailer combination by selectively braking the trailer’s individual sides. “We are proud to win prestigious Medal for Innovation at Agritechnica 2011, and we value WABCO’s contribution to Krone’s technology leadership our segment of the trailer industry,” said Hermann Jörgens, Head of Brake Systems at Krone Agriculture. “With WABCO’s advanced braking, roll-over control and stability technologies for trailers, Krone continues to improve vehicle safety, particularly as agricultural transport units become even larger and faster.” “Winning Agritechnica Innovation Award demonstrates how Krone continues to set standards for vehicle safety the growing agricultural segment of the global trailer industry,” said Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President, Trailer Systems and Aftermarket. “WABCO is passionate about advancing vehicle safety and improving driver effectiveness as we leverage our commercial trailer innovations off-road, specialty markets, thus increasing WABCO content per vehicle as we strive with trailer customers toward zero accidents.” WABCO’s introduced T-EBS for commercial trailers 1998 and has maintained its global leadership for this safety technology. T-EBS shortens the braking distance and enables stable steering throughout the braking procedure. It improves brake wear, thus reducing maintenance cost. As of 2010, WABCO has sold more than one million trailer electronic braking systems and the company’s newest generation features 20 intelligent functions such as TailGUARD™ , rear blind-spot-detection system with automatic braking. Supplier of the Year’ Award from Leading Aftermarket Trade Association UK for Fourth Time BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 15, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that the Independent Automotive Aftermarket Federation (IAAF) the United Kingdom has named WABCO as “Commercial Vehicle Supplier of the Year” for 2011, marking the fourth time that WABCO has earned this award the last six years. IAAF is the UK’s largest trade association representing independent automotive parts distributors, aftermarket service centers and garages as well as parts manufacturers and importers. “This award recognizes service excellence, high quality products and expert technical support across the UK’s independent automotive aftermarket, and we congratulate WABCO on their success as “Commercial Vehicle Supplier of the Year” for 2011,” said Nick Best, President, Independent Automotive Aftermarket Federation. “It is WABCO’s fourth year winning this top award, achievement unmatched by any other supplier, and another mark of WABCO’s leadership and consistent performance.” “WABCO is proud to be honored once again by the UK’s leading aftermarket trade association, as we are passionate about maximizing customer satisfaction amongst distributors, fleets and vehicle operators,” said Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President, Trailer Systems and Aftermarket. “Our service capabilities and standards differentiate WABCO the aftermarket, thus providing customers with safe, efficient and peak performance over the lifetime of their commercial vehicles.” “This award shows that WABCO has excellent partnership with our distributors as they ensure that our end users receive the right part, at the right time, every time. WABCO distributors support our end users with excellent technical knowledge,” said Chris Chapman, Regional Leader, United Kingdom and North America Aftermarket. “As fleets increasingly operate across borders, our customers value WABCO’s service excellence and product quality not only the UK but throughout the whole European aftermarket.” About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Breakthrough Transmission Automation Technology, Named Finalist for 2010 Automotive News PACE Award BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 3, 2009 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO’s new OptiDrive™ system, breakthrough transmission automation technology, has been named finalist for the 2010 Automotive News PACE™ Awards, the automotive industry’s benchmark for innovation. WABCO’s OptiDrive system, modular automated manual transmission system for medium and heavy duty commercial vehicles, continues the company’s 20-year track record of technology leadership transmission automation. Its high degree of modularity significantly reduces the development time required for application to transmission and vehicle platforms, enabling faster time to market for manufacturers of trucks, buses and transmissions. By optimizing gear shifting, WABCO’s OptiDrive system improves vehicle control and safety while enhancing the driver’s effectiveness. It significantly contributes to decreased fuel consumption and reduced maintenance cost for the vehicle’s powertrain while increasing vehicle efficiency and environmental protection. Jointly presented by & Young, the Transportation Research Center and Automotive News, the Automotive News PACE Awards recognize premiere automotive suppliers’ contribution to excellence as it relates to the manufacture and sales of cars or commercial vehicles. 2010 award winners be announced on April 12, 2010 Detroit, Michigan. “Everyone at WABCO takes great pride having achieved this level of recognition for our OptiDrive system, one of the most creatively engineered products our portfolio,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “The judges of the Automotive News PACE Awards look for game-changing innovations that offer identifiable practical benefits and competitive advantages our industry’s commerce. Our OptiDrive system exemplifies WABCO’s passion for innovation as we strive to grow demand for automated manual transmissions worldwide, particularly emerging markets like China, India, Brazil and Russia where adoption of such systems is expected to expand rapidly.” About the Automotive News PACE Awards Program The Automotive News PACE Awards program, established 1994, honors automotive industry suppliers who have embraced innovation or adapted and reinvented themselves to keep abreast of the constantly rising performance bar of the original equipment manufacturer and the rising expectations of consumers. This prestigious program sets the standard for innovation and excellence and has become significant industry credential. For more information, visit www.autonews.com/PACE , www.ey.com/automotive and http://www.trcpg.com/ About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.6 billion 2008, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. adds Microsoft Windows® 7 compatibility TROY, Mich., (Nov. 6, 2009) – Meritor WABCO Vehicle Control Systems today announced the availability of TOOLBOX ™ 9.0, the latest PC-based diagnostics software for its pneumatic and hydraulic anti-lock braking systems, electronic leveling modules, and electronically-controlled air suspensions. New features TOOLBOX™ 9.0 include: Support for RSS Plus ™ , Meritor WABCO’s trailer-based stability system. Support for the “E” version of Hydraulic ABS (HABS). Support for tractor ABS “E” version 4.3 and Hydraulic Power Brake (HPB) releases 1 and 2. Compatibility with Microsoft Windows ® 7 operating system. “As our vehicle systems become more sophisticated, it’s imperative that diagnostic tools are more intuitive and easier to use,” said Alan Korn, director of vehicle dynamics and controls, Meritor WABCO. “Technicians like working with TOOLBOX ™ 9.0. It’s designed to help them be more efficient and productive and minimize vehicle downtime.” TOOLBOX ™ 9.0 supports the complete range of Meritor WABCO vehicle control products: Pneumatic ABS (D and E Versions) Trailer ABS (Easy-Stop ™ and Enhanced Easy-Stop ™ with PLC) SmartTrac Stability Control (ESC and RSC) and RSS Plus ™ Hydraulic ABS Hydraulic Power Brake (HPB) Electronic leveling valves for tractors and trailers Electronically Controlled Air Suspension (ECAS) for buses Since the introduction of TOOLBOX ™ 1999, Meritor WABCO has been leader the development of PC-based diagnostics for braking and other vehicle control systems. TOOLBOX™ displays both active and stored system faults as well as the corresponding repair instructions. It can display both constant and dynamic information from the braking system under test, and activate components to verify system integrity, correct component operation, and installation wiring. Meritor WABCO TOOLBOX ™ 9.0 requires Microsoft Windows ® XP, Vista, or Windows 7; minimum of 512MB RAM; 60MB HD space for full installation; 64- or 32-bit processor; RP1210A-compliant communications adapter for SAE J1708/J1587 or PLC; and serial, parallel, or USB port for RP1210A adapter. TOOLBOX ™ is distributed by SPX Service Solutions. For order information, call 1-800-328-6657. Technical support is available through Meritor WABCO’s OnTrac ® customer service team at 1-800-535-5560. Development and Supply Agreement with Chery, One of China’s Leading Manufacturers of Passenger Cars BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 24, 2009 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO and Chery Automobile Company Ltd. have completed agreement for product development and the long-term supply of vacuum pumps for automotive braking applications for diesel and gasoline direct injection engines. Chery is one of China’s leading manufacturers of passenger cars and China’s top ranked exporter of cars serving more than 70 countries. WABCO vacuum pumps for automotive braking systems utilize ultra-low power consumption design that helps improve engine efficiency. Using modular design concepts, WABCO vacuum pumps feature range of standard components that increase efficiency manufacturing. WABCO’s highly durable vacuum pumps boost performance braking applications, require reduced oil flow rates, and significantly lower weight due to fewer parts. Vacuum pumps for all Chery engines be produced locally at WABCO’s world-class manufacturing facility located Qingdao, China. “We are proud to partner with Chery as they continue to build successful world brand of passenger cars through innovation and adoption of advanced automotive technologies,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia Pacific. “Chery is recognized as one of the most valuable Chinese brands domestic and overseas car markets alike, powered by their culture of world-class quality and pursuit of world-leading technologies.” “This agreement with Chery marks major achievement for WABCO the Chinese automotive industry and further grows our position emerging markets through deep connectivity with customers, powered by our local people and capabilities,” said Mike Thompson, WABCO Vice President, Car Systems. “We are passionate about continuing to grow our vacuum pump business to help customers globally improve vehicle efficiency and meet increasingly stronger environmental requirements.” About WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.6 billion 2008, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. with Major Truck Manufacturer Europe to Supply Innovative Driveline Pedal Module BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 9, 2009 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that global original equipment manufacturer headquartered Europe has awarded WABCO multi-year contract to supply integrated pedal module to equip heavy- and medium-duty trucks for series production starting 2013. Available for both automated and manual gearboxes, WABCO’s integrated pedal module provides standard interface the vehicle’s cab environment, resulting lower installation costs and optimized logistics original equipment manufacturing processes. Innovatively engineered, WABCO’s pedal module can integrate the throttle and the clutch function together with conventional or electronic braking systems. It is available light-weight plastic or aluminum housing, depending on customer requirements. “This major new opportunity marks the continued growth of our technology-leading position integrated pedal modules for commercial vehicles,” said Hans-Jürgen Sander, WABCO Vice President, Driveline Control. “Our passion is to continue setting new standards of performance, reliability and safety while enabling our customers to further simplify and optimize their production methods through innovative, customer-specific modules that plug and play global manufacturing environments.” About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.6 billion 2008, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Multi-Year Development and Supply Agreement with Yuchai, China’s Largest Manufacturer of Diesel Engines for Trucks and Buses BRUSSELS, Belgium, December 10, 2009 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO and Yuchai Machinery Company Ltd. have completed agreement for product development and the long-term supply of twin-cylinder compressors for diesel engines to be mounted on heavy duty trucks. Yuchai is China’s largest manufacturer of diesel engines for commercial vehicles for the past eight consecutive years and one of China’s leading exporters serving more than 50 countries. WABCO’s twin-cylinder compressor technology features the company’s worldwide modular (WWM) design, benchmark for the commercial vehicle industry that improves cost effectiveness and speeds time to market for engine manufacturers and original equipment makers. Through several innovative engineering breakthroughs, these compressors weigh less and further enhance performance while increasing fuel efficiency and improving environmental friendliness. To be mounted on Yuchai’s YC6K series engines, WABCO compressors be produced at WABCO’s world-class manufacturing facility located China. Trial production begin 2010 and series production early 2011. Based on more than 30 patents, Yuchai’s YC6K series engines represent industry breakthrough by successfully combining cooling technology with high strength materials, enabling the engines to meet Euro VI emission requirements while significantly prolonging the engine’s lifetime. “We are proud to partner with Yuchai as they grow their leading position high grade diesel engines China and internationally through adoption of advanced technologies and environmental sustainability,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia Pacific. “This long-term agreement with Yuchai is another major step forward for WABCO as we continue to expand our compressor business China, powered by our local people and capabilities.” “This significant new business demonstrates our continuous growth as we focus on delivery of highly reliable and innovative compressor products,” said Nikhil Varty, WABCO Vice President, Compression and Braking. “Our agreement with Yuchai confirms WABCO’s number one position air compression technology globally, and particularly China, as we further leverage our ability to provide energy savings and clean air solutions to better serve customers through our outstanding network of product development, sourcing and manufacturing that spans all regions worldwide.” About WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.6 billion 2008, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com About Yuchai Yuchai Machinery Company is China’s largest manufacturer of diesel engines for commercial vehicles and has ranked number one the industry for the past eight consecutive years. Yuchai is one of China’s leading exporters serving more than 50 countries. During the Beijing Olympics, Yuchai the only local supplier of diesel engines for Beijing city buses that satisfied Euro IV emission requirements, successfully contributing to “Green Olympics” together with Cummins. Yuchai’s latest innovation is the YC6K series engine. It be produced by Y&C Engine Company Ltd. Wuhu, Anhui province, the newly formed joint venture of major influential automotive industry players Yuchai Machinery Company Ltd., China International Marine Containers (Group) Company Ltd., and Chery Automobile Company Ltd. With registered capital of RMB 500 million and expected total investment exceeding RMB 1.5 billion, the joint venture ultimately build up annual capacity of 200,000 diesel engines for heavy duty commercial vehicles. The joint venture’s vision is to provide diesel engine assemblies and components that are cost competitive and high quality through application of innovative technologies and advanced management concepts. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO CEO Esculier Addresses Baird’s 2008 Industrial Conference WABCO CEO Esculier Addresses Baird’s 2008 Industrial Conference BRUSSELS, Belgium – November 4, 2008 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that Chief Executive Officer Jacques Esculier deliver presentation about the company’s business on November 11 at the Robert W. Baird & Company 2008 Industrial Conference Chicago, Illinois. Mr. Esculier is scheduled to present on November 11 at 7:45 AM Central Standard Time. In addition to live audio webcast, Mr. Esculier’s presentation be available at http://wabco.client.shareholder.com/ at that time. The audio webcast be archived for 90 days. About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,700 people 31 countries worldwide. In 2007, WABCO’s total sales were $2.4 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange with the stock symbol WBC. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Earns Best Aftermarket Service Award from Beijing Public Transport Corporation Support of 2008 Olympic Games WABCO Earns Best Aftermarket Service Award from Beijing Public Transport Corporation Support of 2008 Olympic Games BRUSSELS, Belgium – November 6, 2008 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that the company has been honored with supplier award for “Best Aftermarket Service” by the Beijing Public Transport Corporation (BPTC) for WABCO’s performance before and during the recent Beijing 2008 Olympic Games and the Beijing Paralympics Games, the sport movement for disabled persons. Operator of the world’s largest municipal bus service, BPTC had chosen WABCO earlier 2008 to provide range of braking products, air suspension systems and aftermarket services before and during Olympic activities Beijing, including support for improved service and maintenance capabilities through technical training and advanced diagnostic systems. Throughout the Olympic period, WABCO provided round-the-clock services for BPTC’s bus fleet, including successful response to more than 210 emergency calls. In addition, to prepare for the Beijing Paralympics Games, many BPTC buses were effectively reconfigured with WABCO’s electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) system, resulting barrier-free buses for transportation of disabled athletes. “Expecting extraordinary public demand on our fleet of more than 20,000 buses during the Olympic period Beijing, we had proactively set very high standards for safety, reliability, efficiency and comfort,” said Xu Guoming, Deputy General Manager of BPTC. “WABCO has contributed significantly to our Olympic success not only by supplying spare parts and service but through their leadership, expert teamwork, technical knowhow and outstanding care. We honor WABCO’s Olympic performance and we look forward to their continued support to meet our long-term needs.” Xu Guoming awarded the BPTC Olympic Honor Medal and Olympic Silk Banner to WABCO at ceremony attended by BPTC officials and WABCO managers recently Beijing. Xu Guoming, Deputy General Manager of BPTC (middle), presents BPTC Olympic Honor to Peter Li of WABCO “This BPTC award for best aftermarket service is truly Olympic achievement. It shows our commitment to customer satisfaction while demonstrating the potential for further growth our aftermarket China,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia Pacific. “We are proud to partner with BPTC and we are passionate about continuing to deliver environmentally friendly, fuel efficient solutions and outstanding service for the world’s largest bus fleet well into the future.” About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,700 people 31 countries worldwide. In 2007, WABCO’s total sales were $2.4 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange with the stock symbol WBC. Support Customers Turkey ISTANBUL, Turkey – November 18, 2008 – WABCO, one of the world’s leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles, has opened marketing and sales office Istanbul to further support customers collaboration with Intermobil, the company’s partner Turkey. “For more than 25 years, together with Intermobil, we have been successfully serving original equipment and aftermarket customers through high standards of quality and service. By adding people and capabilities Turkey, we further reinforce our relationships with local customers,” said Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President, Aftermarket and Trailer Systems. “Given the significant potential of the Turkish commercial vehicle market, we’re passionate about deepening our connections with new and existing customers, as we expand our range of support tools, services and training programs, not only Turkey, but at 450 WABCO service centers and over WABCO 500 service points around the world.” “Customer focus is our shared passion with WABCO as we strive on continual basis to improve services such as applications engineering, program management and technical support,” said Nadine Perahya, Intermobil President. “With WABCO’s increased resources Turkey, we can further combine their international experience with our local market expertise, resulting sustainable benefits that customers increasingly value.” About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,700 people 31 countries worldwide. In 2007, WABCO’s total sales were $2.4 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange with the stock symbol WBC. WABCO Introduces New High and Medium Power Compressors for Electronically Controlled Air Suspension Systems for Passenger Cars and Light Commercial Vehicles BRUSSELS, Belgium – December 2, 2008 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, introduced its second generation compressor series for electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) systems for passenger cars and light commercial vehicles at the Vehicle Dynamics Expo recently held Novi, Michigan, USA. Continuing the company’s 20-year track record of innovative air suspension systems for cars and light vehicles, WABCO’s new high and medium power compressors enable its ECAS technology to achieve constant vehicle ride height even when fully loaded and various vehicle heights at different speeds, thereby further increasing vehicle safety and enhancing passenger comfort. WABCO’s second generation compressor series improves suspension performance, while reducing cost for original equipment manufacturers and making air suspension systems potentially more affordable for end users. The first application is the rear axle air suspension the new BMW 7 series. WABCO reports significant market adoption of air suspension systems luxury cars and sport utility vehicles, while segments such as midsize station wagons, multipurpose vehicles and compact vans represent additional growth opportunities, particularly for rear axle applications on vehicles that carry heavy loads relative to their vehicle weight. “From 2000 to 2008, the global demand for air suspension systems for passenger cars has nearly tripled and we expect continued growth this market,” said Daniel Samson, WABCO Vice President Car Systems and Products. “In addition, original equipment manufacturers seek to increase fuel efficiency further by introducing the air suspension function, which improves vehicle aerodynamics by appropriately lowering the vehicle body at high speeds.” WABCO has further developed its ECAS technology to integrate electronic shock absorber control (ESAC) system. In this combination, ESAC determines the most effective damping level based on load, road surface, speed, vehicle body movement and lateral acceleration. It improves vehicle stability due to diminished roll-rate, further increasing driver and load protection. 20 Years of Innovation Air Suspension Systems In 1986, WABCO introduced its first ECAS system for passenger cars and today offers range of air supply modules and electronic control units for passenger car air suspension systems. WABCO’s mechatronics enabled air supply module combines compressor, air dryer, air spring valves, relay and the electronic control unit, resulting innovative, cost effective and easy-to-install solution. WABCO systems and components are increasingly being installed on passenger cars and light commercial vehicles by major original equipment manufacturers worldwide. About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,700 people 31 countries worldwide. In 2007, WABCO’s total sales were $2.4 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange with the stock symbol WBC. Agreement with Fuwa for Manufacturing of Air Disc Brakes China BRUSSELS, Belgium – December 3, 2008 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO has completed its agreement with Guangdong FUWA Heavy Industry Co., Ltd., (Fuwa) to form joint venture for production of air disc brakes China. Fuwa is the largest manufacturer of commercial trailer axles China and the world. As previously announced, WABCO have 70 percent holding and Fuwa have 30 percent holding the joint venture, which be located at Fuwa’s newly established manufacturing facility Taishan, Guangdong, China. The joint venture encompass manufacturing, assembly and testing of air disc brakes for commercial trailers. Financial details are not being disclosed. “The completion of our partnership agreement with Fuwa is another mark of WABCO’s continued success globalizing our reach and growing our presence across the world,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chief Executive Officer. “Our ambition the next few years is to manufacture air disc brakes to equip up to 250,000 axles.” “This partnership enables WABCO to offer its latest-design air disk brakes with competitive advantages such as robust single-piston technology, light-weight design, and high performance at lowest weight to Fuwa and other commercial vehicle manufacturers,” said Wu Zhiqiang, President of Fuwa. “With WABCO as our strategic partner, we further reinforce our leadership position axles the commercial trailer market, and we achieve the full potential of our long term growth.” “WABCO’s joint manufacturing company with Fuwa establishes major footprint for our air disc brake business China as well as Asia,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia Pacific. “We are passionate about supplying and partnering with commercial vehicle manufacturers China, and now with local production of air disc brakes, WABCO can meet the future needs of local and regional customers.” About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission automation systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,700 people 31 countries worldwide. In 2007, WABCO’s total sales were $2.4 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange with the stock symbol WBC. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Hosts French Guests at FleetDay 2007 WABCO Hosts French Guests at FleetDay 2007 French fleets learn about cost saving opportunities and latest safety technologies for commercial vehicles at WABCO’s annual Aftermarket FleetDay HANOVER, GERMANY – 26. NOVEMBER 2007 – WABCO , one of the leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission control systems for the commercial vehicle industry, recently hosted more than 60 guests from leading French truck fleets and distributors at its annual FleetDays event on the company’s test track Jeversen, Germany. The event combined with visit to the WABCO engineering and manufacturing facility Hannover and its state of the art training center. "Partnership and lively exchange with our customers is very important to us,” said Philippe Ancelly, WABCO Aftermarket Leader, Southern Europe . “At this years’ FleetDays we demonstrated to more than 60 participants that our latest technology innovations do not only contribute to overall vehicle safety, but allow for substantial cost savings thanks to reduced maintenance efforts and less vehicle downtimes – decisive factor for the business success of our French customers." The program featured product presentations and live-demonstrations, including innovations like IVTM (Integrated Vehicle Tire Pressure Monitoring), next generation electronic braking system for trailers (EBS E-Generation), the multi-functional data monitoring system Smart Board and Expert Diagnostics, state of the art diagnostic solution. All of these products and systems improve the reliability of trucks, trailers, and buses, reduce the cost of ownership and offer new differentiating features that create more safety and value for customers worldwide. During the live demonstrations, WABCO engineers showed the performance and benefits of the advanced technologies on the test track. In addition to latest technology innovations the fleets were provided with detailed update on WABCO's service network, one of the largest aftermarket service networks for trucks and heavy commercial vehicles all over Europe. Participants toured the production areas at WABCO’s Hannover engineering and manufacturing facility and were introduced to the WABCO Operating System (WOS), the company’s advanced management system that covers every aspect of how it manages its business. This covers five core processes including Six Sigma Lean manufacturing environment, Common Development Process (CDP) to create and launch innovative and high quality technologies and products using standardized processes and Design for Six Sigma (DFSS) methodology and customer partnership model that defines how WABCO engages and supports its customers across the globe. Detailed information on the WABCO products and systems presented at the FleetDay 2007 is available on the company’s website: http://www.wabco-auto.com/de/products_and_systems . WABCO France WABCO’s facility Claye Souilly, 20 km east of Paris, France, and 30 minutes from Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport, established its present location 1971, having relocated from previous facilities occupied since 1874. Today it employs 500 people, including 50 development engineers and sales teams. WABCO France serves as development, production and distribution facility for commercial vehicle and passenger car manufacturers Europe and the US, and the commercial vehicle aftermarket Europe. Specialist expertise includes transmission controls – clutch controls, integrated pedal boxes – and suspension controls for commercial vehicles, and air suspension systems for passenger cars. Customers are all CV OEMs as well as GM US and PSA France. About WABCO WABCO is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission control systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles. Customers include the world's leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. Founded the U.S. 1869 as Westinghouse Air Brake Company, WABCO acquired by American Standard 1968 and spun off 2007. Headquartered Brussels, Belgium, WABCO employs more than 7,000 people 34 offices and production facilities worldwide. In 2006, WABCO's total sales were $2 billion. WABCO is publicly traded company and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the stock symbol WBC. Web site: www.wabco-auto.com . WABCOs elektronisches Bremssystem für Anhängefahrzeuge (EBS E-Generation) für Trailer Award® 2007 nominiert BRÜSSEL, BELGIEN / KORTRIJK, BELGIEN – 20. November 2007 – WABCO , weltweit führenden Anbieter elektronischen Brems- Fahrzeugregelsystemen Federungs- Antriebssystemen für Nutzfahrzeuge, stellt Trailer® 2007 23. – 27. November 2007 (Stand 127, Halle 1) elektronisches Bremssystem für Anhänge­fahrzeuge (EBS E-Generation), SmartBoard, Reifendrucküberwachungs­system IVTM Diagnosesystem Expert Diagnostics vor. WABCO’s neueste Innovation Bereich elektronischer Bremssysteme, Trailer EBS E-Generation, für “Trailer Award®“ nominiert. Die Gewinner Eröffnungstag Messe 23. November gegeben. Die Auswahlkriterien internationalen Jury Kosten-Nutzen-Verhältnis, Innovationstiefe, Einfluss Fahrzeuggewicht -sicherheit, Anwendungsmöglichkeiten, Ergonomie Schulungen, für System angeboten werden. WABCO Vorreiter Entwicklung EBS für Nutzfahrzeuge führte System 1996 ein. Seitdem WABCO weltweit 500.000 EBS Systeme verkauft. Das Trailer EBS E-Generation ermöglicht Herstellern schnelleren einfacheren Einbau. Flottenbetreiber profitieren erweiterten Trailermanagement-Funktionen reduziertem Wartungsaufwand. Das erhöht Nutzungsdauer Anhängers reduziert Kosten. „Die Trailer® Show wichtigsten Messen Benelux-Raum für europäische Anhänger-Branche“, Nick Rens, WABCO Vice President Trailer Systems. „Die Trailer 2007 Plattform, Innovationskraft WBACO Bereich Anhängefahrzeuge demonstrieren Produkte Beispiel Trailer EBS E, Smart Board, Expert Diagnosis IVTM präsentieren. Wir freuen sehr, für Auszeichnung nominiert sind, erwiesenen Kundenvorteile würdigt, Trailer EBS-E System besitzt. Zu Vorteilen gehören u. a. effizientere Anhänger-Nutzung Wartung. Die Nominierung Trailer EBS-E Systems internationale Jury spiegelt positive Feedback wieder, unseren Kunden erhalten haben.“ Einige Highlights WABCO-Stand: Elektronisches Bremssystem für Anhängefahrzeuge, E-Generation – Trailer EBS E bietet hohes Maß Integration bereitet Boden für optimierte Anhängerbremssysteme. Neuartige Steckverbindungen sorgen dafür, System für extremen Einsatzbedingungen Traileralltags gerüstet ist. Gleichzeitig Zahl verbauten Komponenten reduziert, Zuverlässigkeit erhöht Einbau beschleunigt. Flottenbetreiber profitieren erweiterten Trailermanagement-Funktionen reduziertem Wartungs­aufwand. Das WABCO Trailer EBS E Standard- Premiumversion verfügbar, Leistungsspektrum ebenfalls Erweiterungsmodul erweitert kann. Dieses Modul besitzt integriertes Überlastschutz- Überströmventil. Zusätzlich System Roll Stablility Support (RSS) Datenrekorder (Operating Data Recorder, ODR) erweiterter Speicherkapazität ausgestattet. In Premiumversion darüber hinaus elektronisch gesteuerte Luftfederungssystem (ECAS) enthalten. Optional Trailer-EBS-Modulator SmartBoard ausgestattet werden, System, Fuhrparkbetreiber Fahrer Echtzeit Informationen über Status Bremssystems angeschlossenen Komponenten erhält. Alle Betriebsdatenrekorder aufgezeichneten Daten Systemstatus können für einzelne Fahrten für gesamte Fahrleistung Trailers ausgewertet werden. Die Daten System exakten Zeitstempel gespeichert. Die Anzeige Benutzerführung über Symbole erlaubt einfache Bedienung. SmartBoard verschiedenen Sprachen erhältlich liefert Informationen Laufleistung, Achslast, Bremsbelagverschleiß Reifendruck. Eine Warnleuchte meldet Fahrer kritische Zustände Reifendruckabfall Überladung. In Kombination ECAS lässt SmartBoard Steuerung Hebe- Senkvorgänge Fahrwerk Liftachse einsetzen. Expert Diagnostics – Expert Diagnostics umfassendes, vielseitiges mehrsprachiges Diagnosesystem für Nutzfahrzeuge verschiedener Marken, für Einsatz Nutzfahrzeug-Werkstätten bestimmt ist. Diese preiswerte, flexible einfach bedienende Modullösung eröffnet Werkstätten Geschäftsfelder, Vielzahl Marken Systemen eingesetzt kann. Werkstätten können verschiedenen Expert Diagnostics-Paketen wählen – kompakten Handheld-Tester umfassenden Premium Diagnosesystem. Das System werkstatt-tauglicher Hardware neuester Software ausgeliefert. Umfassende Services Schulungen, mehrsprachige WABCO-Hotline Kundendienst ergänzen Pakete. Integrated Vehicle Tire Pressure Monitoring (IVTM) – IVTM drahtloses Reifendrucküberwachungssystem, kontinuierlich Reifendrücke berwacht Über- Unterdruck schleichenden Druckverlust anzeigt. Somit IVTM sowohl Notwendigkeit häufiger manueller Reifendruckkontrollen Risiko Ausfällen reduzieren. Für Anhänger, Lkw Busse erhöht IVTM signifikant Sicherheit verhinderten Reifenpanne bezahlt. Das System besteht externen Radmodulen, Schläuche Reifenventilen verbunden werden. Die Module senden regelmäßig Sensoren erfassten Reifendruckdaten per Funk IVTM-ECU (Electronic Control Unit). Die ECU wiederum überträgt Daten Display Fahrerkabine. Bis 12 Radmodule können ECU verarbeitet werden. Anhänger Auflieger IVTM-ECU ausgestattet. Vom Anhängefahrzeug Reifendruckdaten über Funk Motorwagen gesendet. elektronischer Stabilitätskontrolle (ESC) für Lkws Busse vorzuschreiben BRÜSSEL, BELGIEN 6. Dezember 2007 – WABCO unterstützt Abkom¬men UN/ECE (United Nations Economic Commission for Europe), EU Weg ebnet, Gesetz Einführung elektronischen Stabilitätskon¬trolle (ESC) Pflichtausstattung für bestimmte schwere Lastkraftwagen Reisebusse umzusetzen. Das Abkommen ermöglicht EU, System Bezug UN/ECE veröffentlichte Regelung Nr. 13 über Brem¬sen verpflichtend einzuführen. Ab 2010 verlangt, Neufahrzeuge ESC ausgestattet sind. „Wir stolz darauf, 2001 ESC-System Markt gebracht Mitglied Arbeitsgruppe für Bremssysteme UN/ECE sein”, Jacques Esculier, Vorstandsvorsitzender WABCO. „Wir zuversichtlich, Entscheidung Einführung ähnlicher Vorschriften Teilen Welt fördert”, fügte Esculier hinzu. Die Län¬dern anerkannte Regelung Nr. 13 über Bremsen wirbt gemäß EU-Kommission für einheitliche Standards fördert Einsatz ESC-Systemen Ländern, ESC Pflicht ist. WABCO präsentierte Anbieter 2001 ESC-System für Nutzfahrzeuge, Sonderausstattung elektronischen Bremssystem (EBS) angeboten wurde. WABCO weltweit führenden Anbieter elektronischen Brems- Fahrzeugregelsystemen Federungs- Antriebssyste­men für Nutzfahrzeuge. Heute Prozent Lkws Busse Europa ESC ausgestattet. Stabilitätskontrollsysteme helfen Fahrer potenziell gefährlichen Situationen Kontrolle über Fahrzeug behalten. Das ESC-System greift fahrdynamisch kritischen Situationen selbständig korrigierend Motor- Bremssteuerung verhindert innerhalb physikalischen Grenzen Kippen, Schleudern, Drehen Einknicken Fahrzeugen. Die Stabilisierung Fahrzeuges selektives Bremsen einzelnen Rädern ermöglicht, während gleich­zeitig Motorleistung verringert wird. WABCO Tradition Technologieführer ebnete Weg für wichtige Innovationen, verbessertem Fahrverhalten, höherer Sicherheit Effizienz Nutzfahrzeugen führten. Zu Innovationen gehören Kooperation Daimler 1981 eingeführte Anti-Blockiersystem (ABS), elektronisch gesteuerte Luftfederungssystem (ECAS), automati­sierte Getriebeschaltung, elektronische Bremssysteme (EBS) verschiedene Stabilitätskontrollsysteme. WABCO Stabilitätskontrollsysteme Roll Stability Control (RSC) Anti-Blockiersystem (ABS) eingebau­tes Stabilitätskontrollsystem. Ein Beschleunigungsmesser direkt elektro­nische Kontrolleinheit (ECU) eingebaut, laterale Beschleunigung überwachen. Das RSC-System überwacht Schwerpunkt Fahrzeugs, Radgeschwindigkeiten Grenzwert lateralen Beschleunigung, Überschlägen kommt. Bei Überschreitungen Grenzwertes reduziert RSC automatisch Drehmoment Motors, aktiviert Motor­bremse löst Bremsen Zugfahrzeug Anhänger aus. Dadurch Fahrzeug langsamer, Stabilität nimmt Manövrierfähigkeit kehrt zurück. Electronic Stability Control (ESC) kombiniert Eigenschaften RSC-Systems Messung Rotationsbewegungen horizontaler Ebene. Bei drohendem Kontrollverlust über Fahrzeug aufgrund hoher Rotationskräfte Hilfe ESC Fahreigenschaften verbessert. Diese Rotations­kräfte können schnellem ruckartigem Fahrspurwechsel Kur­venfahrt rutschiger Fahrbahn auftreten. Roll Stability Support (RSS) unabhängiges System für Anhänger bietet elektronische Unterstützung, Wahrscheinlichkeit Überschlägen reduzieren. Das System EBS Anhängers integriert benötigt somit zusätzliche Hardware. RSS überwacht, ähnlich RSC, laterale Beschleunigung Radgeschwindigkeit. Auch kritische Grenzwert lateralen Beschleunigung angezeigt. Wenn überschritten wird, aktiviert System automatisch Anhängerbremsen reduziert Fahrzeuggeschwindigkeit. Stabilitätserhöhende Systeme unterstützen Fahrer, können Kontroll­verluste über Fahrzeug Überschläge Fahrsituationen voll­ständig verhindern. Der Fahrer weiterhin dafür verantwortlich, techni­sche Grenzbereich Fahrzeugs überschritten wird. New Trailer Stability Enhancement System Offering Improved Trailer Intelligence for the North American Market TROY, MICH. – December 11, 2007 – Meritor WABCO Vehicle Control Systems today introduced its new Roll Stability Support trailer system, RSSplus TM , designed specifically for the North American trailer industry to offer more advanced features and added value. RSSplus be available late first quarter 2008 through trailer original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and as aftermarket retrofit through trailer OEM dealers. Continuing history of delivering customer desired solutions, the new system builds upon the company’s current RSS offering which incorporates its industry-leading ABS functionality with other pertinent safety features such as improved roll mitigation. The system retains Meritor WABCO’s field-proven, side-by-side wheel end control which provides superior stability management and helps prevent tire flat spotting and abnormal tire wear. Additionally, the system offers simplified installation and advanced “intelligent” communication capabilities through on-board data recording with event broadcasting capability via Power Line Carrier (PLC) communications or telematic devices. Jon Morrison, president and general manager of Meritor WABCO Vehicle Control Systems, said, “As pioneers of this significant technology, we are pleased to be bringing the next echelon of trailer stability capabilities to the marketplace at more reasonable cost. With the largest population of trailer stability systems place today, this new system is the culmination of valuable customer feedback and the work of our industry-leading engineering teams.” Meritor WABCO introduced its first trailer stability system, RSS, 2003. Today, there are over 4,000 of the company’s units place with several OEMs adopting the technology as standard equipment on their trailers. Advanced Features RSSplus is premium 2-modulator (2M) roll mitigation system that integrates several features, including ABS and PLC functionality, reducing individual component requirements. The new system is compatible for use with spring suspensions, as well as air ride suspensions. A new cable connector system allows for more positive connections and cable stabilization to prevent damage and mitigate potential problems with connector corrosion. Standardized SAE diagnostics make troubleshooting much simpler and are now conventional feature of the system. The diagnostics have been integrated into the company’s TOOLBOX™ PC software. System diagnostics can be performed using standard blink codes which eliminate the cost of additional diagnostic tools. By adding Power Line Carrier (PLC) capability to the RSSplus electronic control unit (ECU), the system can communicate between the tractor and trailer utilizing PLC display. Additional messaging can be accommodated via telematic devices. Examples of events that can be communicated include suspension weight, tire pressure, wheel-end temperatures or other customer-specific data. On-board data recording within the ECU allows for the retention of vehicle performance data the ECU memory to enhance fleet management. Such “intelligent” data can be utilized to help improve operating efficiencies. “With the new system being designed exclusively for the North American market, many of the advanced features, such as standardized SAE diagnostics, incorporate requirements identified specifically by our customers,” said Bob Sibley, director, Meritor WABCO Trailer Products. “These features provide the additional support expected from stability system, plus offer added value for the customer’s operation.” Applications Configurations of the new system include: 2S/2M¹, 4S/2M and 4S/2M + 1M (for most 4S/3M requirements). Applications include vans, reefer units, flat beds, tankers, hazardous material haulers, B-trains and high center of gravity trailers. Design of the new system includes capabilities that are compatible with current tractor stability technologies as well as future technologies. RSSplus is backward-compatible with existing trailers the marketplace making it ideal retrofit technology. 2007” by the UK Automotive Distribution Federation (ADF) for the Second Consecutive Year BRUSSELS, BELGIUM / BIRMINGHAM, UK – 18 December 2007 – WABCO, one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission control systems for the heavy duty commercial vehicle industry, has been named “Commercial Vehicle Supplier of the Year 2007” by the Automotive Distribution Federation (ADF) for the second consecutive year. ADF cited WABCO’s “consistent performance” as key element of the company’s nomination. ADF represents manufacturers, importers and independent wholesale distributors of automotive components the UK. The ADF annual awards honor companies that have shown the highest quality service and focus on customer satisfaction. Quintin Cornforth, new president of the ADF, presented the trophy to WABCO during the ADF Dinner & Awards evening Birmingham on December 6. The award is based on intensive tests of the service quality provided by WABCO’s field sales force and internal sales- and technical-helpdesks. The testing conducted through “mystery shoppers”. In addition, ADF interviewed number of the nominees’ customers during the selection process. “To win this prestigious award for two consecutive years is great honor as it shows that we manage to maintain consistent level of service quality over time,” said Chris Chapman, UK Aftermarket Manager, who accepted the award on behalf of WABCO. “This award is great accolade because both mystery shoppers and our real customers voted, and it drive us to even greater efforts to constantly improve customer service and satisfaction. “This award is excellent close to successful year for WABCO’s Aftermarket business”, said Jean-François Barth, WABCO vice president Aftermarket. “Our UK team’s strong commitment to customer satisfaction is proving strong differentiator when it comes to increasing our presence the very competitive UK market.” Please find more information on WABCO products and services on the website: www.wabco-auto.com Editors Notes WABCO is one of the world's leading providers of electronic braking, stability, suspension and transmission control systems for heavy duty commercial vehicles.
