Continues to Outperform Volatile and Decreased Global Commercial Vehicle Market; Updates Guidance for 2015 Q1 2015 sales of $652.2 million, up 3.8 percent local currencies and down 10.6 percent U.S. dollars from year ago Q1 2015 operating margin of 14.3 percent on performance basis, up from 12.3 percent year ago; operating margin of 13.1 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, up from 11.5 percent year ago Q1 2015 diluted EPS of $1.41 on performance basis, up from $1.28 year ago; diluted EPS of $1.22 on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $1.12 year ago In Q1 2015, WABCO generated $86.5 million net cash from operating activities and $74.5 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 90 percent of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items Updates guidance for full year 2015 to reflect strengthening of U.S. dollar and market changes: sales growth to now range from 5 to 10 percent versus previous guidance from 6 to 11 percent local currencies; full year 2015 diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.60 to $6.00 versus previous guidance from $5.80 to $6.30; and full year 2015 diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.76 to $5.26 versus previous guidance from $5.09 to $5.59 BRUSSELS, Belgium, April 23, 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today reported Q1 2015 sales of $652.2 million, up 3.8 percent local currencies from year ago and down 10.6 percent U.S. dollars, reflecting significant strengthening of the U.S. dollar year on year. “In Q1 2015, we once again demonstrated WABCO’s ongoing ability to generate sales growth that outperforms the commercial vehicle market relative to truck and bus production, as we increased sales by 3.8 percent local currencies, despite significant decline of 9.3 percent new truck and bus builds globally,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “As anticipated, Q1 2015, North America and India expanded truck and bus production by double-digits respectively, and we strongly outperformed these markets,” said Esculier. “At the same time, new truck and bus builds Western Europe accelerated more than we had anticipated. However, this market growth almost entirely offset by unexpected further decline truck and bus production Russia and other countries the Commonwealth of Independent States.” “Also, truck and bus production Q1 2015 declined both China and South America beyond prior expectation,” said Esculier. “But indeed, as anticipated, WABCO significantly outperformed the market China, the world’s largest for commercial vehicles.” WABCO reported Q1 2015 performance operating income of $93.5 million, up from $89.8 million year ago, and operating income $85.5 million on U.S. GAAP basis, up from $84.2 million year ago. WABCO’s performance operating margin for Q1 2015 14.3 percent, up from 12.3 percent year ago, and operating margin 13.1 percent on U.S. GAAP basis, up from 11.5 percent year ago. For Q1 2015, WABCO reported performance net income attributable to the company of $83.1 million or $1.41 per diluted share, up from $79.3 million or $1.28 per diluted share year ago, and Q1 2015 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $71.9 million or $1.22 per diluted share, up from $69.4 million or $1.12 per diluted share year ago. “In Q1 2015, WABCO’s Operating System, our globally standardized management environment, continued to enable fast, flexible responses to volatile market changes, while sustaining robust productivity gains,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s Operating System delivered $17.0 million of materials and conversion productivity. It generated materials productivity of 5.1 percent and achieved conversion productivity of 6.6 percent our factories,” said Esculier. “The outstanding productivity success that we delivered Q1 2015 contributed to performance profit at 33.1 percent, new quarterly record.” During Q1 2015, WABCO generated $86.5 million net cash from operating activities and $74.5 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 90 percent of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items. Since June 2011, WABCO has repurchased 14,152,960 shares for $1,033.6 million open market transactions as of March 31, 2015. WABCO is further authorized to repurchase up to $438.2 million of additional shares through December 31, 2016. “In Q1 2015, we continued to demonstrate our ability to transform top-line growth into healthy bottom-line results,” said Esculier. “WABCO achieved robust incremental operating margin, which delivered above our financial operating framework.” Incremental operating margin refers to the ratio of increase performance operating income Q1 2015 and WABCO’s growth sales. Recent Highlights On April 16, 2015, WABCO announced that from Q2 2014 to Q1 2015 it has entered into contracts with customers globally totaling record $1.1 billion of expected cumulative incremental business, up 10 percent year on year. WABCO achieved this record amount of annual new business despite significant strengthening of the U.S. dollar versus the same period year ago. WABCO’s record new business includes $810 million from 2015 through 2019, up from $620 million reported year ago for the five-year period from 2014 through 2018. These contracts represent new incremental business, separate from replacement and renewal of existing contracts. WABCO continues to expect that its annual sales growth outperform market expansion of new truck and bus builds on average from 8 to 10 percent through 2019. In Q1 2015, WABCO signed long-term supply agreement with Hendrickson Trailer Commercial Vehicle Systems to provide advanced air disc brake (ADB) system for trailers North America. As part of the agreement, WABCO launch its innovative MAXX22T™ North America. It combines WABCO’s leading braking technologies with Hendrickson’s premier medium- and heavy-duty suspension and axle systems. MAXX22T is the commercial vehicle industry’s lightest air disc brake North America. It contributes to WABCO and Hendrickson’s system that offers overall weight reduction up to 100 lbs on tandem axle trailers, which helps to improve vehicle fuel efficiency or enable increased transport payload. Also Q1 2015, WABCO announced that it has further strengthened its partnership with SmartDrive Systems , leader driving performance management solutions that help fleets to enhance vehicle safety and operating efficiency. WABCO invested $20 million U.S.-based SmartDrive Systems and jointly develop next-generation, video-based analytics solutions for commercial vehicle fleets worldwide. This partnership harnesses the extensive capabilities and know-how of two industry leaders. WABCO pioneers advanced safety and efficiency technologies for truck, bus and trailer makers and fleets. SmartDrive Systems offers unequaled expertise driver and vehicle data and video analysis. Recently, WABCO disclosed that three major commercial vehicle manufacturers China have signed supply agreements to equip their next-generation of trucks and buses for export to Europe with advanced driver assistance technologies. Foton, Yutong Bus and BYD adopt both WABCO’s industry-leading OnGuardACTIVE™ advanced emergency braking system – which can autonomously apply brakes and bring the vehicle to complete stop – as well as WABCO’s innovative OnLane™ lane departure warning system. WABCO announced Q1 2015 that it expand its manufacturing capabilities North America with new world-class manufacturing site Charleston, South Carolina, U.S.A., to meet increasing customer demand for its advanced air disc brakes, energy-efficient air compressors and related systems. WABCO localize air disc brake production the U.S. while continuing to manufacture air compressors, actuators , and other braking system components Charleston. Construction of the new 145,000-square-foot facility is expected to be completed by the end of 2015 and fully operational by the first quarter of 2016. In Q1 2015, WABCO China honored with “Excellent Supplier Award” from Yutong Bus, the world’s largest manufacturer of buses. This prestigious award recognizes WABCO’s superlative performance 2014 and it ranks WABCO top among Yutong’s more than 500 suppliers. It marks the third time that WABCO has been honored annually with such top recognition and it is the seventh major award granted to WABCO by Yutong recent years. WABCO Updates Full Year 2015 Guidance WABCO expects full year 2015 sales growth to now range from 5 to 10 percent versus previous guidance from 6 to 11 percent local currencies. WABCO’s previously disclosed guidance for performance operating margin to range from 14.2 to 15.1 percent remains unchanged; however, previously disclosed guidance for operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis now ranges from 13.0 to 13.9 percent versus prior guidance from 13.2 to 14.1 percent. WABCO expects its diluted EPS on performance basis to now range from $5.60 to $6.00 versus previous guidance from $5.80 to $6.30 and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to now range from $4.76 to $5.26 versus previous guidance from $5.09 to $5.59. In addition, WABCO reiterates that it expects 2015 to convert between 80 and 90 percent of its performance net income attributable to the company into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with items for streamlining, separation and acquisition. “In this highly volatile environment, the current pace of weakening of markets such as China, South America, and Russia and other countries the Commonwealth of Independent States – conjunction with further strengthening of the U.S. dollar – prompts us to update WABCO’s guidance for full year 2015,” said Esculier. “This guidance still reflects WABCO’s continuous outperformance of markets, while generating incremental operating margin consistent with our financial operating framework and simultaneously delivering healthy free cash-flow conversion.” Conference Call Jacques Esculier, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, Chief Financial Officer, discuss WABCO’s results and outlook on conference call at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time today. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . WABCO’s 2014 Annual Report is now available online at http://ar.wabco-auto.com/2014/ . 29, 2014 The Mid-America Trucking Show is the major annual event for the heavy-duty trucking industry North America, with 80,000 attendees and over 1070 exhibitors from around the world. At the MATS tradeshow, WABCO presents its portfolio of breakthrough Advanced Safety and Vehicle Effectiveness products and systems for heavy-duty truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. We demonstrate how our cutting-edge products make heavy-duty trucks safer and efficient, and how we tailor them for North America. Here are recent technology breakthroughs that we exhibited last year: Next-generation OnGuard™ collision mitigation system Next-generation pneumatic and hydraulic Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with electronic stability control MAXXUS™ , the lightest and highest performing single-piston air disc brake for trucks ESCsmart™ , the latest generation electronic stability control (ESC) with unique “Drive-it-Away” and “self-learning” capabilities. RSS 1M Trailer Rollover Stability Support System - Proven to be ideal protection for refrigerated, flatbed and livestock applications c-comp™ compressors with integrated clutch, which offer fuel savings up to 145 gallons per year The innovative Electronically Controlled Air Suspension (ECAS) System that helps to improve vehicle traction and reduce tire wear on 6x2 vehicles Related Information MATS 2014 Floor Plan Official MATS 2014 website WABCO @MATS 2013 <- Zurück zu: Tradeshows & Events WABCO weltweit führender Zulieferer Technologien Steuersystemen für Sicherheit Effizienz Nutzfahrzeugen. Highlights Latest Innovations to Advance Commercial Vehicle Safety and Efficiency YOKOHAMA, Japan – May 18, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, showcase its most advanced technologies at Automotive Engineering Exposition 2015. WABCO feature numerous leading safety and efficiency technologies from its portfolio of "industry firsts" and major innovations at Automotive Engineering Exposition 2015, the industry’s largest tradeshow Japan, held from May 20-22, 2015, Yokohama, Japan. Differentiating WABCO products and systems on display include: Industry-leading MAXX™ air disc brakes (ADB) – the industry’s lightest and highest performing single-piston ADB for commercial vehicles. Superbly engineered and compactly designed, WABCO’s MAXX air disc brake technology fits any wheel size from 17.5 to 22.5 inches across light-, medium- and heavy-duty applications for trucks, buses and trailers. Thereby, WABCO’s game-changing MAXX braking technology fits virtually every wheel size of commercial vehicles around the globe. Breakthrough mBSP ™ – modular braking system platform (mBSP) enables commercial vehicle manufacturers worldwide to interchangeably equip their diverse global truck and bus platforms with anti-lock braking (ABS) or electronic braking (EBS) systems based on regional market or regulatory requirements. WABCO’s mBSP, industry first, features the industry’s highest degree of standardization across both components and software of its ABS and EBS systems. Industry-leading OnGuardACTIVE ™ – advanced emergency braking system (AEBS) for trucks and buses that detects moving, stopping and stationary vehicles ahead. It utilizes powerful 77GHz radar sensor that maintains the system’s high performance all weather conditions. OnGuardACTIVE is capable of analyzing the traffic ahead, thus recognizing impending critical driving situations early. The system autonomously applies the brakes and can bring the vehicle to complete stop, helping to prevent or mitigate rear-end collisions. OnGuardACTIVE is the industry’s first AEBS that complies with stringent European regulations now effect and has already been homologated on various commercial vehicle platforms by several leading manufacturers that region. Advanced OnLane™ – camera-based lane departure warning continuously monitors the vehicle’s position within lane markings. WABCO’s OnLane is advanced driver assistance system that alerts the driver of unintentional lane changes via acoustic, visual, and haptic warnings. Thereby, the system improves driver attentiveness, as well as overall vehicle and road safety. WABCO’s OnLane is fully compliant with European regulation and has already been homologated on various commercial vehicle platforms by several leading manufacturers that region. Next generation TailGUARD™ – advanced driver assistance system that combines the functions of rear blind-spot monitoring and automatic braking. A proven safety technology for trailers since 2010, TailGUARD is now available for trucks and buses. It uses up to 6 ultrasonic sensors to identify even small stationary or moving objects hidden the vehicle’s blind spot. WABCO’s TailGUARD alerts the driver via audio and visual signals before automatically applying the brakes to help prevent collisions. "At Automotive Engineering Exposition 2015, we demonstrate how WABCO’s technology leadership further help commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators to improve the safety and efficiency of trucks, buses and trailers Asia and across the globe," said Sujie Yu, WABCO Vice President, Asia Pacific. "Our customers value WABCO's world-class product development, engineering and system integration capabilities, resulting optimal regionalized solutions and superior performance." "Innovation and value-based solutions for customers are at the heart of WABCO’s differentiation," said Osamu Saito, WABCO Japan Business Leader. "We are passionate about adding value for our customers Japan as they pursue domestic, export and global market opportunities." WABCO at Automotive Engineering Exposition 2015 Pacifico Yokohama Exhibition Hall, Yokohama, Japan May 20-22, 2015 Booth 255 About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Chairman and CEO to Address KeyBanc Capital Markets 2015 Industrial, Automotive and Transportation Conference Provides Latest Outlook on Global Commercial Vehicle Market Across Regions Reiterates Continued Commitment to Outperformance and Superior Shareowner Value BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 26, 2015 — WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, announced today that its top executive reiterate the company’s continued commitment to superior shareowner value at the KeyBanc Capital Markets 2015 Industrial, Automotive and Transportation Conference on May 28, 2015. A webcast of the presentation be available on the investor relations page of WABCO’s website. Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, outline the company’s strategies for differentiation and highlight its robust framework to deliver superior value for shareowners volatile market environment. Esculier host WABCO’s General Session on Thursday, May 28, 2015, from 11:00 to 11:50 A.M. EDT. The KeyBanc Conference take place from May 26-28 at the InterContinental Hotel Boston, MA (USA). “We are excited to welcome investors and analysts to our General Session at the upcoming KeyBanc Conference. As global Tier 1 supplier and technology innovator, we share with them our perspective on the commercial vehicle industry and our latest outlook on regional market developments,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “We continue to capitalize on growth opportunities our industry through technology leadership, globalization, and excellence execution. WABCO’s unique ability to anticipate global market dynamics, industry trends and diverse customer needs enables us to deliver differentiated products and services to leading commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators worldwide.” Webcast A live webcast of WABCO’s presentation be broadcast simultaneously on the investor relations page of the company’s website at http://wabco.client.shareholder.com/ . The webcast begin at 11:00 A.M. and conclude by 11:50 A.M. EDT. A replay be available at the same site following the event. Highlights Retrofit, Repair, and Training Solutions for Company’s Leading Safety and Efficiency Technologies DUBAI, United Arab Emirates – June 1, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, showcase its world-class services capabilities at Automechanika Dubai 2015, the largest automotive aftermarket trade show the Middle East. The industry event take place from June 2-4, 2015, the United Arab Emirates' city of Dubai. WABCO feature its broad portfolio of retrofit, repair, remanufacturing, and training solutions for the company's most advanced safety and efficiency technologies the region. WABCO's differentiated service offerings help commercial vehicle fleets and operators improve vehicle maintenance, operating cost and up-time. The company display wide array of aftermarket services for range of its leading products and systems, including: Advanced OnLane ™ – camera-based lane departure warning continuously monitors the vehicle’s position within lane markings. WABCO’s OnLane is advanced driver assistance system that alerts the driver of unintentional lane changes via acoustic and visual warnings. Thereby, the system improves driver attentiveness, as well as overall vehicle and road safety. WABCO’s OnLane is easy to retrofit on wide range of commercial vehicles. New OptiTire ™ – WABCO's next generation of tire pressure monitoring for trucks and trailers is the industry’s first system that allows vehicle builders to choose either external or internal wheel sensors. OptiTire tracks tire temperature and enhances early leakage detection, which helps to improve vehicle maintenance and up-time. WABCO's OptiTire increases fuel economy up to 2 percent and extends tire's lifetime as the system continuously supports keeping tire pressure at recommended levels. The company’s latest tire pressure monitoring system is easy to retrofit on wide range of commercial vehicles. Industry award-winning Automated Manual Transmission (AMT) – WABCO's AMT technology helps commercial vehicle fleet operators to improve fuel economy, driver effectiveness and vehicle safety. It automatically engages the vehicle's clutch and gear shift actuation. WABCO's AMT takes into account the driver’s operation, engine torque, vehicle load and road inclination, resulting optimized gear shifting. WABCO's AMT technology helps improve fuel economy up to 3 percent under certain conditions. In addition, it enhances driver ease-of-use and comfort, enabling them to further focus on vehicle and road safety. WABCO's AMT helps reduce wear on transmission components, resulting lower maintenance costs. WABCO offers effective diagnostic and repair solutions, as well as related training programs to extend the lifetime of AMTs on trucks revenue service today. "At Automechanika Dubai 2015, we demonstrate how WABCO’s technology leadership and extensive world of solutions services offerings continue to help improve the safety and efficiency of trucks, buses and trailers the Middle East, Africa and across the globe," said Sherif El-Sheikh, Regional Leader for the Middle East and Africa, WABCO Trailer Systems, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division. In addition, WABCO showcase its differentiation the aftermarket as the company offers powerful portfolio of innovative aftermarket products and value-added services, including fleet management and telematics solutions, system diagnostics, and genuine parts distribution through extensive network of distributors and more than 2,300 certified WABCO Service Partners more than 110 countries. The company provides more than 13,000 spare parts for customized repair and retrofit of commercial vehicles throughout their life cycle. WABCO highlight its professional technical training offerings through WABCO University , including e-learning courses, business training, and customized consulting services. The company’s educational center of excellence provides numerous practical and customer-specific training modules, including basic courses air brake technology, foundation brake systems and electronic systems, as well as system training courses anti-lock braking systems (ABS), electronic braking systems (EBS), bus systems, driver safety, and training on local rules and regulations. WABCO University has graduated more than 115,000 individuals from 59 countries since its inception 2006 at 18 training centers worldwide. From its office and distribution center Dubai, WABCO supplies local manufacturers of trucks, trailers and buses as well as aftermarket customers across the Middle East and Africa (MEA) region. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . 2014 AMT Market Penetration the Region Expected to Double Next 5 Years BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 24, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that its industry-leading automated manual transmission (AMT) technology continues to increase market penetration among major global commercial vehicle makers North America as demonstrated by sales increase 2014 of 110 percent from the year before. WABCO made the announcement leading up to the 2015 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS), one of the largest heavy-duty trucking industry events the world, held from March 26-28, 2015, Louisville, Kentucky (USA). One of the fastest-growing major component segments the North American commercial vehicle industry, automated manual transmissions have expanded adoption to approximately 17 percent of new truck and bus production as of 2014. WABCO estimates that market penetration of the industry’s AMT solutions reach one third of new truck and bus builds by 2019. WABCO’s AMT technology automatically engages the vehicle’s clutch and gear shift actuation. It takes into account the driver’s operation, engine torque, vehicle load and road inclination, resulting optimized gear shifting. WABCO’s AMT technology helps improve fuel economy up to 3 percent on North American highways. In addition, it enhances driver ease-of-use and comfort, enabling them to further focus on vehicle and road safety. “At MATS 2015, we once again demonstrate WABCO’s advanced automated manual transmission solutions that are rapidly gaining further adoption North America among global truck and bus makers,” said Nik Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “Major customers rely on WABCO to support the increasing adoption of AMT on multiple commercial vehicle brands North America.” Added Varty: “WABCO’s AMT technology helps commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators to improve fuel economy, driver effectiveness and vehicle safety. It helps reduce wear on transmission components, resulting lower maintenance costs.” WABCO first to market with AMT technology 1986. Today, WABCO is the global market leader automated manual transmission technology with 2.9 million AMT systems sold worldwide. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Introduces OnGuardACTIVE™ Collision Mitigation System to North America Superior Radar Provides Over 30% Longer Range Allowing for Earlier Recognition of Potentially Critical Driving Situations “All Season System” Leverages 77GHz Radar to Deliver Better Performance Poor Visibility Driving Conditions BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 25, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, launch its most advanced Collision Mitigation System (CMS) for trucks and buses North America. WABCO’s OnGuardACTIVE™ features superior radar and is effective all seasons. WABCO made the announcement leading up to the 2015 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS), one of the largest heavy-duty trucking industry events the world, held from March 26-28, 2015, Louisville, Kentucky (USA). WABCO’s OnGuardACTIVE utilizes powerful 77GHz radar sensor that maintains the system’s high performance all weather conditions. Its superior performance is particularly vital poor visibility situations such as white outs, heavy rain, dense fog, blinding sunshine or night time driving when camera-based sensors used on other collision mitigation systems may be impaired. OnGuardACTIVE’s radar offers up to five times higher bandwidth than 24GHz radar-based collision mitigation systems available the market. The system’s dual mode function addresses both long range and adjacent lane views. This enables higher accuracy object detection, and more than 30 percent longer range than alternative systems. OnGuardACTIVE is capable of analyzing traffic up to 650 feet ahead, thus recognizing impending critical driving situations earlier. WABCO’s OnGuardACTIVE alerts the driver to potentially critical driving situations via acoustic, visual and haptic signals. Should the vehicle operator fail to take corrective action, the system provides active braking on moving, stopping and stationary vehicles to mitigate or prevent impending rear-end collisons. OnGuardACTIVE is capable of delivering up to full braking on moving and stopping vehicles and can bring the vehicle to complete stop. It can deliver partial braking on stationary vehicles. “WABCO’s new OnGuardACTIVE is our most advanced collision mitigation system,” said Nik Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “Rain or shine, foggy or clear, drivers constantly travel on America’s roads. They need system that works as hard as they do to keep them and their vehicles safe whatever the season. OnGuardACTIVE’s superior radar technology is up to the task.” Added Varty: “Our long range and high precision radar detects moving, stopping or stationary vehicles early, giving drivers precious time to manage hazardous driving situations.” WABCO is market leader collision mitigation systems for the commercial vehicle industry North America. The company has sold more than 80,000 OnGuard™ collision mitigation systems the U.S. alone having protected customers collectively for more than 9.5 billion miles. OnGuardACTIVE be sold and supported North America by Meritor WABCO. MAXX22T™ North America Market-leading Lightweight Air Disc Brake Contributes to System’s Weight Reduction of up to 100 lbs on Tandem Axle Trailers Represents Industry’s Most Optimized Air Disc Brake System for Trailer Applications the Region BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 25, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, signed long-term supply agreement with Hendrickson Trailer Commercial Vehicle Systems to provide advanced air disc brake (ADB) system for trailers North America. WABCO made the announcement leading up to the 2015 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS), one of the largest heavy-duty trucking industry events the world, held from March 26-28, 2015, Louisville, Kentucky (USA). As part of the agreement, WABCO launch its innovative MAXX22T™ North America, the most optimized ADB system for trailer applications the region. The new system combines WABCO’s leading braking technologies with Hendrickson’s premier medium- and heavy duty suspension and axle systems. WABCO’s MAXX22T™ represents the commercial vehicle industry’s lightest air disc brake North America. It contributes to WABCO and Hendrickson’s system offering overall weight reduction of up to 100 lbs on tandem axle trailers, thereby, helping to improve vehicle fuel efficiency or enable increase transport payload. WABCO’s proven single-piston design features approximately 25 percent fewer parts compared to other air disc brakes available the market. Therefore, it helps improve reliability and installation efficiency while lowering maintenance costs. In addition, WABCO’s bi-directional adjuster minimizes the risk of hot running brakes. “We are excited to supply our air disc brake to Hendrickson, global leader medium- and heavy duty suspension and axle systems,” said Nik Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “The cooperation of our two industry leading companies brings together powerful blend of expertise and industry-leading technologies. We are proud to offer state-of-the-art air disc brake system specifically for trailers North America that can deliver high performance and value for our customers.” WABCO at MATS 2015 Booth 32805 the South Wing, Kentucky Exposition Center, Louisville, Kentucky, March 26-28, 2015 WABCO Press Briefing March 25, from 9:30 to 10:00 AM, Conference Room C105 the South Wing. Plans to Jointly Develop Next-Generation Safety and Efficiency Solutions for Commercial Vehicle Fleets Worldwide Invests $20 Million Video-based Analytics Company the U.S. Drives Technology Enhancements and Global Expansion of Industry-leading Products and Services Helps Fleets to Improve Driver Performance and Increase Vehicle Safety, Efficiency BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 25, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, has further strengthened its partnership with SmartDrive Systems , leader driving performance management solutions that help fleets to enhance operating safety and lower fuel consumption. WABCO invested $20 million U.S.-based SmartDrive Systems and jointly develop next-generation, video-based analytics solutions for commercial vehicle fleets worldwide. WABCO made the announcement leading up to the 2015 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS), one of the largest heavy-duty trucking industry events the world, held from March 26-28, 2015, Louisville, Kentucky (USA). This partnership harnesses the extensive capabilities and know-how of two industry leaders to help further enhance the safety and efficiency of fleet operators worldwide. WABCO pioneers advanced safety and efficiency technologies for truck, bus and trailer manufacturers and fleets. SmartDrive Systems offers unequaled expertise driver and vehicle data and video analysis. WABCO and SmartDrive Systems combine their breakthrough products and services to offer new level of functionality and support. SmartDrive Systems offers real-time, video-based driving performance insights and analytics integrating information from data-rich vehicle systems such as WABCO’s advanced braking and stability control technologies into its offerings real-time. SmartDrive Systems maintains database of more than 100 million analyzed risky driving events that enable predictive analytics and real-time risk identification. This information can help fleets to identify and reduce potentially hazardous driving maneuvers and improve overall operating efficiency. “We are excited to invest our winning partnership with SmartDrive Systems,” said Nik Varty, President, WABCO Americas. “The integration of comprehensive real-time data gathered from WABCO’s onboard advanced braking, stability control and efficiency systems – together with SmartDrive Systems’ video-based driver performance management systems and data analytics services – continue to create significant value for fleet customers worldwide. The combination of our industry-leading technologies and services help fleets to improve driver performance and further increase vehicle safety and efficiency.” WABCO has made significant investment both SmartDrive Systems and our partnership,” said Steve Mitgang, CEO, SmartDrive Systems. “Fleets have experienced first-hand the unprecedented insight to potential risk that our combined systems deliver and can clearly see the significant role active safety systems play protecting drivers from the hazards they face on the road every day. We are looking forward to jointly developing advanced products and services that build on our initial work together while expanding our reach to dynamic growth markets around the globe.” WABCO at MATS 2015 Booth 32805 the South Wing, Kentucky Exposition Center, Louisville, Kentucky, March 26-28, 2015 WABCO Press Briefing March 25, from 9:30 to 10:00 AM, Conference Room C105 the South Wing. Localizes Air Disc Brake Production to Meet Increasing Customer Demand North America Builds New 145,000-square-foot Facility and Will Relocate from Existing Production Site New Facility Will Produce Air Compressors, Air Disc Brakes, and other Components for Customers North America Helps Sustain 175 Existing Jobs and Create Over 50 New Jobs BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 25, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, expand its manufacturing capabilities North America. The company invest $17 million to build state-of-the-art manufacturing site Charleston, South Carolina (USA) to meet increasing customer demand for its advanced air disc brakes (ADB) , energy-efficient air compressors and related systems. Earlier today, WABCO announced that it had signed long-term supply agreement with Hendrickson Trailer Commercial Vehicle Systems to provide advanced air disc brake (ADB) system for trailers North America. As part of the agreement, WABCO launch its innovative MAXX22T™ , the most optimized ADB system for trailer applications the region. The new system combines WABCO’s leading braking technologies with Hendrickson’s premier medium- and heavy duty suspension and axle systems. The company made the announcement at the 2015 Mid-America Trucking Show (MATS) held Louisville, Kentucky (USA). Responding to increasing customer demand, WABCO localize its air disc brake production the United States while continuing to manufacture air compressors, actuators , and other braking system components Charleston. WABCO started to manufacture air compressors South Carolina 1996. Construction of the new, 145,000-square-foot facility is expected to be completed by the end of the year. The company then relocate from its exiting Charleston site to the new facility. WABCO anticipates the new production facility to be fully operational by the first quarter of 2016. The company’s investment is expected to create more than 50 new jobs and help sustain approximately 175 existing jobs. “In 2014, we have experienced significant growth North America and are excited to expand our manufacturing capabilities the United States to better serve our local customers,” said Nik Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “For the first time, we localize the production of our advanced air disc brakes which allow us to continue to capitalize on the dynamic growth opportunities of the North American market place.” WABCO at MATS 2015 Booth 32805 the South Wing, Kentucky Exposition Center, Louisville, Kentucky, March 26-28, 2015 Meritor WABCO Ride-N-Drive OnGuard collision mitigation system and OnLane departure warning “Ride-N-Drive,” March 26-28, 2015. Opens New Commercial Vehicle Development and Testing Facility Rochester Hills, Michigan BRUSSELS, Belgium and LOUISVILLE, Kentucky, USA – March 25, 2015 – WABCO (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, has recently expanded its engineering capabilities North America. The company opened new commercial vehicle development and testing facility Rochester Hills, Michigan (USA) to help develop the next-generation safety and efficiency technologies for trucks, buses and trailers. WABCO has invested $1.5 million and built advanced 4,400-square-foot site to support the work of more than 50 engineers involved the innovation and development of new products and systems for commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators North America. “We continue to invest our manufacturing and engineering capabilities North America to better serve our customers the region,” said Nik Varty, WABCO President, Americas. “The new facility the Greater Detroit Area enables us to offer seamless support to design, develop and test breakthrough technologies that further commercial vehicle safety and efficiency the U.S. and around the globe.” Earlier today, WABCO announced $17 million investment to build new manufacturing facility Charleston, South Carolina (USA). The company localize the production of its advanced air disc brake (ADB) systems to meet increasing customer demand alongside transferring compressor production to the new facility. WABCO at MATS 2015 Booth 32805 the South Wing, Kentucky Exposition Center, Louisville, Kentucky, March 26-28, 2015 Meritor WABCO Ride-N-Drive OnGuard collision mitigation system and OnLane departure warning “Ride-N-Drive,” March 26-28, 2015. Interested parties may sign up for the demonstration at WABCO booth 32805. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . About Meritor WABCO Meritor WABCO is North American joint venture focused on the development and delivery of proven, integrated safety technology and efficiency components. These include braking systems and controls, active safety systems, and suspension and control systems for commercial vehicles North America. Two leading parent companies back Meritor WABCO, each with more than 100 year legacies. Meritor, Inc. (NYSE:MTOR), supplier of drivetrain, mobility, braking and aftermarket solutions for commercial vehicle and industrial markets, provides Meritor WABCO the industry’s most extensive service and support network; while WABCO Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:WBC), is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, pioneering breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, collision mitigation, stability control and transmission automation systems. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO INDIA Renews Commitment to Tata Motors’ T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 as Official Braking Technology Partner WABCO INDIA Renews Commitment to Tata Motors' T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 as Official Braking Technology Partner MUMBAI, India – January 20, 2015 – WABCO, leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that it has renewed its commitment to Tata Motors ' T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015. WABCO continue to serve as the official Braking Technology Partner to India's premier truck racing event, introduced 2014. Tata Motors host its second Championship truck racing event on March 15, 2015 at the Buddh International Formula 1 Circuit Greater Noida. Six racing teams compete the T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship showcasing twelve of Tata Motors' state-of-the-art PRIMA Model 4038.S trucks. WABCO provide all competing trucks with range of innovative products drawn from its portfolio of industry-leading safety and efficiency technologies, including WABCO's high-performance air management system and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) addition to high-output, modular compressor technology , advanced air actuation systems, Integrated Pedal Unit (IPU) and other braking components. "We are proud to again serve as the official Braking Technology Partner of Tata Motors' T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 and to build on our five-decade long partnership with India's market leader commercial vehicles," said Mr. P. Kaniappan, Vice President, WABCO INDIA. "We are excited to demonstrate the high performance of WABCO's advanced safety and efficiency technologies racing environment, which represents the most extreme operating conditions for heavy duty trucks." "Tata Motors welcomes WABCO's continued support of India's T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship as our official Braking Technology Partner," said Mr. Ravi Pisharody, Executive Director, Commercial Vehicles, Tata Motors Limited. "This collaboration strengthens our long-standing partnership with WABCO. We greatly value WABCO's contribution of advanced technologies that help to improve the safety, efficiency, and reliability of Tata trucks on the race track and on India's roads." WABCO the first company to introduce ABS to the global commercial vehicles industry with nearly 17 million systems sold worldwide to-date. ABS significantly improves the stability and steerability of commercial vehicles even the most extreme of braking conditions. WABCO ABS ensures balanced braking and reduces stopping distance of commercial vehicles, which is paramount safety factor both race and everyday traffic environments. In addition, WABCO's innovative high-output compressor technologies and air processing systems improve the efficiency of vehicles. Commitment to Outperformance and Superior Value for Shareowners Outlines Strategies for Growth Through Globalization and Technology Leadership BRUSSELS, Belgium, February 5, 2015 — WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, announced that it host its first Investor Day on Thursday, February 26, 2015, at the Grand Hyatt Hotel New York City. The event begin at 8:00 A.M. and conclude by 12:00 noon. The meeting feature presentations from WABCO’s top executives, including: Jacques Esculier , Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah , Chief Financial Officer Leon Liu , President of the Truck, Bus and Car Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) Division Nick Rens , President of the Trailer Systems, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division. “We are excited to host our first Investor Day as platform to demonstrate our continued commitment to sustain shareowner value,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “We continue to drive growth and outperformance the commercial vehicle industry through technology leadership, globalization, and excellence execution. WABCO’s unique ability to anticipate the industry’s globalization and diverse customer needs enables the Company to deliver differentiated products and services tailored to the specific requirements of emerging and mature markets alike.” WABCO’s consistently strong sales growth has outperformed global truck and bus production by average of approximately 8 percent per year over the past five years. Over the same period, the Company has generated shareholder returns that have consistently outperformed the S&P 500 and S&P 500 Auto Parts and Equipment Indices by average of approximately 200 percent. A Q&A session follow the formal presentations at WABCO’s Investor Day. Participants have the opportunity to see highlights from the Company’s advanced technology portfolio and learn more about its key market drivers and strategies for differentiation. A live webcast of WABCO’s Investor Day can be accessed via the investor relations section of the Company’s website at http://wabco.client.shareholder.com . Institute zeichnet WABCO „Top Arbeitgeber 2015 für Ingenieure“ exzellenten Arbeitsbedingungen AUBI-plus zertifiziert WABCO „Best Place to Learn“ für Ausbildungsstandards Nachrichtenmagazin Focus listet WABCO deutschen Arbeitgeber Automobilbereich HANNOVER, Deutschland, 12. Februar 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie, mehrfach deutschen Arbeitgeber 2015 ausgezeichnet worden. Das weltweit renommierte Zertifizierungsunternehmen Top Employers Institute verlieh WABCO Gütesiegel „Top Arbeitgeber 2015 für Ingenieure“ bestätigt exzellente Arbeitsbedingungen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. Darüber hinaus erhielt WABCO Zertifikat „Best Place to Learn 2015“ AUBI-plus für Ausbildungsstandards Ende Januar Ranking Nachrichtenmagazins Focus über 55 Arbeitgeber deutschen Automobilindustrie aufgenommen. „Wir freuen stolz, Arbeitgeber Deutschland anerkannt werden“, Wiebke Bohnsack, Arbeitsdirektorin Personalleiterin WABCO Deutschland. „Unsere Mitarbeiter tragen wesentlich Erfolg unseres Unternehmens bei. Darum bieten attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen globalen Umfeld fördern Kultur, Offenheit, Leistung Dienst Kunden geprägt ist. Die Auszeichnungen bestätigen uns, richtigen Weg sind.“ WABCO beschäftigt Deutschland Produktions- Entwicklungsstandorten Hannover, Gronau (Leine) Mannheim Vertriebszentrum Langenhagen insgesamt über 3.000 Mitarbeiter. Erst kürzlich Unternehmen Investition $27 Millionen (23 Millionen Euro) für Neubau Engineering Innovation Centers Standort Hannover stärkt langfristig Position Technologieführer top Arbeitgeber Deutschland. Seit nahezu 150 Jahren entwickelt produziert WABCO führende Technologien Steigerung Fahrzeugsicherheit -effizienz für Nutzfahrzeughersteller Flottenbetreiber Welt. Zu WABCOs Erfolgsgeschichte gehören wichtigsten Innovationen Branche beispielsweise Entwicklung Markteinführung Antiblockiersystems (ABS) , elektronischen Bremssystems (EBS) autonomen Notbremsassistenzsystems für Nutzfahrzeuge. diluted EPS of $1.10 on U.S. GAAP basis versus $6.65 year ago Full year 2014 diluted EPS of $5.52 on performance basis, up from $5.01 year ago; diluted EPS of $4.81 on U.S. GAAP basis versus $10.31 year ago Full year 2014, WABCO generated $314.4 million net cash from operating activities and $275.8 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 83 percent of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items, and previously disclosed one-time item Q3 2014 associated with expiration of the accounts receivable securitization program Provides guidance for full year 2015 sales growth to range from 6 to 11 percent local currencies, full year 2015 diluted EPS on performance basis to range from $5.80 to $6.30 and full year 2015 diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to range from $5.09 to $5.59 BRUSSELS, Belgium, February 13, 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today reported Q4 and full year 2014 results. WABCO reported Q4 2014 sales of $679.1 million, up 1.6 percent local currencies from year ago and down 5.7 percent U.S. dollars, of which 2.9 percent comes from the Q4 2014 consolidated results local currencies of Transics International , WABCO’s newly acquired subsidiary. WABCO reported Q4 2014 performance operating income of $88.6 million, up from $86.5 million year ago, and operating income $68.7 million on U.S. GAAP basis versus $76.8 million year ago. WABCO’s performance operating margin for Q4 2014 13.0 percent, up from 12.0 percent year ago, and operating margin 10.1 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 10.7 percent year ago. For Q4 2014, WABCO reported performance net income attributable to the company of $81.6 million or $1.38 per diluted share, up from $80.6 million or $1.29 per diluted share year ago, and Q4 2014 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $65.1 million or $1.10 per diluted share versus $416.3 million or $6.65 per diluted share year ago primarily due to previously disclosed one-time gain of $279.5 million Q4 2013 when the European Commission reimbursed WABCO as result of the company’s successful appeal of fine on former entities of American Standard Companies. Full Year 2014 For full year 2014, WABCO reported sales of $2,851.0 million, up 6.0 percent local currencies from year ago and up 4.8 percent U.S. dollars, of which 2.4 percent comes from the 2014 consolidated results local currencies of Transics International, which WABCO acquired February 2014. “Q4 2014 sales increased by 1.6 percent local currencies, despite significant market decline of 18 percent Europe, where year ago market demand surged due to the anticipated pre-buy ahead of Euro VI emission standards that came into effect January 2014 Europe, our largest market,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “Indeed, Q4 2014 sales further contributed to WABCO’s full-year revenues growth global market that remains volatile and uncertain,” said Esculier. “For full year 2014, we grew our revenues by 6.0 percent local currencies, and we once again solidly outperformed every region, despite overall decline of 2 percent global truck and bus production. Throughout 2014, we continued to increase levels of WABCO content per vehicle,” said Esculier. “For full year 2014, we grew global aftermarket sales by 12.7 percent, setting new record for annual aftermarket revenues on currency adjusted basis,” said Esculier. “WABCO’s record aftermarket percentage growth reflects our acquisition February 2014 of Transics International, leading provider of fleet management solutions, which further supports WABCO strategic objective to expand business relationships with fleets around the world.” WABCO reported full year 2014 performance operating income of $371.4 million, up from $355.4 million year ago, and operating income $331.0 million on U.S. GAAP basis versus $331.9 million year ago. WABCO’s full year 2014 performance operating margin 13.0 percent versus 13.1 percent year ago, and operating margin 11.6 percent on U.S. GAAP basis versus 12.2 percent year ago. WABCO reported full year 2014 performance net income attributable to the company of $334.0 million or $5.52 per diluted share, up from $317.4 million or $5.01 per diluted share year ago, and full year 2014 U.S. GAAP net income attributable to the company of $291.5 million or $4.81 per diluted share versus $653.2 million or $10.31 per diluted share year ago primarily due to previously disclosed one-time gain of $279.5 million Q4 2013 when the European Commission reimbursed WABCO as result of the company’s successful appeal of fine on former entities of American Standard Companies. “Throughout 2014, we continued to demonstrate the agility and adaptability of WABCO’s Operating System, our globally standardized management and manufacturing environment,” said Esculier. “Due to our early anticipation of market slowdown the second half of 2014 versus the first half, we accelerated operational flexibility, adjusting direct labor production facilities, reducing indirect labor and costs, and leveraging leaner support functions across our global footprint. This timely implementation of WABCO’s countermeasures delivered $12 million of savings operating expenses.” “For full year 2014, we continued to demonstrate our ability to transform top-line growth into robust bottom-line results,” said Esculier. “WABCO delivered healthy incremental operating margin of 15 percent, excluding year on year currency transactional effects, which is still well within our financial operating framework.” Incremental operating margin refers to the ratio of increase performance operating income 2014 and WABCO’s growth sales. “During 2014, WABCO’s Operating System continued to enable fast, flexible responses to volatile market changes, while at the same time propelling robust productivity gains,” said Esculier. “It delivered $76.5 million of materials and conversion productivity, while continuing to contain price erosion. It generated materials productivity of 5.4 percent and delivered new annual record conversion productivity of 6.4 percent.” During full year 2014, WABCO generated $314.4 million net cash from operating activities and $275.8 million of free cash flow, resulting conversion rate of 83 percent of performance net income attributable to the company. Free cash flow excludes payments for streamlining, separation and acquisition items, and previously disclosed one-time item Q3 2014 associated with expiration of the accounts receivable securitization program. Since June 2011, WABCO has repurchased 13,578,361 shares for $971.8 million open market transactions as of December 31, 2014. WABCO is further authorized to repurchase up to $500 million of additional shares through December 31, 2016. “Throughout 2014, we continued to further differentiate WABCO through solid market outperformance, healthy incremental operating margin, free cash flow conversion rate of 83 percent, and allocation of capital that is shareowner friendly,” said Esculier. “For full year 2014, WABCO delivered earnings of $5.52 per share on performance basis, up 10 percent versus year ago, marking new annual record as we demonstrate once again how WABCO continues to deliver outstanding value for our shareowners.” Recent Highlights Recently, WABCO became the first supplier of advanced emergency braking systems (AEBS) homologated Europe accordance with European Union regulations. WABCO’s OnGuardPLUS™ AEBS technology is currently available on new trucks produced by major commercial vehicle manufacturer based Europe. In accordance with EU legislation, newly registered medium- and heavy-duty trucks as well as buses must be equipped with AEBS from November 2015 onward. OnGuardPLUS detects moving, decelerating and stationary vehicles ahead; it alerts the truck or bus driver; it autonomously applies the brakes, and it can bring the vehicle to complete stop, helping to prevent or mitigate rear-end collisions. In January 2015, WABCO disclosed that its fleet management business, Transics International, has entered into new agreement with ASKO NorgesGruppen , Norway’s largest grocery company. Transics supply ASKO’s entire commercial vehicle fleet with its industry-leading fleet management solutions (FMS) . The customer’s fleet of 700 combined trucks and trailers be equipped with advanced FMS, including on-board computers, mobile technologies and back-office software. Through this new business contract, Transics help ASKO to further enhance its fleet’s safety performance and operational efficiency. For full year 2014, WABCO increased penetration of advanced vehicle safety and efficiency technologies North America. For example, 2014, sales of WABCO’s automated manual transmission (AMT) technologies increased by 110 percent as major global truck makers increased their adoption of AMT systems. Sales of WABCO’s OnGuard™ collision mitigation system (CMS), the first with active braking North America, increased by 49 percent as WABCO continued to expand its CMS market leadership through further adoption of OnGuard among major commercial vehicle makers and national fleets. WABCO North America further enhanced its engineering and new product development capability for local applications at new center Rochester Hills near Detroit, Michigan. Recently, WABCO India announced that it has renewed its commitment to the Tata Motors T1 PRIMA Truck-Racing Championship for the second year row. During 2015, WABCO continue to serve as Official Braking Technology Partner to India’s premier truck-racing event, which showcases 12 of Tata’s state-of-the-art PRIMA model trucks. WABCO provide all competing trucks with range of innovative products from its portfolio of industry-leading safety and efficiency technologies, including WABCO’s high-performance air management system and anti-lock braking system (ABS) . WABCO supply high-output, modular compressor technology; advanced air actuation systems, integrated pedal units , and other braking components. Introduced 2014, Tata Motors’ T1 PRIMA Truck-Racing represents extreme operating conditions for heavy-duty trucks. Recently, WABCO announced that it has supplied advanced, high-performance safety and efficiency technologies to KAMAZ-master , the winning truck-racing team of the 2015 Dakar Rally . KAMAZ-master heavy-duty truck teams crossed the finish line first, second and third place. Their 2015 championship marks the thirteenth time that KAMAZ-master has won the Dakar Rally. Supplying KAMAZ-master with technologies since 1997, WABCO equipped KAMAZ’s 2015 heavy-duty trucks with high-performance air compressors , wheel-end solutions and WABCO Tristop™ Actuators , one of the industry’s most reliable piston-type spring-brake cylinders. The 2015 Dakar Rally ran two weeks through Argentina, Bolivia and Chile amid the most challenging terrain on Earth. As of Q4 2014, WABCO China has been far recognized by 8 different major customers with total of 17 awards. These prestigious awards associated with WABCO’s performance China during 2014 cover superlative achievements such as supplier excellence, best manufacturing quality, technology innovation, service excellence and stellar on-site support. Leading original equipment and vehicle manufacturers granting these awards include Beiben Trucks Group, Beijing Foton Cummins Engine Company, Beiqi Foton Motor, China National Heavy Duty Truck, Dongfeng Liuzhou Motor, Foton AUV Bus, Shanghai General Motors and Shenzhen BYD Automotive. In addition, WABCO China has won several awards from leading industry publications as well as the China Association of Remanufacturing. Full Year 2015 Guidance Based on our current estimates of future market conditions, WABCO expects full year 2015 sales growth to range from 6 to 11 percent local currencies; performance operating margin to range from 14.2 to 15.1 percent; and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to range from 13.2 to 14.1 percent, resulting diluted EPS on performance basis to range from $5.80 to $6.30 and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to range from $5.09 to $5.59. WABCO expects 2015 to convert between 80 and 90 percent of its performance net income attributable to the company into free cash flow, excluding payments associated with items for streamlining, separation and acquisition. “During 2014, WABCO’s differentiation continued to yield solid results as we further extended our leadership position as preferred supplier the global commercial vehicle industry through our three-pillar strategy of technology leadership, globalization and excellence execution,” said Esculier. “Entering 2015, we remain committed to further anticipate market conditions and respond quickly and efficiently to sudden changes customer demand, while still continually bringing innovative, cost-effective, value-based solutions to vehicle makers and fleet operators every region of the world,” said Esculier. “Our continued ability to outperform the market globally – together with further initiatives to drive productivity – strongly sustains confidence our ability to continue to deliver outstanding value for WABCO’s shareowners.” Conference Call Jacques Esculier, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, Chief Financial Officer, discuss WABCO’s results and outlook on conference call at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time today. It be webcast at www.wabco-auto.com where the press release and financial information be available under “WABCO Q4 and Full Year 2014 Results.” The call is accessible by telephone listen only mode. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Demonstrates Continued Commitment to Outperformance and Superior Shareowner Value at Its First Investor Day Reiterates Outperformance Target of 8 to 10 Percent Outlines Strategies to Sustain Growth Through Technology Leadership, Globalization and Excellence Execution BRUSSELS, Belgium, February 26, 2015 — WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, host its first Investor Day today at the Grand Hyatt Hotel New York City, NY (USA). The meeting feature presentations from WABCO’s top executives, including Jacques Esculier, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer; Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, Chief Financial Officer; Leon Liu, President of the Truck, Bus and Car Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) Division, and Nick Rens, President of the Trailer Systems, Aftermarket and Off-Highway Division. Outlining the company’s strategies for differentiation, WABCO’s senior management highlight the company’s robust framework to deliver superior value for shareowners: Outperformance: Relative to global truck and bus production, WABCO stays committed to outperform the commercial vehicle market by 8 to 10 percent over five-year period. The company anticipates increasing the value of WABCO content on trucks, buses and trailers mature and emerging markets alike. Incremental margin: WABCO intends to maintain attractive incremental operating margin derived from growth. Incremental operating margin refers to the ratio of increase performance operating income relative to WABCO’s growth sales. Cash flow conversion: WABCO stays committed to converting between 80 and 90 percent of its performance net income into free cash flow. The company has returned approximately $1 billion to shareowners from 2011 to 2014. WABCO sets goal of returning more than $800 million of cash to shareowners through 2017. “We are excited to welcome investors and analysts to our first Investor Day as we demonstrate our differentiating strategies for growth,” said Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. “We continue to drive outperformance the commercial vehicle industry through technology leadership, globalization, and excellence execution. WABCO’s unique ability to anticipate global market developments, industry trends and diverse customer needs enables the company to deliver differentiated products and services to leading commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators worldwide.” Technology Leadership and Innovation WABCO demonstrate to investors and analysts its continued differentiation through sustained technology innovation. For example, 2014 WABCO pioneered its breakthrough modular braking system platform (mBSP™). It features the highest degree of standardization the industry across both components and system software for anti-lock braking (ABS) and electronic braking (EBS) systems . Thereby, the company enables global truck and bus manufacturers to efficiently tailor their vehicle platforms to regional or regulatory requirements by interchangeably equipping them with either ABS or EBS. In addition, WABCO showcase number of technologies associated with its industry-leading portfolio of advanced driver assistance systems, including OnGuardPLUS™ . WABCO’s OnGuardPLUS detects moving, decelerating and stationary vehicles ahead. It alerts the driver via acoustic, visual and haptic signals. OnGuardPLUS autonomously applies the brakes and can bring the vehicle to complete stop, helping to prevent or mitigate rear-end collisions. Globalization WABCO serves every leading manufacturer of trucks, buses and trailers every region of the world. The company anticipates progressive adoption of advanced safety and efficiency technologies common Europe other markets around the globe. WABCO’s applicable market Europe is currently valued at approximately $3,000 per vehicle. The content per vehicle other global growth markets such as India, China, the U.S., and Brazil ranges from estimated $300 to $1,500. WABCO projects closing of this content per vehicle gap present the company with rich reservoir of organic growth. Design to Cost WABCO highlight the company’s innovative “Design to Cost” and “Redesign to Cost” programs. These initiatives adapt WABCO’s industry-leading technology portfolio to meet vehicle manufacturers’ and fleet operators’ needs for cost-competitiveness every region of the world. WABCO combines its advanced technology expertise Europe with frugal engineering capabilities India to create new safety and efficiency systems and optimize existing technologies to better serve markets worldwide. Guidance for 2015 Based on its current market outlook, the company expects full year 2015 sales growth to range from 6 to 11 percent local currencies; performance operating margin to range from 14.2 to 15.1 percent; and operating margin on U.S. GAAP basis to range from 13.2 to 14.1 percent, resulting diluted EPS on performance basis to range from $5.80 to $6.30 and diluted EPS on U.S. GAAP basis to range from $5.09 to $5.59. Webcast A live webcast of WABCO’s Investor Day be broadcast simultaneously on the investor relations page of the company’s website at http://wabco.client.shareholder.com/ . The webcast begin at 8:45 A.M. EST and conclude by 12:00 P.M. EST. A replay be available at the same site following the event. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Demonstrates Advanced Safety Technologies at Tata Motors' T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 Official Braking Technology Partner at India’s Premier Truck Racing Event Helps Improve Safety for Trucks and Drivers Extreme Racing Environment and on India’s Roads Industry Leader with nearly 17 Million Anti-Lock Braking Systems (ABS) Sold Worldwide NEW DELHI, India – March 14, 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, demonstrate its advanced safety technologies at Tata Motors’ T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 as the official Braking Technology Partner. Tata Motors host second season of India’s premier truck racing event on March 15, 2015 at the Buddh International Formula 1 Circuit Greater Noida. Six racing teams compete the T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship showcasing twelve of Tata Motors’ state-of-the-art PRIMA Model 4038.S trucks. This second year Championship features race trucks that are lighter, accelerate faster and reach higher top speed of 130 kilometers per hour (over 80 miles per hour) compared to last year’s event. WABCO provide all competing trucks with range of innovative products drawn from its portfolio of industry-leading safety and efficiency technologies, including WABCO’s Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) and high-performance air management system. Additionally, the trucks feature high-output, modular compressor technology, advanced air actuation systems, Integrated Pedal Unit (IPU) and other braking components. These technologies help improve the safety of trucks, drivers, and motorsport enthusiasts at the race event. WABCO provides host of additional industry-leading technologies to Tata Motors’ trucks and buses on sale India and other markets. Advanced technologies include electronic braking systems (EBS) with electronic stability control (ESCSmart TM ), electronically controlled air suspension (OptiRide TM ), and automated manual transmission (OptiDrive TM ). WABCO’s technologies are widely recognized by commercial vehicle manufacturers and fleet operators for their ability to help improve driver effectiveness and road safety. “We are excited to demonstrate the high performance of WABCO’s advanced safety and efficiency technologies racing environment, which represents the most extreme operating conditions for heavy duty trucks,” said Mr. Jacques Esculier, WABCO Chairman and Chief Executive Officer . “WABCO is proud that our technologies offer safety and efficiency benefits for millions of vehicle operators on India’s roads every day.” “We are pleased to welcome WABCO back as the Championship’s Braking Technology Partner for this second year event. Tata Motors appreciates WABCO’s ongoing commitment to pioneer safety and efficiency technologies for commercial vehicles here India and worldwide,” said Mr. Ravi Pisharody, Executive Director, Commercial Vehicles, Tata Motors Limited . “We greatly value WABCO’s contribution of advanced technologies that help Tata trucks and buses to be safer and more efficient on the road.” WABCO the first company to introduce ABS to the global commercial vehicles industry, with nearly 17 million systems sold worldwide to-date. ABS significantly improves the stability and steerability of commercial vehicles even the most extreme of braking conditions. WABCO ABS ensures balanced braking and reduces vehicle stopping distances, which is paramount safety factor both race and everyday traffic environments. Press Photo / Caption: WABCO continues its participation Tata Motors’ T1 PRIMA Truck Racing Championship 2015 as official Braking Technology Partner. The championship features Season 2 race trucks that are lighter, accelerate faster and reach higher top speed than before. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading innovator and global supplier of technologies that improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough products and systems for braking, stability, suspension, transmission automation, and aerodynamics. Today, all of the world’s leading truck, bus and trailer manufacturers have WABCO technologies onboard. In addition, WABCO provides the industry with advanced fleet management solutions and aftermarket services. WABCO reported sales of $2.9 billion 2014. The company is headquartered Brussels, Belgium, and has 11,000 employees worldwide. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com . About WABCO India: WABCO India designs, manufactures and markets conventional braking products, advanced braking systems, and other related air assisted products and systems. The company has achieved major market share the Indian OEM market as well as the domestic aftermarket, which serves through strong & wide national distribution network. With five world class manufacturing facilities, software design center, application engineering center and test track India, WABCO India excels engineering and manufacturing. WABCO India employs over 3,200 employees and reported Rs.1138 Crores sales 2013-14. For more information, visit www.wabco-auto.com/en/wabcoindia/home . Modernste Flottenmanagementlösungen sorgen für Sicherheit Effizienz Transics stattet norwegische ASKO Flotte aus; Modernste Flottenmanagementlösungen sorgen für Sicherheit Effizienz BRÜSSEL, Belgien – 15. Januar 2015 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), führender Technologielieferant für weltweite Nutzfahrzeugindustrie, kündigte an, Flottenmanagementbereich Transics International kommerzielle Flotte norwegischen ASKO NorgesGruppen branchenweit führenden Flottenmanagementlösungen ausrüsten wird. Transics beliefert 700 Lkw Auflieger umfassende Flotte ASKO führenden Flottenmanagementlösungen, Bordcomputer, mobile Technologien Backoffice-Software. So unterstützt Transics größte Lebensmittelunternehmen Norwegens dabei, Sicherheit Effizienz Flotte steigern. Mitte 2015 Transics firmeneigene ASKO Flotte fest installierten TX-SKY -Bordcomputern aufrüsten mobile Applikationen für Smartphones selbstständigen Transportunternehmer liefern ASKO zusammenarbeitet. Die Backoffice-Software TX-CONNECT Transics integriert Echtzeitdaten fixen, mobilen kombinierten Lösungen einzige Instrumententafel. Darüber hinaus Transics TX-TRAILERGUARD ™, Telematiklösung Generation für effizientes Lkw-, Auflieger- Frachtmanagement, installieren. Transics aus, Projekt Ende 2016 abgeschlossen wird. Vorgestellt September 2014, TX-TRAILERGUARD integrierte Produkt Übernahme Flottenmanagementsystemanbieters Transics, Marktführers Europa, WABCO Februar 2014. Die innovative Telematiklösung integriert umfassenden Echtzeitdaten fortschrittlichen Bremssysteme, Stabilitätsregelung effizienzsteigernden Systeme WABCO Transics Backoffice-Software TX-CONNECT verbundenen Telematiksysteme. „Dank strategischen Übernahme Transics WABCO können Kunden leistungsstarken Synergien Flottenmanagementlösungen Transics WABCOs Erfahrung Nutzfahrzeugbereich führenden Sicherheits- Effizienztechnologie globalen Reichweite maximal profitieren," erklärte Nick Rens, WABCO President, Division Trailer Systems, Aftermarket & Off-Highway. „Wir freuen uns, differenzierende Flottenmanagementlösungen ASKO liefern Flotteneffizienz größten Lebensmittelhändlers Norwegens optimieren können." „Durch Flottenmanagementlösungen Transics ASKO gesamte Flotte Echtzeit überwachen können", erklärte Svein Sollie, Transport-Direktor, ASKO. „Die modernen Systeme Technologien Transics schaffen direkte Verbindung unseren Lkw, Aufliegern, Fracht Bürofunktionen. Wir gewinnen wichtige Erkenntnisse, Sicherheit betriebliche Effizienz Flotte steigern können." Die Flottenmanagementlösungen Transics liefern wertvolle Informationen über Standort, Streckeneinhaltung, Lieferzeit, Kraftstoffverbrauch Emissionen, Lenk- Ruhezeiten, Achslast, Reifendruck Frachttemperatur. So können betriebliche Entscheidungen unterstützt werden. Darüber hinaus lassen Transics Systeme nahtlos übergreifenden Streckenplanungssoftware ORTEC, ASKO arbeitet, integrieren, wodurch Lieferkette ASKO optimiert kann. Pressefoto / Bildunterschrift: Transics gesamte kommerzielle Flotte ASKO – 700 Lkw Auflieger – modernen Flottenmanagementlösungen ausstatten trägt größeren Sicherheit Effizienz Flotte bei. Über WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) weltweit führender Anbieter Technologien Kontrollsystemen für Sicherheit Effizienz Nutzfahrzeugen. WABCO fast 150 Jahren gegründet leistet weiterhin Pionierarbeit elektronischen, mechanischen mechatronischen Technologien für Brems-, Stabilitäts- automatisierte Übertragungssysteme, weltweit führenden Konstrukteure Nutzfahrzeugen (LKW, Busse Auflieger) geliefert werden. WABCO erzielte 2013 Umsatz 2,7 Milliarden Dollar Hauptsitz Brüssel, Belgien. Nähere Informationen finden Sie www.wabco-auto.com . Racing Team Defends Championship Title at Dakar Rally 2015 Supported by WABCO's High-Performance Safety Technologies BRUSSELS, Belgium – January 19, 2015 – WABCO, leading global supplier of technologies to improve the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles, today announced that it has supplied number of advanced, high-performance safety and efficiency technologies to the winning truck racing team of the Dakar 2015 rally , KAMAZ-master . KAMAZ-master race trucks crossed the finish line first, second, and third place. The KAMAZ-master team has won the Dakar rally thirteen times to-date. WABCO has been supplying KAMAZ-master with pioneering safety technologies since 1997. For Dakar 2015, the Company provided KAMAZ-master team's heavy duty trucks with high-performance air compressors , wheel-end solutions, coupling controls and WABCO Tristop™ Actuaters , one of the industry's most reliable piston-type spring brake cylinders. "The Dakar Rally represents two grueling weeks the most challenging terrain on Earth. It is the ultimate test for trucks and teams alike." said Vladimir Chagin, director of NP KAMAZ-Avtosport, leader of KAMAZ-master team. "We appreciate WABCO's continued support of the KAMAZ-master truck racing team and its advanced safety technologies" Dakar 2015 concluded on Saturday, January 17 Argentina's capital of Buenos Aires. It the rally's seventh consecutive year to be held South America. The route covered 9,000 kilometers (5,592 miles) Argentina, Bolivia and Chile crossing the Andes Mountains and racing the Salar de Uyuni, the world's largest salt lake before venturing the Atacama Desert, commonly known as the driest place on Earth. In total, 63 racing trucks representing twelve different commercial vehicle brands competed the Dakar 2015 rally. KAMAZ-master sent four trucks to successfully defend its title. For more information visit the KAMAZ-master website at www.kamazmaster.ru/en or watch the team's video here on YouTube .
