WABCO began supplying KAMAZ 1992 and currently provides electronic braking systems with integrated electronic stability control, anti-lock braking systems, air disc brakes, electronically controlled air suspension, as well as components for braking and driveline controls. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. Founded nearly 150 years ago, WABCO continues to pioneer breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, bus and trailer manufacturers. With sales of $2.7 billion 2013, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. X Elektronische Stabilitätskontrolle (ESC) Verbesserte Fahrzeugsicherheit ESC WABCO ESC erhöht Fahrzeugsicherheit, automatisch eingreift, sobald Fahrzeug instabil wird. WABCO ESC verbessert Richtungsstabilität, speziell dynamischen Manövern erhöht Schutz Fahrzeugs Schleudern, Drehen Einknicken. Eine häufigsten Ursachen für Ladungsschäden stellt Umkippen Fahrzeuges dar. Deshalb WABCO Integrated Roll Stability Control (RSC) entwickelt. Unser RSC-System greift automatisch ein, Fahrzeug instabil steuert aktiv Motor Bremsen, Geschwindigkeit vermindern Umkippen verhindern. WABCO bietet Kunden außerdem Möglichkeit ESC ESCsmart™ aufzurüsten - WABCO-Lösung für schnelle Fahrzeugabnahme Effizienz Fließbandende. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Obtains Approval EU for ESCsmart, Breakthrough Technology WABCO Obtains Approval EU for ESCsmart, Breakthrough Technology and Industry’s Most Efficient Method to Certify Electronic Stability Control for Trucks and Buses BRUSSELS, Belgium, July 15, 2009 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, today announced that WABCO’s ESCsmart™ system has been certified by TÜV Nord Germany, accredited technical service, which leads to the approval by the German Federal Authority for Road Transport. As result, WABCO’s ESCsmart system is now approved for use all 27 countries the European Union and 20 other countries worldwide where electronic stability control (ESC) for commercial vehicles is applied accordance with the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe’s Regulation 13 for braking. WABCO’s new ESCsmart system is the global commercial vehicle industry’s first technology that uses computational simulation to homologate electronic stability control systems for trucks and buses. It avoids the traditional approach to ESC homologation which requires original equipment manufacturers to physically test all variants of vehicles. It substantially increases flexibility and saves significant time and labor for truck and bus makers. As recently reported, the EU has approved mandate that sets better standards to improve road safety Europe, including the EU’s new regulation to introduce ESC systems as compulsory on new heavy commercial vehicles from November 2011. Currently, less than 10 percent of the total number of heavy duty trucks produced Europe are equipped with electronic stability control. “An outstanding achievement, WABCO’s new ESCsmart system enables original equipment manufacturers and vehicle body builders to design and sell unique vehicle configurations despite their lack of pre-existing ESC parameter settings,” said Jean-Christophe Figueroa, WABCO Vice President, Vehicle Dynamics and Control. “With ESCsmart technology, commercial vehicle makers can respond faster to market needs by introducing new vehicle types within significantly shorter development phases. Drawing on our technology leadership, we help customers Europe and worldwide to optimize their total cost and effort of adopting electronic stability control.” WABCO pioneered ESC for commercial vehicles 2001 and has continued to innovate this safety technology ever since. ESC improves directional stability and helps protect against roll-over, skidding, spinning and jack-knifing. WABCO has sold more than 50,000 ESC systems since its introduction. About WABCO WABCO Vehicle Control Systems (NYSE: WBC) is leading supplier of safety and control systems for commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability, and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer, and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.6 billion 2008, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium. Messe Image Gallery Videos Pressemitteilung WABCO Marks Another Industry First for Advanced Safety Technology China as Part of Contract with Yutong, World’s Largest Manufacturer of Buses WABCO Marks Another Industry First for Advanced Safety Technology China as Part of Contract with Yutong, World’s Largest Manufacturer of Buses BRUSSELS, Belgium, November 29, 2011 – WABCO Holdings Inc. (NYSE: WBC), global technology leader and tier-one supplier to the commercial vehicle industry, supply its Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) to Yutong China, the world’s largest manufacturer of buses, as part of expanded long-term agreement to furnish advanced safety technologies. It marks the first adoption of ACC technology on commercial vehicle the Chinese market. Series production start the first quarter of 2012 with WABCO ACC as standard feature on Yutong’s range of high-end buses, which includes luxury, intercity, urban, light and hybrid electric buses. Yutong buses are service 27 countries. WABCO’s ACC automatically adjusts the vehicle’s speed to maintain preset distance to the moving vehicle ahead. It reacts with acoustic and visual warning, engine control and, if necessary, partial braking. It improves vehicle safety as well as driver effectiveness and comfort. WABCO continue long-term to supply Yutong with electronic stability control (ESC) and electronic braking systems (EBS) as standard features for series production on Yutong’s range of high-end buses. “We greatly value WABCO’s technology portfolio as it strongly supports our “Super Safety” program comprising ACC, ESC and EBS as standard features on high-end Yutong buses,” said Tang Wang, Deputy Director of Technology, Yutong Bus Company. “We are proud to be the first bus maker China to equip vehicles with ACC, and as result, the safety controls on our premier products are the most advanced the Chinese market.” “We continue to pioneer new technologies for advanced safety and driver effectiveness as demonstrated by Yutong’s choice of WABCO’s ACC to further strengthen their leading position the bus market China and internationally,” said Leon Liu, WABCO President, Asia. “Commercial vehicle manufacturers China are increasingly attributing further value to vehicle and road safety, and as result, they are growing their adoption of highly advanced technologies. This trend is driver for increasing WABCO content per vehicle through specially developed, locally adapted systems and products.” WABCO pioneered ESC for commercial vehicles 2001 and has continued to innovate this safety technology ever since. ESC improves directional stability and helps protect against roll-over, skidding and spinning as well as jack-knifing tractor-trailer combinations. WABCO has sold more than 100,000 ESC systems since its introduction. WABCO introduced EBS for heavy duty commercial vehicles 1996 and has maintained its global leadership for this safety technology. EBS shortens the braking distance, enables stable steering throughout the braking procedure and improves driver effectiveness and comfort. It improves brake wear, thus reducing maintenance cost. In addition, WABCO currently supplies Yutong with electronically controlled air suspension (ECAS) , braking products and anti-lock braking systems (ABS) . As the inventor of ABS for commercial vehicles, WABCO first to introduce ABS China. WABCO is currently China’s major ABS supplier for trucks and buses. About WABCO WABCO (NYSE: WBC) is leading global supplier of technologies and control systems for the safety and efficiency of commercial vehicles. For over 140 years, WABCO has pioneered breakthrough electronic, mechanical and mechatronic technologies for braking, stability and transmission automation systems supplied to the world’s leading commercial truck, trailer and bus manufacturers. With sales of $2.2 billion 2010, WABCO is headquartered Brussels, Belgium.
